review.reviewText: Very well positioned for getting around. Rooms have been done up so for an older hotel quite comfortable.
review.positiveRemarks: Good value for money in San Francisco terms
review.negativeRemarks: Maybe just a little more thought in amenities. Maybe just a little attention to detail.
review.locationRemarks: close to busses cable cars and trolley buses so for tourist recommended

review.title: Excellent location to Union Square.
review.reviewText: Although our room was small it was perfectly adequate for our needs as we were out exploring the city and surrounding area every day.  The room was clean and bed very comfortable. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful.The location of the hotel was ideal as it is very close to the train station, cable cars and buses. A great range of eateries in the immediate area. We would have no hesitation in recommending this accommodation to others.
review.negativeRemarks: Nil
review.locationRemarks: As mentioned under experience.

review.title: Needs update
review.reviewText: The hotel was nice but it is in need of an update. The theme is outdated and should would be nicer if they didn't try and play/decorate based on the name. The area around the hotel is pretty dirty but that's not the hotels fault. It is close to everything so you never need your car.

review.title: Nice hotel in a great location near Union Square
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed for 4 nights at the King George Hotel and our experience was a pleasant one. The hotel is in a great location, just a block from Union Square and close to all public transport. The room was clean, the staff were friendly and the hotel was nice and quiet. There is only one elevator, which can be slow at times but it is still workable. The only downside was the wifi connection. We were on the 9th floor of the hotel, which is the top floor, so not sure if that affected the quality of our connection.
review.negativeRemarks: The wifi connection was terrible, almost to the point of being unusable.

review.reviewText: The King George is in a great location.  The staff are friendly and very helpful. I plan on staying at the King George again.

review.title: Good hotel central to downtown San Fran
review.reviewText:
Very comfortable hotel with spacious rooms, plenty of storage space and all the usual facilities.
Nothing was too much trouble for staff to provide and there's a nifty tablet to use to order extra pillows, iron, coffee or room service - very silicon valleyesque
review.positiveRemarks: Central location one block from Union Square.
review.negativeRemarks: No air-con was present, although room had a fan to help keep everything cool.

review.title: Nice hotel central to San Fran.
review.reviewText: Lovely comfortable bed, quiet room, on a higher floor at rear of building.
review.positiveRemarks: Excellent location, everything within walking distance. Concierge very helpful!
review.negativeRemarks: Internet terrible, especially in the heart of San Fran. Lift service can be updated. Maid service could be improved, with making of bed.

review.reviewText: We were very pleased with our stay at the King George Hotel.  The location is fantastic - 1 block away from Union Square and Cable Cars, and BART line very close by.  Our room with single queen bed was a bit small and the bathroom was tiny, but everything was very clean, comfortable and in excellent condition.  The tablet included with the room was very handy, and we appreciated the outlets on each bedside table for charging electronics.  There was a loss of wifi for just over a day during our stay, which was a little inconvenient but not the end of the world.  Every staff member encountered was courteous and helpful.  And did I mention that the location is fantastic?

review.title: Nice themed hotel.
review.reviewText: It was a great time to be had there was HBO and other great tv stations water pressure was good and room service was quick and easy.

review.title: Extended weekend getaway
review.reviewText: This hotel was about what I expected.  Close to everything that we needed.  We walked to and from AT&T Park twice, about a mile and a half each way.  Plenty of places to eat or catch a nightcap within a block.  The hotel was a nice change from the corporate hotels that we usually stay.  My only real knock is that the hotel bar be more consistent with their hours.  Upon checking in we were told it stayed open until 10:00. Saturday after a day of wine county, we wanted to just stay in and relax.  Got down to the bar and the young man, who was quite pleasant told us that he was closing up and this was a little before 8.  All of the bars and restaurants in that area are very busy and loud and to just be able to hang out without going out.  He did let us order one drink...it must have been the puppy dog faces we gave him!
review.positiveRemarks: The people were all very nice.  Very helpful when asked about how to get to places and had lots of suggestions for places to eat.  very convienient.
review.negativeRemarks: Improve the bar hours and maybe even serve some appetizers.  A small breakfast would be nice but not needed as their are 3 diners within 30 seconds.
review.locationRemarks: many restaurants and bars very close and around the corner are some very nice art galleries.   Public transportation station 2 blocks away.

review.title: Very good location, our room was noisy on t
review.reviewText: Great location , we had a noisy room on the street side, everything else was good
review.negativeRemarks: Light breakfast would be good
review.locationRemarks: Everything handy

managementResponses.response:
Thank you so much for your kind words! I will certainly pass on the compliments to the Chef at Caf√© Mason. Hope to welcome you back soon!
Cheers, Candice 
General Manager

review.title: Downtown was really nice at night.
review.reviewText: Great food at mason cafe, great sleep, great time.
review.negativeRemarks: Bigger tv
review.locationRemarks: Depends on why you are there

review.title: Nice stay!
review.reviewText:
For the central location and cleanliness of the room given how expensive it is for SF during summer and limited time required in the hotel, we will definitely return. Say this also for my friend staying in another room.

There's basically no storage room for suitcase. For a 2-4 nights in SF with small luggage, it was comfy for me. Very clean bathroom. Bed sheet could be/look newer. 

We didn't rent a car so not sure about parking. Lift could be slow but fine with me.

Very nice front desk staff. Neat room.
review.locationRemarks: 2-3 blocks away from Powell station, which can take you straight to airport.

review.title: great downtown location.
review.reviewText: Read in a previous review about the fact that some homeless people are around. This is a fact for most locations in san fran. and the king george location was no worse than any. going to be back in san fran april 2017 and will inquire at the "george" for sure.
review.positiveRemarks: Rooms are smaller, but definitely clean and updated. Price was good for a downtown location. Bike rental very close to hotel also.

review.reviewText: Good service. My room was close to the ventilation system installation and it was a little noisy but they provide ears plugs freely.
review.locationRemarks: Close to the Commercial District and China Town, 45 minutes of walk from the Fisherman's Wharf.

review.title: Charming hotel
review.reviewText:
Awesome location, especially for first time visitors to San Francisco. The hotel is filled with old world charm, including the lift! 
Staff were wonderful as was the luxurious bed. Would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Nice location, close to everything
review.reviewText:
It was a good experience, nice clean hotel, friendly service.
The only problem was the internet connection, it was not working most of the time.
Nice bar, small elevator, great staff.

review.title: Nice and convenient
review.reviewText: Good central location. The hotel staff was very nice and helpful, especially Ming(?) and Abdull(?).  It could have been even better if they could use the lounge for a continental breakfast. But overall very enjoyable!

review.title: Great location. Just a couple of blocks from Union
review.reviewText: Hotel is characterful and well situated for Union Square and transport links. Nice staff and good value

review.title: Lovely hotel, area surrounding not great
review.reviewText:
Lovely hotel, friendly and helpful staff 
Loved the tablets in the rooms - great idea. 
Unfortunately the area isn't great - lots of beggars and druggies wandering about asking for money
If you can ignore that then it's pretty central and relatively easy to get to all the attractions
Excellent location. Close by stores and restaurants
Great that the hotel was so close to several 24 hour eateries!

review.title: Location, location, location.
review.reviewText: Loved our stay at the King George. Very clean place to stay, staff very friendly and helpful. We stayed with our two young adult children and had a blast!  Location was perfect for us with lots of food and entertainment at every block. Elevators are a little slow, what can you expect for one of oldest hotels in the city?

review.title: Very nice character hotel
review.reviewText: Small buy comfy well furnished rooms nice tv and bed, renovated washroom very friendly helpful staff.

review.title: Good hotel located nearby Union Square/Powell Str
review.reviewText: This hotel was good value for the money.  Although older, this hotel has had many upgrades over the years and we were very comfortable there.  The room and bathroom were small but very clean/comfortable and well appointed.  Staff were friendly and helpful.  Location was very convenient to union square area, powell street cable cars, various car rental, and lots of good restaurants.  Just note that homelessness is a big problem in San Francisco and this area is especially so.  No big problems though and we would stay again for the price we paid compared to other area hotels.
review.positiveRemarks: price, convenient location, clean and comfortable rooms

review.reviewText: Room was a bit small, but clean and conveniently situated

review.title: Great quality hotel in the middle of the fun!
review.reviewText: Easy check-in and helpful staff. Always received a greeting coming in and out. Simple touches like that are always appreciated. Location is good for those new and accustomed to the city--union square, downtown, all within walking distance. Comfortable for those who are looking to take it easy but also perfect for the adventurous types who only need the room to sleep and change.

review.title: Good hotel for short visit
review.reviewText: My wife and I stayed 3 nights (July 5-8, 2016) to visit our son.  The hotel's location is excellent, just minutes from theater, museums and tons of restaurants.  The room was a bit on the small side, but it was clean and comfortable and, most importantly to me, quiet.  The staff was cheerful and very helpful.  Would definitely stay there again.

Great location!  Great location!  Great location! Use Bart and Uber as parking is costly but convenient with a garage across the street . The noise level on the fifth floor was moderate . Giving you a true taste of city life  Everything in the room was in excellent working condition.  The coffee pot in the closet was a little odd but I would stay here again and hope to get a room and one of the higher floors.Use Bart and Uber.  The concierge service is a real bonus.  The hotel gives you a coupon for 20% off the casa mason restaurant next-door Giving you a true taste of city life

review.title: It's a good hotel. Good location.
review.reviewText: It was a good hotel. It's in a good location, easy to get around the city.  The room was very small, we didn't mind it too much, we were mostly out in the city anyway. Staff was nice...cafe mason next door for breakfast is good...the hotel provides a coupon for breakfast there since the hotel doesn't provide any. We liked it and would stay again.

review.title: Would definitely recommend.
review.reviewText: We recently stayed at King George for 2 nights and had a great time.  The room we had (Superior Room, 1 Queen Bed) was definitely not the biggest hotel room as we read in some reviews, but we did not plan on spending a ton of time in the room anyways.  There was definitely enough space for what you need (small walk-in and lots of storage under the bed).  The bed was honestly one of the comfiest beds we have ever slept in!    Bathroom was tiny but again, all you need and very clean.  Our room was ready when we arrived in San Fran around 11am which was awesome and staff was great. Location wise, it is right by everything you need (transit, restaurants and shopping).  There are homeless people honestly anywhere you go in San Fran - one street is good then another is a tad shady.  We were not bothered by any of them right by the hotel.  A minor downside to the hotel is the elevator.  As the hotel has an older feel which I really liked, the elevator is quite tiny and very slow which can be a negative if you have a big group or lots of luggage or are older.  The stairs are very narrow and windy which gave us an added leg workout along with walking around San Fran!  We would stay here again and recommend it to someone looking for a hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice staff, amazingly comfortable bed, clean room, very quick check-in and check-out, great location.
review.negativeRemarks: More variety at the lounge (it is just wine and beer), elevator upgrade.
review.locationRemarks: Great location.  It is right by transit, great restaurants and lots of shopping.

review.title: Lovely Hotel
review.reviewText: We love this hotel and have stayed there 3 different times. Cozy, clean and within walking distance to everything!

review.title: Glad we switched to this hotel
review.reviewText: The staff hotel and location are fantastic for San Francisco, very clean and comfortable, close to all transport and Westfield which has a great food court. We highly recommend this hotel but suggest you don't get a room at the front due to street noise, we had one at the back but were told by others the front was noisy.

review.title: Shuttle to airpor + the "Mr. Manager" @ the front
review.reviewText:
The shuttle to the airport, Terrible!!! I am very disappointed. Very dirt, I felt very uncomfortable inside such an old, noisy and filthy shuttle van recommended by this hotel. Shameful!
If not for this hotel's manager, who I met in the morning when leaving the hotel, all the front desk workers were very pleasant. 
A hotel's manager, suppose to at least greet his guests and not turn his face away when see them, as he does.

This hotel was better than I expected. Although the rooms are on the smaller side, they were well kept and clean. It is in a good area where you're comfortable walking around the city. It is next to a couple of 24 hour spots to eat for those who desire late night food runs. The only downsides I can think of is that there is only one elevator for a building that I believe is 7-9 floors. Also, parking with validation was $35 a night in the structure across the street (I hear that's normal for SF though).

review.title: Hotel in good location
review.reviewText: Hotel right in amongst restaurants, theatres, Blues and jazz establishments.   Ball park easy half hour walk away.  Hotel is clean and comfortable, and staff very helpful....would definitely go back.
review.negativeRemarks: Maybe a fridge in room
review.locationRemarks: See  above

review.reviewText: very good location at union square, staff are very friendly and helpful, but the room is too small
review.negativeRemarks: bathroom

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Good location, short walk to the Square, were you can catch public transport to most locations

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest, 
Thank you for taking the time to write a review.  I'm sorry your experience didn't live up to your expectations.  You can be assured that i have taken your comments to heart and will take appropriate action to address these issues the best I can. Our Union Square Business Improvement District continuously strives for a healthier community free of "pan handlers" and it's a process that is being aggressively addressed.  As far as your parking is concerned, we do offer competitive prices in the Union Square area and I'm sorry that you felt the price was too high for an SUV.  Again, thank you very much for your feedback. 
Sincerely, 
Candice Cancino
General Manager

review.title: Tiny room, no bathroom , parking scam
review.reviewText:
Tiny room is understandable. Bathroom is way too small,  mirror in bath room is 6 inches wide.

Parking is listed as 43$ a night, but charged 64$ a night, they call a minivan oversized car.

Pan handlers every where

review.title: Great central location
review.reviewText: The hotel was fairly easy to find.  The lobby was clean and the check in was easy.  The building is quite old.  I was nervous about the room being dated but although very small it was clean and comfortably furnished.  The bathroom did have a tub but it was so small that it would have been difficult for anyone but a child to be comfortable in it.  Although small the bathroom was very clean.  For the price and the area this hotel is awesome.
review.positiveRemarks: Very clean and comfortably furnished rooms
review.locationRemarks: Within walking distance of Powell street and Market street.  Very near the BART station and any city transit you might want.

review.title: Great new technology
review.reviewText: While we were staying they installed individual tablets in every room. It was so convent to be able to touch a button and have extra towels and coffee delivered within 5 minutes.

review.title: Very nicely decorated , awesome staff, clean
review.reviewText: Very nice place, just as ad stated, clean, friendly staff, very accommodating , close to union square
Great location. Great staff. Great room. Long wait for elevator in the morning so we decided we needed the exercise and used the stairs.

review.title: First time staying in the city
review.reviewText: My husband and I spent 2 night at the King George,   we arrived at just before 11pm and was greeted by a very friendly man working the desk.   We found our room on the 3rd floor to be on the small side, but we expected it to be.   Our room was decorated very tastefully and the bathroom look to be updated.  We had to open the window because there was no air but that cooled the room nicely.   The room was clean and very nice.    We had coffee each morning in the lobby area which is very nice as well.  There was a bar,  but we didn't have a drink there.    Overall we could not be happier that we chose to stay at the King George.   I loved the location,   right in the middle of Union Square,  we walked to a lot of the stores and to China Town.   I would recommend this hotel to anyone.   Other than taking a bus tour we were able to walk to restaurants ,  bars,  the bart,  and shopping.
review.positiveRemarks: nice clean rooms,   very friendly staff,   location is fantastic
review.locationRemarks: union square,  china town,  bus tours,  nice shopping and restaurants,  bart

review.title: Excellent and comfortable stay in SF
review.reviewText: The hotel is located very close to Union Square. Very convenient and clean. It would be better if I had a bath tub in my room. Other than that, it was excellent stay.

review.title: ideal location, ok rooms no water to drink in room
review.reviewText: location is ideal for traveler to the city, park in front of the hotel save at least 15 per day and is convenient no in and out priviledge

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Nice hotel close to Union Square, neighborhood terribly run down, streets littered in garbage and full of homeless people.
Near Union square, close to the cable car, train, bus station. Very conveniently located. Nice staff. Unfortunately no restaurant in the hotel or breakfast service.

review.title: Comfy hotel in a good location
review.reviewText: Hotel is in great location close to m, many restaurants, shopping and public transport. Room was smaller than usual, but hotel is in historical building and room has charm. Staff is very polite and helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: Great location: a block and a half away from Union Sq. and two blocks from Market st. It is close to to muni stop and cable car lines.
review.negativeRemarks: They could have add a breakfast bar or keep their bar open longer (I came down at 9 pm, and bar seemed to be closed)
review.locationRemarks: Three 24-hour diners next to hotel. One of them delivers to the hotel. "Biscuits and blues" blues club is across the street.

review.title: OK Hotel,  close to most attractions.
review.reviewText: Overall the hotel was ok, staff friendliness has slipped since the last time we stayed and the free WiFi is patchy at best.  If you don't mind small spaces and lack of Internet this place is close to some great places to eat and the cable car.

review.title: Extremely good value
review.reviewText: Super clean, comfy beds, and excellent location. Spent one night there and enjoyed to comfy bed, and the room was extremely clean. My friend and I had a great time at this hotel

Room was small, clean, and the bed was quite comfortable. Bathroom and shower albeit a little on the cramp side still not bad and had good water pressure. This hotel is good for the traveler who doesn't want to spend a fortune for a decent room in a city that is very expensive.
review.positiveRemarks: Hotel staff is very friendly and were very eager to please guests.
review.locationRemarks: Near Union Square for the shoppers who have expensive tastes. But , also near Chinatown for cheap trinkets  and loads of restaurants.

review.title: Cute hotel small rooms
review.reviewText: Staff were friendly and welcoming. Hotel is clean. Rooms are small but cute and clean with all the amenities you would expect. Neighborhood is ok. Would stay here again

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest, 

Thank you very much for taking the time to write a review on your recent stay in San Francisco.  Our hotel King George, is centrally located in the Union Square area.  I appreciate your feedback and will take measures to ensure our staff is aware of the check in / out delays that affects our guest experience.  Rest assured, I will do my best to fix the concerns you raised in your review. 
Warmly, 
Candice
General Manager

review.title: Rooms are nice but.....
review.reviewText: Rooms are nice, rooms facing the street are extremely loud you wont sleep, lobby is strange looking, one elevator that is extremely slow, the stares are narrow so you can't walk up them with luggage. Front desk check-in took about 15 minutes and I was the only person there?? Check-out was about the same, time consuming for no reason. People coming from out of state...this hotel is in the Tenderloin, which is a bad part of SF. (lots of homeless people, trash, and noise) However, you can walk to union square in about 5 mins. This hotel has a nice full bar area that was open late
review.negativeRemarks: Lobby, elevator, front desk check-in and out
review.locationRemarks: People coming from out of state...this hotel is in the Tenderloin, which is a bad part of SF. However, you can walk to union square in about 5 mins

review.title: Great staff and nice facilities
review.reviewText: Great location if you're attending a conference at one of the huge nearby hotels, as I was. Very convenient, and the rooms were pleasant.

review.title: Nice Union Square Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean, well laid out and close to the BART, Cable Cars and city transit system. Small elevator, small rooms but worked very well for our week in San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel was close to transit, shopping, theatre and dining.
review.negativeRemarks: We thought it was very nice. Yes, the elevator was small as were the stairs which meant some delays going up and down but it is a heritage building!!
review.locationRemarks: Walking it was 5 min to BART, 5 min to Cable Cars, 25 min to Fisherman's Wharf, 10 min to China town, 15 min to Japan town.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Maggie, 

Wow! Thanks so much for your wonderful review of our hotel.  I will certainly pass your kind words to JR and Beth.  I am so glad that you enjoyed your stay and I hope to welcome you back soon. 

Cheers, 
Candice Cancino
General Manager

review.title: Perfect Location
review.reviewText: Great Costumer Service!  We checked in a bit earlier, JR & Beth at the front desk were wounderful in accommodating our large group! The location is perfect as everything is within walking distance (shopping,dinning,entertainment,public transportation).  We have stayed in this hotel in the past, the rooms were what we expected.

review.title: Clean good location
review.reviewText: Front desk staff in past visits have been more friendly. & personable
review.locationRemarks: Located a block from Union Square. Near muni stops & many restaurants & shopping within walking distance..

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest, 
Thank you for taking the time to write a review.  I am happy to hear that you enjoyed our hotel but unfortunately had a bit of a restless sleep.  We value your feedback and we are working on finding a solution to the outside the noise.  I look forward to welcoming you back soon! 
Sincerely, 
Candice Cancino
General Manager

review.title: Nice hotel. Bad neighborhood.
review.reviewText: It's a very nice hotel and building. The room, 404, was very small but nice and clean. It faced the side alley which is very noisy with a lot of yelling and fighting in it at all hours of the night. Busses, cars and people sound like they're right in your room. You might not get a good nights sleep.

review.title: Great hotel in great location.
review.reviewText: My husband and I stayed at the King George Hotel for four nights and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. It's location is in the heart of Union Square. We didn't even need a rental car, but used the cable cars and took the Bart. The staff at the hotel was very friendly and attentive. The only negative to the place was that the rooms are quite small but since we didn't spend much time in our room it wouldn't stop us from staying there again.
review.positiveRemarks: Loved the old charm of this building, the price considering the great location and the helpful staff.
review.locationRemarks: We had a great location in Union Square. We walked to numerous restaurants, took the cable car to Pier 39, and North Beach.

review.title: Met all of our needs.
review.reviewText: Room was quite small along with bathroom but was more than adequate. Had most amenities one would need . Had a coffee maker although we never used,we went down to lobby for free coffee and tea. Was able to print our boarding pass from the hotels computer stations. Wifi was nil, even though they offered free in room wifi, I could never get on. Room was equipt for what we needed . Staff  was lovely . We were hardly in room as we were exploring San Fran .

managementResponses.response:
Dear Barbara, 

It was such a pleasure to read your wonderful review of the King George Hotel! I am so touched and appreciative of your kind words.  I hope to welcome you back soon. 

Cheers, 
Candice Cancino
General Manager

review.title: Nice hotel accessible to places of interest
review.reviewText:
Staff are very knowledgeable and helpful
Rooms are small but well equipped
The hotel is accessible to transport (cable cars, buses, trains, airport
review.positiveRemarks: Hotel was charming with an interesting history.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing

review.reviewText:
We stayed for 2 nights.  The room itself was fine and clean but a bit small, though quiet.  
One night we heard some people knocking outside in the hall way around 3 AM

review.title: Close to Union Square
review.reviewText: My friend and I stayed here for a race and it was a great location. We got the room with two twin beds and it's a pretty small room. The beds weren't that comfortable and the pillows weren't that soft. The room worked out though because we were only there for the night. The room was clean and the bathroom was small. I think I would stay again but get a room with two double beds! Also the room only had a ceiling fan! The window opened all the way though! So be careful if you have kids!!

managementResponses.response:
Hi! We are delighted to hear that you had a wonderful experience at the King George.  I look forward to welcoming you back. 

Warmly, 
Candice Cancino
General Manager

review.title: Cute and Quaint
review.reviewText: Super cute and quaint room right in the heart of San Francisco. We took the Bart in from Berkeley and the hotel was just a few blocks away. Its in the perfect location for a night out on the town, fine restaurant dining, sightseeing, and shopping.

review.title: Good enough
review.reviewText: The hotel is concern about the safety of the people staying.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest, 
Thank you for taking the time to write us a review. I believe feedback is a gift and I will certainly share your comments to the appropriate team.  As with your car, I have forwarded your concern to the valet parking manager.  We hope you can give us a second chance.  Should your travels bring you back to San Francisco, please do reach out and we will be happy to provide a complimentary room upgrade.  

Warmly, 
Candice Cancino
General Manager

review.title: Definitely not a 3 star hotel
review.reviewText: The room is very small and I don't think they have any AC in the room just a fan above ceiling. We tried to open the window to get some fresh air but the window of the room was located really close to a furnace exhaust for a restaurant that was open 24 hours so all the smell of food was around us and entered the room because the windows are old and they don't shot well. So don't expect to breathe any fresh air while in your room. The room was clean and they use some extra freshener trying to combat the smell of food in the room. Also I encountered another issue with the valet parking. When I picked up my car to leave the hotel it was smelling full of smoke. Also we detected a small ash residue on the dashboard so on my trip back home I got to inhale plenty of that smoke. The hotel knew about the situation but they decided not to inform us about the situation. Good luck with this hotel if you want to breathe air with fried chicken smell combined. Also be careful who parks your car also. Definitely a bad experience that I learned from it.
review.positiveRemarks: The location is good because it is in walking distance to Union Square and Cable car.

review.reviewText: Worth the price. Conveniently located. You get what you pay for.

review.title: San Francisco 2015
review.reviewText: Lovely hotel in heart of city great shopping and dining,  parking horrible get valet and pay 39$. Very old hotel but sufficient however elavator small and slow. Staff was friendly and helpful would definitely return to king George hotel.
It was ok, the hotel needs more staff to help all people
Outstanding location. Very clean and updated. Room a little small but great private bathroom. Check in was actually fun with staff. Classy - not stuffy. Will stay there again.

review.title: Budget stay
review.reviewText:
It's good enough for its price, in one of the more expensive downtowns in the U.S. The place seems clean, and staff is friendly. The rooms have a smaller box locker with a physical key, which you use as a "safe". 

Only PROBLEM: 9 floors, 1 elevator (with permit expired months ago) that fits 4 people with luggage. This elevator might as well be a coal mine shaft... So every morning you have a long long wait.. The situation can get really ugly.

review.title: Close to city. Economical hotel to stay in.
review.reviewText: Friendly and helpful staff. Good experience as the staff will help us with locations and directions. Nearby to most local central locations.

review.title: Fabulous location
review.reviewText: We are from Australia and i booked this hotel on line after reading some great reviews. We are in our 50's and I keep a nice clean home so when we go away i want to stay somewhere with the same standards but cannot afford 5 star. This hotel was reasonably priced especially for San Francisco so in a way i was hesitant. Again ready the Expedia reviews i booked it. We weren't disappointed. A big smile greeted us and this set the pace. The staff were helpful and so friendly. The location is fabulous as Macy's and all the major shops, Cable Car,Hop on Off bus are just around the corner. Great places to eat either side of the hotel. We had one of the newly renovated rooms which was very nice. Bed was so comfortable and room small but spacious and had everything we needed. The bathroom was also small but it was so well layed out and well stocked with beautiful lush towels and shampoos soaps etc. We were away for a month and stayed all over the US and in lots of hotels and i have to say the house keeping at this hotel was the best. Our room was spotless each day. I have recommended this hotel to everyone in Aussie that have mentioned they will like to go to San Francisco. If we return and there is a high chance of that as our daughter lives in the USA we would book again.
review.negativeRemarks: Absolutely nothing, Just keep that charm going...
review.locationRemarks: Everything you want or need to do is just around the corner

review.reviewText: Enjoyed the stay, parking is expensive but it's a downtown )

We talk about people but discreetly.

review.title: A nice hotel located in the central of the city.

review.positiveRemarks: It is very clean and the staff is quite helpful.
review.locationRemarks: The location is very convenient.  It is very close to the bus and tram stops.

review.title: Nice hotel near Union Square
review.reviewText: I stay in smaller 'vintage' hotels when I visit San Francisco because I enjoy the sense of history they convey. The King George is a very pleasant 'vintage' hotel, with decently sized rooms (not too big, not too small) and closets, as well as a full bath, though the tub is small. The bed was very comfortable, and there are ample outlets for chargers, etc. Linens were decent, and the room was immaculate. The staff asked my preference for being near the ground floor or above, as well as street side or interior alley side. Very accommodating for storage of luggage if checkout is earlier than your departure from SFO. I'll definitely keep it on my short list for my next trip to San Francisco.
review.locationRemarks: At the 24 hour diner across the street, get the breakfast, with sourdough toast and hash-browns. Very close to all of the great shops Union Sqare.

review.title: Very nice Boutique Hotel conveniently located
review.reviewText: The King George Hotel is a great location in the Union Square area of San Francisco, which puts it close to the Geary Theater, shopping and China Town.  Within a few short blocks, there are Chinese, Indian, Thai, American and other eateries that offer a wonderful variety of food.  The hotel itself dates from the early 1900's, but it is well-maintained and nicely decorated.  The beds were comfortable with thick mattresses.  The bathroom is old-fashioned and a bit small. The bathtub shower had a high side that could prove difficult for older people or those who have knee problems to get in.  My companion and I had a twin room and it was not a big room, so possibly the double-double or queen room would be bigger.  But it was large enough for us. Our main complaint was that they had one small elevator for the guests and in two days there we found it filled with hotel staff and workmen on several occasions and needed to wait for it to go down and up again.  That's a minor problem though and for the cost and location of this hotel, this was a great buy.  I will happily book this hotel again.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked the location and the helpfulness of the staff.  The rooms were nice and it was clean.
review.negativeRemarks: We had a little trouble with the electronic door lock that used a chip to open the door due to instructions on the card being unclear.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location,  Theater, restaurants, diners, shopping, cable cars and Chinatown all very close.

review.title: Great location with everything that was needed
review.reviewText:
I chose to stay at the King George Hotel on my first visit to San Francisco, as it was located right in the heart of downtown and only about a block away from the popular tourist location; Union Square. 

My first impression was that of a very old fashioned, quaint building and was unlike what I expected for a hotel in downtown San Francisco. However any doubts I had quickly vanished as I entered a very warm, welcoming lobby with friendly staff who helped accommodate me quickly.  

The room was very "charming" for lack of a better word and had everything that was needed, but I will say to be prepared for the occasional sirens/persons yelling as you can definitely hear street noises, since being situated in such a central downtown area.

With that aside, the price was very reasonable compared to other hotels that I reviewed, as well as rooms on Airbnb. I was surprised at how expensive some Airbnb rooms were while searching for similar locations, which made my decision to stay at King George that much easier for a small additional cost. 

While I was only visiting San Francisco on holiday and not business, I cannot say how I would rate all of the facilities at this hotel, but for a single traveler the experience was very pleasant and welcoming. It is a very charming hotel and I would definitely visit again on future trips and recommend for other travelers.
We had a very nice room on the 7th floor. It looked newly remodeled and had very good energy. They made this tiny space look and feel great with all the amenities.

review.title: Nice hotel, close to union square, market street
review.reviewText: Comfortable clean hotel. Friendly staff. Quick check in and out. Found everything I need in the room though it's very small and the bed is occupying all the area but wasn't a big problem for me. No breakfast in the hotel but they offer coffe and tea at the reception in the morning.  Best location ever, safe area at night and close to union square and market street where you can find all the shops, the mall, first station of the cable car, the bus and train stations. I would definitely go to this hotel in my next visit to San Francisco and recommend it to friends.

review.title: Nice location.
review.reviewText: A couples getaway.  The location was good and the staff were very helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: The cleaning supplies were very strong smelling.

review.reviewText: Hotel very close to Union Square and trolley. Rooms on small side, but not unexpected.  A heads up, though, that there is no air conditioning.  Usually not a big deal, but can get hot if its warm outside.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,
I am sorry to hear we were not able to meet your expectations during your stay with us. San Francisco generally has a very mild climate and our guests find our ceiling fans and operable windows sufficient to keep the rooms cool. I apologize you were not able to have a restful night sleep with us, and I do hope you will give us another chance to provide you with an exceptional experience should you return to the King George Hotel.

I saw  lot of guests checking out next day because of the same problem. Very high rates too. You expect a decent room!

review.title: Very nice for the price
review.reviewText: Not too expensive. Very nice. Helpful and very friendly staff. Room was also nice modern. Only thing my room needed was an a.c. unit. It was really hot the first day I stayed,  there was a fan but it wasn't enough. Otherwise it was great I'd stay there again.

review.title: Good hotel, good location
review.reviewText: I had never been to SF before. I was in town to go to baseball games at AT&T Park and Oakland Coliseum. I wanted to be close to major hubs for public transportation and in a relatively safe, hassle-free area that's easy to get in and out of. I was willing to pay a little extra money to not stay in a cruddy place and to have certain amenities, as well as a good location. This hotel accomplished all of the above. While not perfect, it's easy to get to, close to numerous transportation options to get to major attractions (but it's near no major attractions itself) and didn't cost an arm and a leg (I saved 20% by booking the flight and hotel on this site, which made it worth the cost I ended up paying). My room had no AC, but it had a ceiling fan, so it was comfortable for September. I don't know about summer months when it's hotter, but some rooms do have AC. I recommend asking for a higher floor so the street noise doesn't bug you. The bathroom is tiny, and there isn't much shelf or closet space so prepare to be flexible with what you bring.
review.positiveRemarks: My room was small but was clean and well-appointed (comfortable bed, etc.). The staff was terrific. It has two public computers near the front desk.
review.negativeRemarks: I don't think there's much anyone could do to change it, but there's a lot of homeless people in the area. It got annoying.
review.locationRemarks: It's a block from Union Square. It's 2 1/2 blocks from the Powell-Mason/Powell-Hyde cable cars and the big Muni/BART station at Powell and Market.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,
Thank you for staying with us and for providing your feedback on your stay. I am pleased to hear you enjoyed our central location in the heart of Union Square, close to all of the world class shopping and dining San Francisco has to offer. San Francisco has a very mild climate, and most of our guests find our operable windows and ceiling fans to be sufficient for their needs. We do offer Air Conditioning in our "deluxe" rooms types, so please be sure to book one of those rooms if you desire Air Conditioning. Thank you again for sharing your feedback with us.

review.title: Some Surprises
review.reviewText: While the hotel staff were nice, and the hotel is well-situated, I was disappointed to discover that the internet service offered at the hotel was poor. The connection was intermittent and I was unable to log on to check my email when I wanted to nor avail myself to other online services. Further, there were plumbing issues with the toilet in the room. I would have been prepared to let this all go except that upon my return home, I discovered marks on my skin. I learned these were caused from bed bugs. As such, my overall impression of the hotel has been lowered.

Because of the mild climate this should not be a problem however because you will be keeping the windows open for air you also get the noise from the street..if your a light sleeper you may want to stay elsewhere.Rooms are small..not a issue if your only staying a few nights. Check in was quick. Housekeeping is very good. Because of the small rooms i do not recommend staying here with children. Fine for a solo traveler or a couple.For breakfast check out the Pine Street diner across the street...excellent omelets.Bottom line..I would stay here again

review.title: Pleasant hotel with friendly staff
review.reviewText:
To be honest, I didn't have a lot of expectations when I signed up. I was in town for a wedding and needed a place to stay for the weekend, and it was the most affordable package in the downtown area. It's located in an old building and the room was on the smaller side. With that said, the room was clean and tidy. Just don't expect too much hotel amenities. Also, the area can be a bit shady at night with signs of drug use and homelessness nearby.

The front counter staff and concierge were very helpful and friendly from the moment of checking in to checking out. I never got to thank or tip the concierge gentleman when I checked out since he wasn't working at the time. As it was my first time being in SF, he gave me quite a few pointers on where to go and how to get there. Overall, if you're not looking for anything too fancy within budget, I highly recommend this place.

The room was quite small and the bathroom tiny but quaint. There is only one lift in the hotel which was really slow so you might choose to use the stairs. Tea and coffee was available in the morning but it would have been great to have tea and coffee available all day.

review.reviewText:
I passed by this hotel many times - this was the first time to stay here. Of course this is not the modern high-rise hotel like some others around the corner and it has its won charm.
Compared to other older hotels in the neighborhood, this hotel has been updated recently and well maintained.
Staff was very friendly and accommodating. I got what I needed in timely manner.
It is a 100 years old building and does not have air-conditioning. The ceiling fan works very well and it was very comfortable. In San Francisco, you don't need air-conditioner except for a couple days in mid summer. Many houses in San Francisco do not have air-conditioner.

review.title: Fabulous hotel !!üòçüëè‚ú®
review.reviewText: This hotel experience exceeded my expectations. The King George is affordable, great location, clean, very friendly and helpful staff, and unusually quiet (especially during PRIDE weekend). I read reviews where people complained about the room and bathroom size, and while small, I didn't find it uncomfortable in the least. A perfect boutique hotel in a wonderful city! üòç I'll be back!

review.title: Very Comfortable and Clean stay at a great price!
review.reviewText: So impressed!  We will definitely stay here again.  It is so difficult to find a reasonably priced place to stay in SF, and this is it!  This hotel dates back to 1914, so it has the tiny elevator from that period and the low ceilings in the room, but this only makes it more charming.  The room, lobby, bar, restrooms and meeting areas were all spotlessly clean.  The bed was very comfortable and has a nice assortment of pillows.  The free wifi and fixed rate parking with in-and-out privileges helped to keep our trip to SF on budget.  They will put a refrigerator or roll-away bed (or crib) in your room upon request and we had a combo heat and air unit in our room so we could have the temperature in the room just like we wanted it.  24 hour room service from the 24 hour diner next door, discount coupons provided.  Every single person we encountered on the staff was extremely courteous, knowledgeable and helpful.  Major shopping a block away.  Upon checkout I mentioned how much we enjoyed our stay and that we would be back, and if there were anything I would change it would the the hobo that smoked in the alley that caused cigarette smoke smell to drift into our room.  I thought this was just a normal thing for being in the city and something to expect, but the employee said to call the front desk immediately next time and they would take care of the situation immediately!   I felt like we were getting the service and convenience of a top-of-the-line SF hotel at a budget price.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing!
review.locationRemarks: In the downtown district, one to two blocks to the major stores like Nordstrom's, Macy's, Tiffiny's, etc.  Three 24 hour Cafe's within 50 steps.

review.reviewText: Everything about my stay exceeded expectations. It was cleaner and nicer than other hotels costing significantly more. No bedbugs, always a plus. Great location. Will definitely stay here again!
review.positiveRemarks: I liked the overall vibe and value.
review.locationRemarks: It's centrally located near the BART and METRO, with hundreds of shopping and dining options within walking distance.

review.title: Comfortable stay
review.reviewText: If not for the renovation/construction they are doing right now, I would have given them a five star all the way around. They started with work early in the morning and if you wanted to sleep a little late you  couldn't due to the noise right upstairs. Other than that, very nice place, staff very pleasant, room very clean and location close to everything.

review.title: Location, location, location!
review.reviewText:
My niece and I stayed at the King George Hotel for four nights; May 21-15, 2015.  Overall we had a wonderful experience; check-in was smooth and welcoming (which set the tone), hotel room was small but comfortable and met our needs, and the conceirge were extremely helpful with tips on where to go and where to eat.  The room we were in was recently renovated and I can see how it can go downhill fast if housekeeping is not more diligent.  

The location was fabulous.  Sure it's close to the Tenderloin district but one can easily avoid venturing there, especially during the evening hours.   Public transport is close at hand and there's lots to do within walking distance as well, especially if you like to walk.
review.positiveRemarks: The location and the friendly staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Housekeeping for sure.  The louvered windows in the bathroom should be replaced as I can see this being an issue in winter, and air con for summer.
review.locationRemarks: Location is perfect to everything; either walking or public transport.

review.title: Great location!
review.reviewText: Great location! Room was small but perfect for our needs. Very clean hotel and room. The bed was comfortable. The staff was friendly and knowledgable. Will definitely stay there again!
Clean, comfortable room. I got lucky and was given one of the larger rooms.

review.title: A centrally located hotel which is easy to find!
review.reviewText:
This is our second time staying at the King George Hotel. It is on Mason street, just two blocks from Union Square. It is a small hotel but clean, pleasant and comfortable. The rooms are quite small but since we only sleep there, it is fine.
The hotel has been undergoing renovation and the bathrooms and rooms are lovely.
The staff is pleasant and helpful with every aspect of our stay.
review.negativeRemarks: A small refrigerator would be nice.
review.locationRemarks: It is right around the corner from Union Square. Perfect for just about everything.

review.reviewText:
rooms are small but cozy and very clean.  It's in a great location for shopping.
the only problem was the street noise.  when I stay here again I will ask for a room 
without a window.

review.title: Loved the hotel, wary of neighborhood
review.reviewText: I loved my stay here, but be very careful while walking (particularly downhill) - things get rough quickly.

review.title: Small room but good location and staff
review.reviewText: Excellent location next to union Square.  Room was small but manageable  with decent light
review.positiveRemarks: friendly staff; great location; wifi was fine
review.negativeRemarks: layout of room with 2 beds  and desk was so tight, hard to open room door
review.locationRemarks: Union Square

review.title: Close to Union Square
review.reviewText: A very good overall experience; hotel has been updating all accommodations, so it was nice to stay in a "brand-new" room. Only one elevator, but hotel is small, so this was not an issue even when staying on the top (9th) floor; I usually walked down the stairs in the morning, which was fast and easy (but not necessary if you prefer to take an elevator).
review.positiveRemarks: Convenient to conference I attended; nice d√©cor and staff; lots of restaurants within a few blocks ranging from all-day breakfast to Thai & Japanese.
review.negativeRemarks: Room service is funky as it's from a diner next door, so no healthy meal choices of any kind and no opportunity to pair meal with a glass of wine.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Chinatown & Union Square (both an easy walk). BART system within a 4 block walk.

review.title: Check in at 12:30 PM , on the 23rd March 15
review.reviewText: Nice receptionist,smiling East Asian,his joke about my snoring noises is not funny,because I request a room with twin beds.In fact I first plan to visit SF with my 35 years old daughter.On the 26th March 15 I checked out and forgot a small toy for my grand son,the House Keeper found it and returned it promptly.Bravo,please give her a kiss,thank you.
review.positiveRemarks: Excellent staffs,including Concierge.Central location and no Breakfast.

review.title: No heat
review.reviewText: No heat in room, provided space heater does not heat room.

review.title: Great location.
review.reviewText: The hotel is going through a recent renovation but it did not interrupt our stay.
review.positiveRemarks: The location was terrific, the staff was very friendly and the room was very clean and nice. We would return.
review.negativeRemarks: More staff in the morning when checking out.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square (shopping), Theater (Curran), Chinatown and fabulous french bistros were within walking distance.

review.title: Nice, reasonably priced hotel near Union Square
review.reviewText: I have stayed here before and will again, good place for the price. Clean and comfortable (small rooms, it is older hotel). Heating system is temperamental, older radiator type, but it does work eventually.
review.negativeRemarks: Steam clean the carpets and fix the heating system
review.locationRemarks: Close walk to Union Square and to Market Street where you can catch the Cable Car to Fisherman's Wharf, buses and street cars to anywhere are close.

review.title: Great hotel in Union Square.
review.reviewText: Great location in Union Square at a good price for that area.  Close to the subway, shopping and good dinning options.

review.title: Great location, great staff
review.reviewText: Clean hotel, central location, well kept. Great price. Parking is across the street and a bit pricy. Similar to parking cost anywhere in SF. Was supplied with a fridge after requesting. No additional charge.
Great staff with hotel located conveniently near majority of attractions in SF.

review.title: Nice hotel in the heart of downtown San Francisco.
review.reviewText: Overall, it was a comfortable stay in this hotel! Located in the heart of downtown San Francisco, King Georges Hotel has a walk distance to many spots of interests. The room is clean, the staff is always smile and friendly. Wifi access is efficient and fast, computers in the lobby was very helpful to information search and print something.
review.positiveRemarks: Friendly staff ready to help you at anytime, convenient transportation.
review.negativeRemarks: Room is little bit smaller than expected,
review.locationRemarks: 334 Mason St. San Francisco, near Union Square, China Town, Japan Town, city tour lines, good restaurants and bars.

review.title: Great location right near Central San Francisco
review.reviewText: I chose the hotel because it was close (Walking Distance) to everything I needed to do on my short visit to S.F. This was very true.
review.positiveRemarks: Remodeled Room was in excellent condition. Although very small it was very clean, quiet and comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks:
1.) The phone system was terrible. I could hardly hear anyone and the handset was lousy. 
2.)  A "Luggage Table" for my suitcase. There is room.
review.locationRemarks: Great.

review.title: Great hotel - great location
review.reviewText:
Spent two days in San Fran.  Abdul the concierge is great. 
Very close to all the sights and shopping.  Couldn't recommend it more highly. The place has a lot if charm.

review.title: Work in Progress
review.reviewText: King George is renovating most of their rooms, one or two floors at a time, and so the hotel is experiencing a good deal of disruption.  The very good staff does their best to smooth this over but can only do so much.
review.negativeRemarks: I expect things will get back to normal after the renovation is completed.

review.reviewText: The staff is phenomenally helpful!    Particularly Daniel, who drove me and my car to the near-by public parking lot and then walked back to the hotel with me.  He also good-naturedly helped my friend find her I-phone which she lost.  Mark, the manager, was also most helpful with his assiatance and good nature.  I would return to the hotel because of the staff.  AND the great location.

review.title: Nice little quaint hotel
review.reviewText: Bathroom and bed were lovely and clean. It was a few steps too far from Union Sq, but overall very nice
review.locationRemarks: Union Sq shopping and dining.

review.title: Location vs. noise
review.reviewText: Location is great for day tripping, and close to everything downtown Union Square etc. Reason why we booked was location and the affordable (relatively speaking for SF) vallet parking which was a major PLUS. Walk or catch trolly's, or public transportation within steps. Rooms were freshly rennovated which was great, pretty, clean and comfortable, but ours didn't have all the lights installed ("yet") that were supposed to.  So the only light in the room was overhead on the fan. We had to get out of bed to turn off/on the light and not much for ambiance. Would have been nice to have the light near the bed for reading and on/off convenience from bed. Even if you don't think you need a concierge service, stop by and introduce yourself. No matter why you are there, he's a GREAT resoruce for information and shortcuts on how to get around, the best steak dinners for less, and where to grab some local's favorites.
review.positiveRemarks: Convenient parking, rennovated rooms, location, super helpful staff, free Pete's coffee in the lobby.
review.negativeRemarks: MAJOR bummer was that the louvered windows didn't filter or keep ANY of the city noise out at night. NO SLEEP due to street/city/construction/ noise.
review.locationRemarks: Great location - good eats and plenty to do and see right outside the door and within feet or a ride.

review.title: Comfortable and Centrally Located
review.reviewText: The King George is clean, centrally located and slightly fading.  The room was small but well laid out and clean.  In all, excellent value.

review.title: Snall, convenient, comfortable
review.reviewText: Good small hotel close to all transportation and attracrion . Very friendly and nicely updated. Room was small but bed was excellent. Will recommend KG as a happy choice.

review.title: Super cute Union Square hotel with character
review.reviewText: King George Hotel was very cute and centrally located (two blocks from Union Square, close to restaurants, shopping, and all forms of transit - including the Hyde st cable car). The hotel was built in 1914 and is supremely charming, although rooms are small, they have been recently renovated‚Äìthey are stylish and comfortable (especially the bed!). In particular noticed their precise and ingenious use of every last inch of the limited inches in the endearingly small washroom. Staff were friendly and accommodating and valet parking isn't much more than the public parking offered nearby - granted we only stayed one night. For a longer stay you may want to investigate alternative parking options. Was also happy with the overall cost - considering a motel in some of the surrounding cities‚ÄìPetaluma, Novato, San Rafael‚Äìwas close to the same price, what we paid to stay in a boutique hotel, in central SF felt like a total steal. Just know - the rooms are small (fairly common in SF), great for a couple passing through, but if you're planning to stay a while, or have kids, something to be aware of, the cheap rate doesn't get you much space.
review.positiveRemarks: Charming, good location, comfortable bed, nicely appointed, good rate.
review.negativeRemarks: Experience was great but cheaper parking options would be good.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Union Square, shopping, restaurants, cable cars/transit (easy to get to the Ferry Building/Fisherman's Wharf). Very central to all areas.

review.title: Hotel was being remodeled and everything was clean
review.reviewText: Hotel was near Union Square, could walk to Chinatown, easy to get to cable cars, street cars, buses. But was difficult to figure out the bus routes. There were beggars on most corners, but not directly in front of the hotel. I would definitely stay here again. Lot of noise at night, but The Hilton is across the street and they heard the same noises we did. Bring a pair of ear plugs or go around the corner to Walgreens and buy some. Slept very well. Hotel should train staff to open beer or wine since that is all they serve, so you could have a drink during the middle of the day if you wanted
review.positiveRemarks: Liked that it was near transportation and was pretty easy 2 find.
review.negativeRemarks: Bar was only open for few hours, had 2 go somewhere else in middle of day if you wanted a drink.

review.title: Nice hotel in Union Square district
review.reviewText: Wonderful, pleasant atmosphere at the Bar and sitting areas
review.positiveRemarks: Walking distance of my choices as well as BART, CABLE CARS,Public Transportation. Friendly, accommodating staff, and professionals
review.negativeRemarks: Very nice hotel
review.locationRemarks: Great Location

review.title: Great location, good for a short stay.
review.reviewText: Stayed just for one night- it was OK. Staff is very friendly, but hotel does not have much amenities. Room was very small but newly remodeled and had everything what's needed in it. Bed was comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness. There was someone's hair in the bathtub and toilet.
review.locationRemarks: Close to everything.

review.title: Great Hotel, Not so great city
review.reviewText:
The hotel was nice and clean. The room was small but comfortable enough for a short stay. The staff are very friendly and polite.

The city it self is full of homeless people and sketchy. Definitely did not feel safe walking around at night.

review.title: Weekend in San Fran
review.reviewText: This was hotel was very comfortable and located at a great spot just 2 blocks from Union Square.  The price was great and the amenities were adequate.  The people at the desk were especially helpful.  We arrived early in San Francisco, about 6am.  Check in is usually at 3pm, but the ladies at the front desk on Feb 15 am were so kind to find a room to check us in right away so we wouldn't have to wait 8 hours for a room after a 10 hour flight.  The colors were nice, the beds were soft and the bathrooms were clean.  It's just a stone throw's away to the Powell Cable Car Turn about.  I highly recommend this hotel to anyone who is visiting San Francisco for a weekend.
review.positiveRemarks: The location was great, a lot of nice affordable and delicious restaurants surrounds the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Maybe they could include a complimentary continental breakfast if not a caf√© downstairs.
review.locationRemarks: Cable car is just 2 blocks away as well as the BARTS and MUNI stations.  You don't need a rental car here.

review.title: Great location, small but clean and comfy room.
review.reviewText: The hotel has been recently renovated and they did a great job. Our room was small but clean and had everything we needed; the staff was friendly and responsive to requests for extra blankets and towels. Right near the Powell St. station which is a hub...highly recommended!

review.title: Great, affordable hotel
review.reviewText: Loved the hotel! Very affordable, nice staff, clean and renovated rooms!! The only (tiny) complaint was that there was no air conditioning and the room was WARM! San Francisco was experiencing warm weather and we had to keep our windows open in our 9th floor room.

review.title: Night staff
review.reviewText: The night staff was the greatest I've experienced. I have no complaints about them, they went above and beyond. I will come back and stay for sure

review.title: Valentines Getaway
review.reviewText: Had to change my room 3x (The first one had 2 small beds, 2nd one felt like it was 1979) but finally got the room advertised on the website on the 3rd time. Rooms are very small there, kind of felt like a dorm. Still the perfect getaway for a one night Valentines stay. No complaints.
review.negativeRemarks: Every room should be renovated because some rooms have a 1979 feel to them.
review.locationRemarks: Lots of restaurants to choose from.

review.title: Small but clean
review.reviewText: Rooms at this hotel were small but had everything we needed for our vacation. Ive stayed in more expensive hotels and have yet to find a staff as friendly as King George. I will stay here again on my next vacation to San Francisco
review.positiveRemarks: Restroom was very clean and staff very friendly, the knowledge of staff for things to do in city was great. Everyone there had a smile a seemed happy.
review.locationRemarks: Plenty to do in Union Square, shopping and great food and you also have plenty of other places to visit like the pier and fishermans wharf.

review.title: Great hotel, great location
review.reviewText: The room I stayed in was small but nice, clean, and had everything I needed. The carpet was in serious need of a steam clean but that may happen, as they were in the midst of a renovation. The Union Square location is great and close to the cable car to Fisherman's Wharf. Good price for what you get, but not much room for more than the bed in the room. Staff was excellent and very helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Clean the carpet in the room.
review.locationRemarks: See review

review.title: Would recommend on price only!
review.reviewText: I've stayed here a few times and never really had much to complain about.  The last time we were "upgraded" to a renovated room. This time, not so lucky. We asked if we could stay on one of the renovated floors since we have stayed at this hotel numerous times, and the last time was just a month earlier. We were told they were booked - but if we wanted to "upgrade" to a renovated room we could pay $20.  So, not actually booked.  The only thing they had going for them this stay was the parking garage across the street, and Lori's diner next door. Basically nowhere to put anything in the room, so all my stuff was on the floor, and the baseboards are old, dusty and dingy.  Our room was overheated due to the outdated boiler, and we had our window open the entire time but that didn't help much at all. There is ONE very slow elevator.  Our room keys had to be re-keyed twice. Took about 5-10 minutes to get hot water. I hope they don't increase the price too much when they are done renovating all the rooms. This has sort of been our "go - to" hotel thanks to the convenient parking and hotel location, but I will probably look elsewhere next time.
review.positiveRemarks:
Close to parking. Close to Union Square. 
The guy at the bar is awesome!
review.negativeRemarks: A lot.
review.locationRemarks: Near Union Square, ACT, Cable Car

review.title: Under Construction
review.reviewText: Hotel is in a great location staff was very friendly. Rooms are small and old but there is construction going on. I didn't stay and moved to a different hotel but staff were good about it. Will be nice once it's finished.
review.negativeRemarks: Old fashioned rooms, very small.

review.reviewText: I use this hotel once a month and overall, from staff to rooms to small details everyone is excellent.  So close to everything.  When you travel as a single woman, you feel very safe and everything is at your finger tips.  Blessings

review.reviewText:
Our room on the third floor overlooked the alley. All night, the restaurant next door emptied glass
bottles  into the dumpster. With no air conditioning to mute the sounds, the street noises where
unbelievably loud. We heard ever moan, laugh, curse, scream, siren, rant, preach....all night.
The twin mattress's in our room would not stay on the wooden boxes they were resting on.
The bathroom, while small, was updated and very clean.

managementResponses.response:

General Manager
King George Hotel

review.title: Single small elevator.
review.reviewText: Single elevator is to small for guests, staff and construction workers to use at the same time. The stairs are steep and narrow for regular use. The rooms are very small. The staff was great, they have no control over the other issues.

review.title: New Years
review.reviewText: I had a lovely time being so perfectly located. This hotel is beautiful and elegant, filled with original charm.

review.title: Nice choice
review.reviewText: Clean, elegant, thoughtful. Perfect location near everything.

managementResponses.response:

Sincerely,
Bertrand H. Newson
General Manager
King George Hotel

review.title: Disappointed !  Rooms need to be to updated!
review.reviewText:
Close to Union Square but staff was overwhelmed and a bit disorganized .  Valet service 
needs to be revamped as there was a 45 minute wait in the lobby for us while trying to 
check-out--- but no one available to find our paid for parked car!
Our bathroom which faced the  open parking garage across the street had a full length window with a sheer see through curtain  ( ! ).
We realize it was a weekend before the holidays but this could have been such a better experience ----with staff that was not overextended  and updated amenities.
review.negativeRemarks: Overall--- better organized staff and cleaner updated rooms.
review.locationRemarks: Vacation  to SF  planned.

review.title: SF at Christmas
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was very proficient and friendly.  The room was clean and comfortable.

review.title: Disappointed this time
review.reviewText: I have stayed at this hotel three times in the past and was very satisfied each time.  But this time I stayed in an extremely small room on the fifth floor that was  uncomfortably warm, even with the one window open.  The bathroom was dinky and the walls throughout needed repair and paint.  The staff was lovely, however.

managementResponses.response:

review.title: Older hotel near Union Square
review.reviewText: Older hotel near Union Square. Good location.  Being an older hotel the rooms are on the smaller size and the bathrooms even smaller. Still a good place to stay if you want to be near Union Square.

review.title: Nice, close to union square..
review.reviewText:
It has a sweet vintage vibe that I like. A clean hotel close to union square. 
If your not familiar with the city it can be hard to get to with electronic directions. ( Siri didn't know that we couldn't make the left turns she kept telling us to make) parking was an issue for us, we checked in dropped off our bags and left immediately. There was no need for the valet. By the time we returned all parking was taken. The money saved with the Internet hotel special went towards parking two blocks away. Maybe just the time of year, but when your tired driving in circles looking for parking, then have to walk two blocks in the cold.....
review.positiveRemarks: I love vintage, they have updated it beautifully without losing the vintage vibe.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking!
review.locationRemarks: If you want to shop you are close to union square. Nice resteraunts, even a jack in the box. You can take the trolly to the warf.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,

Sincerely,
Bertrand H. Newson
General Manager
King George Hotel

review.title: NICE HOTEL, CLOSE TO UNION SQUARE IN SAN FRANCISCO
review.reviewText:
IT WAS ONLY A ONE NITE STAY FOR CHRISTMAS SHOPPING IN S.F.
CLOSE TO POWELL ST CABLE CAR AND.UNION SQUARE.   ROOM WAS FRESHLY RE-DECORATED
STAFF VERY FRIENDLY. 
HOPEFULLY WILL STAY THERE AGAIN NEXT YEAR
review.locationRemarks:
CLOSE TO UNION SQUARE  S.F.
SHOPPING AND CABLE CARS

review.title: Very nice location.
review.reviewText: My first time in San Francisco and first time stayed at this Hotel, I was very please with my choice.
review.positiveRemarks: So close and able to walk.
review.negativeRemarks: About the noise.
review.locationRemarks: Shopping, dinning.

review.title: Thin Walls, Loud Neighbors, Hard Beds
review.reviewText:
Let's see now, where should I begin?
The neighbors were loud, the walls were thin
The hotel staff was just ok
During my one night San Fran stay
The bed was hard, like a box
Unlike the fur of a fox
I knew my stay would not be great
I stayed here only for the rate

managementResponses.response:

Sincerely,
