General Manager
King George Hotel

review.reviewText: Check in was easy, great location.  The parking structure is right across the street making it easy to find parking.

review.title: Old can be charming, dirty is just plain gross!
review.reviewText: OK, I love vintage and old architecture in buildings. I would rather stay in a grand old hotel with the wonderful detail that is unavailable today.  But, if it is going to please me it has to be clean and maintained! The lower grout in the wall tile surrounding the tub was black. The corners of the white tile floor were black. The shower curtain rod had rust on the bottom at each end. There was some peeling paint in the bathroom. The sink faucet never fully shut off. And, no one wants a bedspread with whatever ick may be lurking on it anymore. Has the hotel staff not seen all the news exposes on what remains on a bedspread? Give me a clean duvet, or two sheets wrapping a blanket please!
review.negativeRemarks: The housekeeping. I think I would have really liked a clean room.
review.locationRemarks: Just off of, but not on Union Square. A really good location in the shopping heart of San Francisco.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Tioga Dan,
Thank you for your recent stay with us and we appreciate your business. We are glad to hear you were pleased with the friendly and helpful service provided by the staff and our excellent location in close proximity to the downtown area of San Francisco. We welcome the opportunity to accommodate you again in the future!

Sincerely,
Bertrand H. Newson
General Manager
King George Hotel

review.title: Union Square Central
review.reviewText:
Stayed 2 nights while on a business trip to San Francisco.  The room was clean, quiet and comfortable, although a bit small.  The staff was super friendly and helpful.
The location was excellent, just one block off of Union Square.  Very centrally located with most of downtown within easy walking distance.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Daneka,
Thank you for your review. We‚Äôre glad you were overall very happy with your recent stay and that you enjoyed our central location near shopping, restaurants, and public transportation. We appreciate your comments regarding our free Wi-Fi and the cleanliness of your room. Thank you for feedback as we are currently undergoing our room renovation, which will include new platform beds and improved sound proofing. We hope you stay with us the next time your travels bring you to San Francisco!

Sincerely,
Bertrand H. Newson
General Manager
King George Hotel

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText:
This was our second time at the King George. 
Overall was very happy, it's in a really convenient area with lots of shopping, restaurants and public transport nearby. Free wifi and in room movie purchase very handy.
The room was really clean but really small which didn't bother us too much because we had so many activities planned. 
The beds were not that great though, very hard pillows and lots of street noise so it's really hard to get to sleep and stay asleep.
We would return but perhaps request a different room location because of the street noise.
Good hotel for the price.  Room is little small for two people.
review.locationRemarks: Great location

managementResponses.response:
Dear Marty,
We appreciate your feedback and thank you for your recent stay with us. We‚Äôre pleased you enjoyed the value of our historic location as we sit in the heart of the Union Square shopping and restaurant district and are very close to public transportation. Thank you for mentioning our pleasant and helpful staff and our comfortable beds. We‚Äôd welcome the opportunity to accommodate you again in the future!

Sincerely,
Bertrand H. Newson
General Manager
King George Hotel

review.title: Good place to stay by Union Square
review.reviewText: Old hotel but well maintained, has "character". Comfortable beds, pleasant and helpful staff. Well located to explore the city-convenient to all public transportation. Eateries close by.

Staff was friendly, room was nice. I would have liked a small fridge in the room. 
Some homeless outside. :/
Good place to stay if you are going to be out and about

review.title: KING GEORGE, KING size bed
review.reviewText:
I requested extra pillow and extra towels before my arrival, but nothing. Then I called the front desk and housekeeping, but nothing. Our Valet Parking was supposed $35. We were charged $57. They corrected the charge, but no inconvenience.

We requested a King size bed and for $300 a night it was very small. The bathroom is tiny and all the caulking are dirty. It needs some updating for sure. The carpet is a bit smelly. Our room supposed to get a good view. We had the view of another hotels window. There is no heating or air in the room so we open the door, but the noise of the outside generator is way to loud. We could not stand.
review.positiveRemarks: location. two block to Union Square.

review.reviewText: Nice hotel in a good location, close to Union Square. Lots of shops and restaurants nearby, in a walking distance to the China Town.

managementResponses.response:
Dear KB,
Thank you for your recent stay with us. I'm pleased to read that you enjoyed our convenient Union Square location and our clean, quiet rooms. I‚Äôll be sure to share your kind comments with my team regarding the cleanliness of your room. We‚Äôd welcome the opportunity to accommodate you in the future!

Sincerely,
Bertrand H. Newson
General Manager
King George Hotel

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Convenient location to Union Square, parking, restaurants......clean and quiet. Rooms are small, but who cares?  We don't stay in SF for the hotel room - it is a place to sleep and shower - nothing more.  Great breakfast restaurant next door, greatly convenient.

review.title: Decent basic place to stay
review.reviewText:
The hotel was clean and the staff was accommodating, but the overall condition of things was a bit worn out. The curtains in our room had a large rip in them, we weren't able to plug in our phone chargers without unplugging the clock and lamp on one side of the bed, and one of the windows didn't seem to close all the way. The furniture was very banged up and scratched. The room didn't have a chair, you had to sit on the bed. 

It was perfectly okay and clean if you are looking for a place to sleep at night, but if you are on the sort of trip where you may end up having to stay in your hotel room during waking hours, I would probably stay somewhere else.
review.positiveRemarks: Good price, relatively quiet. Staff was accommodating.
review.negativeRemarks: I felt like the room was in worn out condition.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square area, plenty of shopping, restaurants and touristy things nearby.

review.title: Well located, but service for that price
review.reviewText: Well located. Bad experience booking by Expedia. Prices are higer on Expedia almost 20% than the rates the hotel has if you do it directly. The staff is rude, no vocation for service. They just do their duty. Rooms very small, internet is a nigthmare.

review.title: Not a good experience.
review.reviewText:
Wifi signal was really really bad.  There was completely no signal in the first room so I changed to another room in which I could receive wifi signal only in the bathroom.  

The room was very small.  I could not open my two medium-size suitcases at the same time.

Also,  although the location is good (near to powell street),  there were many homeless walking around after 7pm.  They followed me until I arrived the hotel.  And near the hotel at the corner of the street,  it was the favourite location for baggers and homeless.  I saw them staying at the same place everyday.

There was only a lift in the hotel which was very slow.  I walked downstairs everyday.  Cannot imagine if I lived on above 6th floor.

review.title: Cheapest hotel near Union Square
review.reviewText:
San Francisco has some the most expensive hotel rates in the US so our cost ($250 a night via Expedia) was the most we could afford or justify for a place to stay overnight. The King George is about a long block from Union Square. This is a former single residence hotel so the rooms are small and older.  Clean enough.

I know this is a busy, urban area but it is sad to see the decay of society inches away from paying this much money to stay.  I lived in SF three years so I am not a clueless tourist, just a visitor who moved away.  I was showing friends from Europe the city and it was a little shameful to have to walk around vomit and dog feces to get to a pastry shop where the junkie lady was shouting at us.  This was at the busy outdoor-seating coffee shop down Cyril Magnun (recommended by King George hotel staff, by the way.) Stick with Starbucks I guess?

The parking was $35 a night, self parking and convenient.
review.positiveRemarks: Cost. Cleanliness of rooms. Staff were efficient and friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: Only one elevator for an eight story building with many rooms.  Long waits result.
review.locationRemarks: One block from Union Square.  Cable cars there. Shopping galore. Starbucks and lots of diners and bars nearby.

review.title: Room is the exact opposite of the internet picture
review.reviewText: No air conditioning even though I was told my room had air. Horrible section of the city

review.title: Reasonable value considering location.
review.reviewText: It is well located for anyone participating in the SF Marathon events. Reasonable value for a great location.
review.locationRemarks: Great location for those interested in a shopping experience.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Bert,
Thank you for your recent stay with us and I appreciate your feedback. I‚Äôm pleased you enjoyed our convenient location in the heart of Union Square along with the cleanliness of our facilities. Please accept my apologies for failing to meet your expectations regarding the size of your room and access to ice and snack machine, which are located on the lobby level. We value your business and would welcome the opportunity for you to stay with us in the future.

Sincerely,
Bertrand H. Newson
General Manager
King George Hotel

review.title: This block does not work !!
review.reviewText: While this hotel was ok in cleanlyness, it lacked common items that we take for granite.  One ice machine for nine floors.  One beverage area for nine floors. No snack machines on any floor.   Very small rooms or at least the one we had.  I was told upon checking in that this room was an "upgrade".  I would spend a little more and try to enjoy comforts while on vacation.  I would not stay again or reccommend this hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: See above comments.
review.locationRemarks: Downtown in the city.  Tour pickups were convient.

managementResponses.response:

Thank you for your recent stay with us. We‚Äôre pleased you enjoyed the charm and warmth of our location as we sit in the heart of the Union Square shopping and restaurant district. I‚Äôll be sure to share your kind comments with my team!

Sincerely,
Bertrand H. Newson
General Manager
King George Hotel

review.title: Lots of SF Character
review.reviewText: A great boutique-y hotel for the price.  It had a lot of San Francisco character to it and it was in a convenient location to Union Square.  Don't come here expecting large rooms (although that really goes for all of SF), but you definitely feel like you are in the city.  They had a small bar with a happy hour and prompt service.

review.title: Near the Hotel there is nice cafe Mason
review.reviewText: No condition, general condition works all night and prevent good sleeping.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,
Thank you for your valuable feedback regarding your recent stay with us. I‚Äôm pleased that you enjoyed the value we offer and our centralized location in close proximity to public transportation, Union Square and Chinatown. I appreciate your comments regarding your room and I‚Äôll follow up on the observations for a more efficient room layout. My apologies for the noise you encountered. Please rest assured, this issue is being addressed as part of our ongoing renovations. We hope to have you as our guest again soon.

Sincerely,
Bertrand H. Newson
General Manager
King George Hotel

review.title: Could do better, but at higher cost.
review.reviewText: We stayed for two nights. We had room 818, which is right over the exhaust fan of the diner adjacent to the hotel. This created continual noise and smells. The room had one king size bed and two nightstands, no other furniture. No drawers other than in the nightstands. No place to open suitcases other than on the bed. However, room was clean and renovated.
review.positiveRemarks: Reasonable price compared to surrounding larger hotels.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location within easy walking distance of Powell BART station, Union Square, Chinatown, and F tramway line.

review.title: Close to Union Square, offering tourist facilities
review.reviewText: The one downside of our stay was that the twin-bedded room we had booked (and paid for) had been "given away" when we arrived, and a queen bedded room was substituted; this shocked us but seemed to the hotel staff to be entirely acceptable practice. The queen room was deluxe which was supposed to make up for what we had specified as important to us - 2 beds.  That problem was handled by giving us a "free" cot in the queen room for one night till "our" room was available, and the rest of our stay was fine. SF hotels are expensive but this one seems overpriced for what it offers. Small rooms, with poor closet space, for instance. However, we found it just fine for our purposes --basically a bedroom while attending a conference. Instead of air-conditioning, the room had a good ceiling fan, meaning we could keep the windows closed at night, useful because the hotel is in a busy and thus potentially noisy area.
review.positiveRemarks: It was clean and our maid service was good. Coffee was made available in the lounge early in the morning.
review.negativeRemarks: Pricing.
review.locationRemarks: Just off Union Square  - it has lots of restaurants, a food and beverage store close by. Walking distance to cable car. It's busy and can be noisy.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,
Thank you for your recent stay with us and we‚Äôre happy that you were pleased with our centralized location to the renowned Union Square Area and within walking distance to Moscone Center. We understand that overnight lodging costs in San Francisco can be expensive, which is why we offer prices that are very competitive as compared to our competing hotels in the area. I appreciate your feedback regarding curtains in the bathroom and will follow up accordingly. We‚Äôd welcome the opportunity to accommodate you in the future!

Sincerely,
Bertrand H. Newson
General Manager
King George Hotel

review.title: Great location in downtown
review.reviewText:
Its location is both a curse and a blessing. It is in the heart of downtown at walking distance from the Moscone convention center. It is also close to several convenient public transportation stations to explore the rest of the city. However, this makes the prices in the "very fancy" range, and the hotel does not provide the luxury typically associated with 200 and up $ /night rooms. Indeed, although the room had plenty of space and a nice "old-times" feel to it, there was no "opaque" curtain for the restroom, which means that anyone in the parking structure in front could look at us go to the restroom at their leisure. In addition, the TV listings are among the worst I've seen (barely basic cable-level). The parking is in front of the location (a public parking structure) and costs about 35-40$/day with taxes. The hotel will sell you a pass for slightly more which will allow you to go in and out of the structure as you please (but then, who wants to drive in downtown SF?)
So all in all, the place is totally fine, but do not expect any kind of luxury, even at 200-300$/night.
review.negativeRemarks: Opaque curtains in the restroom (no-brainer)
review.locationRemarks: 5 minutes walk from cable car.

review.title: Not what is advertised
review.reviewText: The rooms are extremely small, and the hotel is very outdated. We had two rooms for five people (one was a 15 year old) and it was very cramped. We had to request a roll away bed four times before we received one. They did waive the $20 fee for the bed because of the long wait. The bathroom sinks were cracked, and the paint was peeling. There was no air conditioning that we could find and only one room had a window that would open.

managementResponses.response:

We are so glad to hear you had a pleasant and memorable stay and that you were pleased with the exceptional service provided by the staff. Happy Anniversary and we look forward to seeing you again soon!

review.title: anniversary trip
review.reviewText: The lobby was clean & nicely decorated. The staff at the desk took care of us right away. Our gear was stored tho it was hours before check-in time. Everyone showed us great courtesy & made us feel secure. The location could not have been better, for dining, dancing & gallery hopping. The day & evening concierges were so helpful, it really made our trip memorable. We will most certainly visit here again.
review.positiveRemarks: It is clean, quiet, & perfectly located. The staff are courteous & knowledgeable. Also, it is tastefully decorated, without excess.
review.negativeRemarks: Maybe an extra hook on the bathroom wall, & the little shower caps that I always forget, would be nice. Nothing major.
review.locationRemarks: There is a Biscuits & Blues just a few doors down, with spicey-good food and great music. Then there are wonderful art galleries very nearby.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,
We appreciate your business during your recent stay with us. We are glad you were happy with the great value we offer, our friendly and helpful service and our central location in the heart of Union Square. Thank you for your wonderful feedback and we hope to see you again the next time your travels bring you to the Bay Area!

Sincerely,
Bertrand H. Newson
General Manager
King George Hotel

review.title: Location and value are great for Union Square area
review.reviewText: Historical building in Union Square area. It is within walking distance of almost anything you'll need in downtown. Price is a good value compared to other options in the area, more comfort than a hostel, cheaper than the five-stars. Front desk staff was out-of-their-way helpful. We stayed a whole week so they offered us a mini-fridge for free, nice touch.
review.locationRemarks: Everything is walkable, from all transportation to Chinatown to shopping. Lots of restaurant choices around, too.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Bruce,
We appreciate your kind feedback and thank you for your recent stay with us. We are glad to read you were pleased with our friendly and courteous staff and our newly renovated rooms. We‚Äôd welcome the opportunity to accommodate you again in the future!

Sincerely,

General Manager
King George Hotel

review.title: Best of san francisco
review.reviewText: Hotel has just finished a complete over haul and its fantastic . Parking at front or in alley for your luggage and a rental return garage on corner . Staff are very courteous

review.title: Convenient location
review.reviewText: 5 min away from a Bart station. 5 mins away from union square. Friendly staff. Hotel has character. Room is small but everything is clean and new. Had not seen any ghosts during my two nights stay here.

review.title: Good value in convenient location
review.reviewText: SF is an expensive place to stay and this is a good value hotel in a central location near Union Square.  It is about a ten minute walk from the  Powell St Bart station so getting there from the airport is not a problem. The staff were extremely helpful and courteous and are one of the  hotels big assets. The decorations were a little tired, but it is going through a remodelling process at presnt and I am sure it will become even more desirable soon. There is a good blues music  venue accross the  street called Biscuits and Blues that I would also recommend if you like a relaxed, low key, live  music experience.
review.negativeRemarks: Decorations a bit tired, but currently undergoing a refurbishment programme. Only one small lift  caused small delays.
review.locationRemarks: Biscuits and Blues club opposite is good. John's Grill is about a two minute walk away on Ellis and they have great steaks.

review.title: Exceeded all expectations
review.reviewText: Perfect location. Exceptionally friendly staff. Rooms a bit small but very clean. First class stay all the way. Would stay  again and will recommend highly

review.title: A typical downtown hotel
review.reviewText:
This hotel is located in downtown SF and it's going through a remodel. The hotel is surrounded by diners and is just steps from city bus lines and tourist buses. The place has an arrangement with a huge parking facility just across the street.
Our room has probably been renovated. It was clean but small without microwave or refrigerator.The doorsteps are narrow. There's only one elevator and it's small, old and slow.  What I'm trying to say is that it's a good place for individuals and couples, but families with young children should take into account some  inconvenience. Again, the location is good and the price affordable.
review.negativeRemarks: Installation of a modern elevator

review.title: Noisy Thursday night
review.reviewText: My sister and I stayed at King George Thursday and Friday. Thursday was terribly noisy due to trash collection and noisy people outside that we could hear ALL NIGHT LONG.Friday was a better night as no noise outside. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Apparently if you get a room with 2 double beds it backs up to the area outside where they do trash collection, but all the other rooms are fine. We talked with other guests and they had a quieter night than us in regular rooms on that Thursday.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice staff, close to restaurants, shopping, and museums
review.negativeRemarks: NO trash pick up in the middle of the night. I could hear bottles clanking against each other all night as they sorted the trash bins.
review.locationRemarks: California Historical Museum, St. Patrick's Cathedral, Yoruba Park

review.title: Great hotel in the middle of Union Square.
review.reviewText: The staff was very friendly and helpful. We enjoyed being right in Union Square close to so many great places.  The room was clean and comfortable. The staff's recommendations on places to eat were excellent.  They also helped arrange a shuttle back to the airport.

Hotel was conveniently located in the Union Square district. It is in the middle of a remodel but didn't notice any issues related to it. Only thing is that walls are pretty thin--or the people in the next room were extraordinarily loud--as we could hear them talking through the wall. But overall good experience, especially because of the reasonable price.

review.title: Okay hotel in Union Square area
review.reviewText: Hotel is undergoing renovations which did not include our room yet.  Rooms are small but okay for two people.  Walls very thin so we heard lots of noise from guests next to us. Staff was very nice and helpful.
King George Hotel staff was very polite and willing to assist in anything we needed.
review.positiveRemarks: It is situated in a good location.  Staff is polite and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Probably I would recommend they find a way to speed up the valet service for the car.
review.locationRemarks: Great shopping right nearby; lots of art galleries.

review.title: Lovely staff and awesome location
review.reviewText:
Fantastic friendly staff and excellent location;)
Was a little noisy at night and small in size.

review.title: Really pleasant boutique hotel experience
review.reviewText: Awesome location. Great customer service. Def a boutique hotel don't expect anything fancy but overall it was a very pleasant experience

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Convenient location of hotel-which made the city assessible on foot. Coffee shops near by served for a quick breakfast spot.

review.title: Comfortable hotel centrally located and with wifi.
review.reviewText: Service was excellant. Staff very helpful & informative & polite. Would highly recommend hotel to anyone.
review.positiveRemarks: Location & warm reception of hotel staff.
review.locationRemarks: Generally walkable distance to main attractions eg Union Square, Market places, Fisherman's wharf.

review.title: Tiny, overpriced, outdated rooms
review.reviewText: The rooms were expensive, but you don't get what you pay for. The rooms were extremely small, looked like they were from the 1970s, and had no air conditioning! I realize San Francisco is not hot, but hotel rooms often are. We resorted to opening the windows, but that came with problems. First, they provided an excellent means for our toddler to potentially fall to his death. Second, the heavy curtains block the open windows preventing air flow. We had to use our luggage to hold the curtains away from the window. Third, there is a hostel directly across the alley, so they get a nice peep show of your misery. We averaged about $300 a night for the equivalent of a $40 motel room.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Guest,
Thank you for your valuable feedback regarding your recent stay with us. I appreciate your comments concerning our friendly and helpful staff and I apologize for the noise issues you experienced As you mentioned, we‚Äôre currently in the midst of a room renovation that will address several of your observations including soundproofing to reduce exterior noise. We‚Äôd welcome the opportunity to accommodate you again in the future.

Sincerely,
Bertrand H. Newson
General Manager
King George Hotel

review.title: Bring your earplugs.
review.reviewText:
The hotel was definitely showing its age and had a room reno underway. My room hadn't been updated yet and was quite tired although reasonably clean. The bed was short and not overly comfortable although I've definitely had worse. Staff were great and as helpful as they could be. For downtown SFO, the price was comparitively reasonable but it wasn't the advertised 3 star... especially with the noise! Oh, the noise!

My room was on the 5th floor facing an alley and the hostel next door. The first night had someone yelling and playing guitar out on the street, followed by road work and garbage trucks emptying dumpsters for what seemed like an hour. Even with the windows closed and heavy blinds drawn 5 floors up, it sounded like everything outside was in the room with me. Ended up with 2 hours sleep in 20 minute chunks. I had hoped that it was an anomaly so gave it another try but no luck. Even worse than the first night and another 2 hrs of sleep. The old single pane glass and the slatted glass that doesn't fully close in the bathroom were poor insulators. Hint - close the bathroom door.

As I had spent a lot of money to attend a conference that I was barely staying awake for, I ended up leaving after 2 nights and booked a better hotel. Had to walk away from my remaining 3 nights payment as there was no refund available from Expedia after check-in, and the hotel said they couldn't do anything since my booking was through a third party.
review.negativeRemarks: Not sure how far reaching the renos will be but please insulate the windows!
review.locationRemarks: Kind of a sketchy neighborhood, especially after dark. Close to Union Square, transit, and Moscone Center

managementResponses.response:

Sincerely,

General Manager
King George Hotel

review.title: At the heart of the matter
review.reviewText: From the welcome to the goodbye it was a great experience. I'll stay here again.
review.locationRemarks: Like it being at the heart of such a vibrant city. Easy getting to a cable car, buses, BART to get around and explore. Lot's to check out and do!

We appreciate your business and hope you visit us again the next time your travels bring you to the Bay Area!

Sincerely,

review.title: Great location and customer service.
review.reviewText: David on the desk looked after us perfectly, the room was clean and recently renovated. All up great value, location and service.

review.title: San Francisco - close to Union Square
review.reviewText: Didn't know the hotel was under renovation - well into 2015. We did receive a newly renovated room, with new twin beds. Very cozy, high ceilings, large ceiling fan ( no air conditioning available), redone bathroom, very clean. A small 3 drawer dresser in the closet along with a room safe, plus a desk and TV, shared night stand. COZY. The beds and linens are very comfortable, but any one over 5'10" will find the twin beds seem short (although that may be the case regardless). Getting in and out of the shower/tub is a little tight - the sink being right beside the tub was handy and helped. Space is at a premium in older hotels, so the tub is a shorter style but deeper then most.
review.positiveRemarks: A chance to stay in a 100 year old hotel with character & modern amenities. Plenty of hot water, complimentary coffee service in the a.m
review.negativeRemarks: More in room storage if a stay is greater than a couple of nights.
review.locationRemarks: A block from Union Square - great shopping, restaurants, tourist hop on hop off bus's - a decent 24 hour diner right across the street.

managementResponses.response:
Dear Jessjax,
Thank you for your recent stay with us while in town for your brother's special occasion! We're glad to read you were pleased with the value and our centralized location in close proximity to all there is to do and see in San Francisco including Union Square, Chinatown, North Beach, and Fisherman's Wharf. We value your feedback and apologize for the elevator delays you experienced, which we have addressed with the construction workers. We look forward to having you stay with us in the future and experience one of our newly renovated rooms.

Sincerely,
Bertrand H. Newson
General Manager
King George Hotel

review.title: Great Union Square Hotel
review.reviewText:
we stayed four nights at this hotel for my brothers wedding. They were at the Four Seasons, almost three times as much per night! and just a 10 minute walk.
Overall we were pleased with the hotel. Wish we had received a renovated room as they looked much fresher and more appealing. However the room we had was perfect for the price and on the inside part of the hotel so no street noise.
Staff was pleasant.
Only down side was that there was construction on going which meant a long wait for the one very small elevator during the two weekdays we stayed.
I would suggest that the construction crew use the stairs or leave the elevator for paying customers staying at the hotel when needed. I was surprised to have to wait for three elevators upon check out, we couldn't take the stairs as we had too much luggage.
review.negativeRemarks: Construction crew should use stairs or free elevator for those waiting who are paying customers of the hotel.
review.locationRemarks: This location is literally in the heart of the city. Union Square, Chinatown, North Beach (Little Italy) the financial district and wharf area are all

review.title: Old and classy. Great location.
review.reviewText: Great little hotel. Lobby was a fun trip to old England meeting San Francisco. Will be close to a 4.5 when construction is over.
review.locationRemarks: Dine and see Union Square

review.title: Staff was not helpful. Place is a dump.
review.reviewText: This is over priced and the staff are not helpful.

review.title: Nice hotel, conveniently located
review.reviewText: Nice, indipendent hotel, conveniently located in union square area. It's a 1915 building - and it' undergoing a renewal. We got one of the just renewed rooms, tiny but clean and tidy. The prrsonnel was kind and the barmzn supersweet anytime i needed hot water to prep food for my baby :).

review.title: overbooked - but excellent
review.reviewText: The hotel was overbooked so I was sent just a couple blocks away to a sister property. Everyone at both properties were very helpful and accommodating. They made the switch very smoothly and while at first it seemed inconvenient to have to change it turned out to be not a big deal at all. The sister property was just as wonderful. Would love to stay at the King George next time and will try again. Thanks for a great transition to your other property tho :)

review.title: Great location, decent value
review.reviewText: While the King George is not a fancy hotel, it is very well located and provides a reasonable value. This mid-block hotel is next door to a great diner, which is known for breakfast, and all the action of Union Square.
review.positiveRemarks: Decent value; nice staff; free coffee; safe.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms are dated but the hotel is going through a floor by floor renovation.
review.locationRemarks: Located in the heart of Union Square and near all modes of transportation. It is a nice walk to North Beach and Nob Hill, as well as the Embarcadero.

review.title: Nice hotel in the middle of downtown!!!
review.reviewText: The bed was a little uncomfortable. The room was small but worked out just fine for us. The are remodeling the oops. Hope they don't raise their rates!!!
review.negativeRemarks: More comfy beds.
review.locationRemarks: We shopped and ate within a few blocks of the hotel. We were so excited about the location!

We hope you visit us again the next time your travels bring you to San Francisco!

Sincerely,

King George Hotel

review.title: Friendly staff, small rooms, kinda shabby.
review.reviewText: The check-in process was rather simple and pleasant. The front desk staff were welcoming and friendly. unfortunately, their smiling facies could not make up for the small rooms, shabby decor, and the run down appearance of the rooms. I will not stay here again until after the renovations (according to a sign in the lobby, the renovations are schedule for 2015).

managementResponses.response:
Dear Erna,
Thank you for your wonderful 5-star review of our hotel! We're glad you were pleased with the value we offer, our friendly and accommodating staff, and our clean and quiet rooms. As you mentioned, we are in the process of renovating our guestrooms and we would welcome the opportunity to accommodate you in the future!

Sincerely,

General Manager
King George Hotel

review.title: Very Nice
review.reviewText: Union Square isn't my favorite place to stay because of its tourist-y aspect but we found this hotel fairly cheap and thought it had a cute/rustic look to it. The staff was amazingly friendly and super accommodating, giving us a room that faced a quieter street and matching our rate for a second night. Yes, the hotel is old but they ARE renovating it. Despite that the building is old they managed to make it very clean and supply you with a modern enough feel. Overall, very satisfied with my stay.

review.title: Very good location for a short stay tourist.
review.reviewText:
The surroundings and continuous traffic makes the hotel very noisy. I wish they put double insulated windows in the rooms to cut the nuisance.
Except this serious problem, we found the hotel OK.
pmmathur
review.negativeRemarks: To improve sound insulation to cut constant noise from street and neighbourhood.
review.locationRemarks: All places of tourist interest in SFO are easily reachable. We could easily take the MUNI buses and cable tram from here making it economical and safe

review.reviewText: The King George is an older hotel near Union Square. It offers good value for money and is clean. They are currently renovating it floor by floor, but we heard no noise.
review.locationRemarks: Union Square is close to shopping and restaurants. The BART, MUNI and cable car transit systems are all within a three block walk.

review.title: Perfect location!
review.reviewText: Just outside the front door and around the corner and you are in the heart of Union Square. We also went to a musical at the Orpheum and took the BART to avoid the hassle of parking. The station was a short walk from the hotel with lots of people out and about making it feel very safe even late at night when we were returning. The hotel was a great find with reasonable rates and a great staff!

review.title: Awesome.
review.reviewText: The queen room was so comfy and I just love the architecture. Friendly and efficient staff. I will go back next time I'm in SF.
review.locationRemarks: Right in the heart of the city. You can do most anything.

review.title: Nice, clean, quite. Close to al our fav places.
review.reviewText: Had a good sleep. Overall it was an excellent stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Location is very close to Union Square.
review.negativeRemarks: None
review.locationRemarks: See above.

review.title: Short stay in SF.
review.reviewText: I had a short stay in the city. King George was close to the event. Comfortable & affordable would stay again

review.title: Excellent way to experience the past.
review.reviewText: I thought the price was right and so I booked a room after reviewing pictures and comments. The place was built in 1914 and is a designated "soldiers quarters" for those headed to the Pacific Theatre of war. If you want to get a feel for what it was like to be someone headed out not knowing their fate, stay here. The rooms are small but adequate for an overnight stay with a historical conversation point.
review.positiveRemarks: The historical significance of place. The friendly staff and clean rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: The bath tub in the room has a corner that should be altered so that a person does not bump their knees.
review.locationRemarks: The location is near a parking structure, liquor store, 24 hour dinner and Union Square.

review.title: For the price, pretty nice
review.reviewText: The room was really small but then again, it's pretty much the reality of downtown San Francisco. Besides that, everyone was friendly and very helpful. I was there with a friend and we both had a single bed which was ok. We're pretty happy of the price we paid and what we got but it's definetly not an "over the top hotel".

review.title: I'll be back
review.reviewText: This is my second stay here. Location is fantastic, Staff are great. Rooms are what you would expect from the price. I convinced two colleagues to stay here this time - both were very happy with the experience.

review.title: Our stay at King George Hotel
review.reviewText: The staff is very friendly and really helpful. We have stayed here once before and enjoyed our visit. We don't have to wait for any assistance weather we want ice or valet for parking. There is always someone to our aid immediately!
review.positiveRemarks: We like the location in Union Square. We like valet parking they offer and the customer service is great!
review.negativeRemarks: Maybe upgrade on the bed quilts
review.locationRemarks: The location is perfect-we came at Christmas time and we were nice and close to shopping ,as well as walking distance to some nice places to eat.

review.title: Great staff, good location, a little worn
review.reviewText: Location is ideal for out of towners, and the staff were very helpful and seemed genuinely friendly. The addition of a free minifridge was an unexpected plus. The room (Queen) was small and dated, though they are renovating the floors below to fresh it up. There was an old musty smell in the "clothes closet" which was off-putting. The room was doused by housekeeping with air freshener every day which masked the smell, but was cloying at the same time. Kept the windows open all the time, which was ok in Feb but would have been too noisy in the summer. Will definitely go back, though will ask for a renovated room next time.
review.negativeRemarks: Speed up those renovations
review.locationRemarks: Two blocks from Union Square, three blocks downhill to Powell Street transit connections, and close to Geary Street for buses across town.

review.title: Boutique Hotel Close to Union Square
review.reviewText: The hotel is undergoing renovations right now. Unfortunately, there was no water available on any floors except the first floor for a number of hours. Once water was restored to part of the building the hotel staff were able to move us to another floor that had water so we could flush the toilet, brush our teeth, take showers, etc. We have stayed here before and really like the convenient location and the fact that the rooms are always very clean. We would stay here again once the renovations are complete.
review.negativeRemarks: Better pillows.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is half a block from the ACT and Curran theaters and two blocks from Union Square.

review.title: Great location for budget hotel
review.reviewText:
The hotel was in a great location. Easy to find for a first time visitor and completely transit accessible. It's easily walkable to many tourist attractions including the cable car, the ferry terminal and chinatown.

My room was small but comfortable and clean. The decor had a very classic feel which was in keeping with the heritage of the building. At the time, the 1st and 2nd floors were under some renovation so the staff made a point of giving me a room as far away as possible which was much appreciated.

Don't expect anything too fancy but it's certainly a great hotel for the budget price.
Hotel is under renovation. It is located within walking distance of most key tourist destinations. Staff is very friendly. Rooms are small, and walls do not block noise.
review.locationRemarks: Nob Hill. Market SQ, Fisherman's Wharf and Pier 39 (20 minute walk). China Town & Little Italy.

review.title: Nice hotel with great city location
review.reviewText: The staff was very friendly and helpful with our public transportation issues. The room was nice and comfortable, though a little on the small side. The location is wonderful for food and shopping and bars, just don't go too far west at night. The lounge happy hour is also nice. It has a very historic feel. We were very happy with it.

review.title: nice to strores and restaurants
review.reviewText: nice hotel, not the fanciest hotel but very pleasant.
review.positiveRemarks: It was close to union square and public transportation
review.negativeRemarks: there should be a voucher for cheaper parkiung of ones car.
review.locationRemarks: as u saud above. public transportation was near by and union square up or down the block. act theatre is near by and other plays are easily gotten tol

review.title: nice hotel in the middle of downtown san francisco
review.reviewText:
enjoyed our stay in this little quiet hotel.
the hotel is quite old but still well kept.
location is a major plus.
staff and personnel are very helpful and friendly.
review.positiveRemarks: two things that are really nice about this hotel are 1) location - downtown area, and very near union square plaza, and 2) friendly & helpful staff.
review.negativeRemarks: - none -
review.locationRemarks: 1 .shop at market st. 2) cable car to hyde st fisherman's wharf, crab lunch, cruise, see the sea lions, and walk back via little italy & chinatown.

review.title: Ok for the price near union square
review.reviewText:
Would have been better if there was enough hot water. Not fun to end a shower with a luke warm rinse. Make sure you rinse the shampoo and conditioner out early on! Concierge was not too helpful on New Year's Eve. We asked him where the action was and he sent us to an area that was closed up tight for the night. What a waste and too late to retrace our steps. We were bummed.

Overall if you need a reasonably priced place in the heart of the city, like the old-fashioned quaint decor, know where you are going, and only take quick showers, the King George is ok.
review.negativeRemarks: More hot water and smarter concierges.
review.locationRemarks: Enough said.

review.positiveRemarks: Great location and easy to find.
review.negativeRemarks: The elevator. Only one that goes up to 9 floors. it was annoying to have to wait so long. The stairs are tiny and spiral that makes you feel sick
review.locationRemarks: I went to Union Square, shopping mall, and close to transportation

review.title: Needs to Be Updated
review.reviewText: Things were fine, it is a good hotel if you want to stay downtown and are just needing a place to sleep for one night. It is a very old building and you can tell because the rooms look and even smell a bit like a really old building. It was fine for the night, but I don't think I would stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: It was near Union Square, close to walk to a lot of places.
review.negativeRemarks: Inside of building needs to be updated.
review.locationRemarks: lots of food and shopping near by.

review.title: Location good for Union Square.
review.reviewText: Right next to a hostel. Bed and room was small but comfortable. Free internet, but better reception at Starbucks next door.

review.title: very good

review.title: Comfortable spot
review.reviewText: Very much liked the location and 24 hour front desk. Room and bathroom clean and acceptable. Great value.
review.negativeRemarks: Parking rates
review.locationRemarks: Shop

review.reviewText: The hotel is well-located and the staff are friendly enough. Room was ok, if basic. Also looked out onto a wall. The wifi is absolutely dreadful - barely works at all. The bar is only open for a couple of hours of an evening. Quite a bit of noise from outside. Pretty sure there are better hotels to be found in the same kind of area for the same kind of price. Not dreadful, but not recommended.
review.negativeRemarks: Very poor wifi
review.locationRemarks: Near to Union Square - lots going on.

review.title: Great location - close to everything!
review.reviewText: Great concierge staff (David) b/c we only had 6 hours in San Fran, told us to take a bus tour which was the best- saw the most things in the least amount of time! Room was basic but had everything you need, clean and quiet. Coffee for breakfast.
review.negativeRemarks: If you like the big huge hotels, this isn't it. It's a great location, has what you need for a hotel, nice decor.
review.locationRemarks: Right in the middle of great shopping, walking distance to tons of things to do, and nice area. Can even walk to China Town!

review.title: good
review.reviewText: good nd clean but small

review.title: Nice hotel, in a good location.
review.reviewText: It's an old building, so don't expect big rooms, and spacious bathrooms, but in San Francisco who wants to spend lots of time in your hotel room? It's clean and comfortable, and the staff are great. It's also in a good location, close to the cable car and union square.
review.positiveRemarks: Locations was great, and the building had old world charm
review.locationRemarks: Close to union square, and cable cars.

review.title: Not worth the Money!!!
review.reviewText: We stayed at the King George for my birthday. When looking for a place to stay, we reviewed the hotel online and it had great reviews with a 3.9 stars. It is DEFINITELY NOT a 3.9, more like a 2. Rooms are not even close to what they show in pics, floors in room SLANT, light switches not up to code, curtains were shredded, BED HARD AS A ROCK, elevator is SMALL and SLOW, need to take stairs most of the time but they are spiral and STEEP, make sure you hold on or you will fall, hotel needs a COMPLETE OVERHAUL!!! Great price, great location, but NOT worth it!!! Pay a little more to stay at a REAL hotel!!! Only good thing about it was that we found an AWESOME place to eat at, the Mason Cafe next door was AWESOME for dinner and breakfast!!!
review.negativeRemarks: EVERYTHING!!!!!!!!!!!!
review.locationRemarks: Great location to Union square, Market and ALOT of shopping

review.title: Christmas Shopping
review.reviewText: We were treated like Queens The staff made sure everything was perfect
review.negativeRemarks: Its an old hotel but kept up very nicely

review.title: Nice Hotel in the Center of Things
review.reviewText:
I always stay here, when I go to San Francisco. The place has character, and some cool help. It's not full-service, but it has that essential "San Francisco Quality".

The place has one, overused elevator..so, be patient.

If you are staying for more then a day, or two, get to know the staff.......it will pay dividends.

The number of homeless people, out front, is no higher, or lower, a percentage then the rest of town....there's little the King George Staff can do about this....especially as the place is pretty interactive on the street level. Just go with it.
great location

review.title: Very good value in a great location
review.reviewText: A somewhat distinguished old hotel in the heart of SF. lobby is quaint and old school, with a bar/ lounge in the back. Staff are friendly and helpful. Rooms are modest but clean and quiet. And you're a block from Union Square and 3 from the Powell St. BART. And in early December, about $100 per night.

review.title: Weekend at San Francisco
review.locationRemarks: Most of sightseeing POI are in walking distance, and those that are not in walking distance are easily accessible by public transport.

review.title: Convenient , clean , downtown location

review.reviewText: Had a great time in San Francisco. Easy to get around. Delicious dining. The room was on the small side but adequate. The bathroom was extreme small. It would have been convenient to have some sort of shelf to put hour toiletries.

review.title: Nice old if you like old. Clean, small. Pleasant
Good central base
review.reviewText: Overall I was made welcome but had little need to have contact with staff otherwise
Rooms are very small but kept really clean. Great service from the staff. It is in the city, so pretty noisy.
review.positiveRemarks: Walking distance to great shopping and to Moscone Convention Center.

review.title: Great for a short stay.
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a wonderful location. I was a stone's throw away from everything I wanted to do. My only problems were that it seems there are little things that could be done to spruce up the joint, that wouldn't even cost much more money, that just aren't done. Like the hotel bar is pretty depressing looking when it could be fun and intimate, and lobby lighting and the concierge desk and waiting area are just sort of sad looking. They could also maximize their space better so there isn't luggage everywhere when you walk in. The room itself was perfectly fine though, except for the bathroom mirror which was peculiar and unacceptably non-functional. I recommend this hotel for a short stay.

review.title: two blocks from Union Square - great for shopping.
review.reviewText: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay. It is close to Union Square and nice restaurants. Nice little bar downstairs that serves Happy Hour for wine and beer. Would stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to Union Square and nice little bar downstairs.

review.title: Very central location and decent price
review.reviewText: Given I found looking for hotels in SF to be rather expensive, the King George was decent value for money. It was a comfortable little hotel in a great location just round the corner from Union Square.
review.negativeRemarks: Only one lift was a bit old and could take some time to wait for. But wasnt the end of the world
review.locationRemarks: Very central, one block off Union Square. Easy to get to from BART station from airport

review.title: Great staff and location
review.reviewText: Great hotel staff and location. Smaller rooms but overall well worth the price paid. Very good restaurant , Cafe Mason, located next door.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: The King George Hotel is the kind of hotels I like to stay all over the world, good price, friendly, convenient location, has a safe in room, quit, good bed, all the essential for me. I stay there mainly to sleep, so it gives me everything I need. Thank you, I will me back.
review.negativeRemarks: The Pillows are too firm
review.locationRemarks: Whatever you like.

review.title: a bit of a disappointment
review.reviewText: Hotel room was clean and the location is convenient, but staff was not very friendly and upon check out there was a manager chewing out one of the attendants behind the desk in front of all the guests. Very unprofessional!
review.negativeRemarks: upgrade room furniture and counter space in the bathroom

review.title: Expecting more
review.reviewText: Rooms are very tiny and kind of outdated along with the 4X4 elevator. Staff was great but get ready for an extreme parking bill.

review.title: Nice historic hotel
review.reviewText: Perfect clean & cozy !! Lov these old hotels !!yes I highly recommend this lovely place !

review.title: Nice staff, cute rooms, "eh" location.
review.reviewText:
I was staying at the King George to attend a conference at the nearby Hilton. The location was very convenient, not only for getting to the conference, but for exploring Union Square, and quickly getting to the Bart/Muni stations.

Unfortunately, I didn't realize that the hotel is well within San Francisco's famous "Tenderloin" neighborhood. I'll let you Google that one for yourself, but let's just say that it's not the best of the city. There are lots of panhandlers, and one in particular would yell at every passer-by asking for a dollar. From about 8pm-10:30pm. Every. Night.

If you want to leave the windows open to get some cool air, you're going to get plenty of street noise. It's still quite loud even with the windows closed.

All that said, the hotel staff were pleasant, the room was cute, and the location was convenient.
review.positiveRemarks: My favorite was the all-white bathroom. White tile, sink, toilet, tub, shower liner. Taking a shower in the morning w/ sunlight streaming in.
review.negativeRemarks: Soundproofing against street noise?
review.locationRemarks: It's super close to Union Square (which has plenty of tourist-targeted shopping/dining) and public transportation.

review.title: Good location and price
review.reviewText: Very cute hotel. A little noisy and parking expensive but it's in Union Square so not surprising. No air conditioning and room was a bit warm. Charming decor and friendly staff.
review.locationRemarks: Great location, perfect for tourists since Union Square is 1 block away. Very convenient for the hop on hop off bus.

review.title: Small room in hotel close to downtown San Francisc
review.reviewText: Room was clean but small. No bathtub. Difficult to get two people in bathroom. Staff provided suggestions for dinner. Right in the heart of downtown San Francisco. Seemed to be a little overpriced for the size of the room.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to downtown San Francisco. Staff friendly.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms very small.
review.locationRemarks: Close to China town, Union square, Powell streel cable car.

Staff 'missed' cleaning ro for the day. When brought to front desks attention
the excuse was they forgot,made mistake,small hotel
small staff, housekeeping gone for they day.
No apology , no effort to correct, this after being assured

review.negativeRemarks: Staff needs customer service retraining.

review.title: King Georges Hotel
review.reviewText: Good location and many things to do around the hotel. This is a old hotel but still ok and clean. The staff was very polite also. The room was small and were no air conditionning....

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText:
good location and simple room, actually nothing special it is just hotel. the single bed seems like small. but it is common.
I think it is general condition hotel... if you do not have special request, you can take this hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: elevator and sightview...

review.title: Nice location! Clean room.
review.reviewText: Glad my friend and I stayed at the King George. The hotel was clean and the staff very friendly and helpful. Our room had two twin beds and was perfect for our overnight visit. We were able to check in early, which made our mini-vacation that much more enjoyable. The hotel is within walking distance of all things "Union Square" as well as Chinatown...and easily accessible via Bart. Would recommend to a friend!
review.negativeRemarks: No ice buckets in the rooms, and the only ice machine is on the main floor.

review.title: Worst hotel I have been to.
review.reviewText: Rooms are very small, room service was not very good, didn't clean the bath, I give it 2.5 from 5, staff were very nice and helpfull

review.title: Best located place
review.reviewText: My best friend and I stayed at this place so we could go to a concert at the America's Cup Pavillion. We ended up taking BART to Powell street which is about a 5min walk to the hotel and then taking the bus to the wharf. Plenty of restuarants and stores surrounding the hotel, walking distance - as it is near Union Square. Staff and hotel in general was perfect - minus the noise but can't expect less from the city life. Definitely enjoyed our stay and look forward to staying here in the near future.
review.locationRemarks: Centrally located and easy to get around by foot.

review.title: Ideal location to explore the city safely.
review.reviewText: This was our third visit and the hotel was just as welcoming as we remembered. Tiny rooms, yes, but well-appointed and comfortable. Handy when arriving by air - just get on the BART train to Powell Station and walk a couple of blocks to the hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Very friendly reception staff, and it's great to be able to leave luggage onsite between checking out and going to the airport.
review.negativeRemarks: Some rooms get a bit of street noise so maybe double-glazing would help in those cases.
review.locationRemarks: It's handy for Union Square - a shopping and transport hub that will get you effortlessly to the rest of the city.

review.title: Pleasantly surprised at quality of King George
review.reviewText:
I was pleasantly surprised at the quality of the King George Hotel. It was nicely furnished and comfortable, and staff were always available and very welcoming.
Having the bar available on the ground floor was a special treat.
review.positiveRemarks: Loved the location near Union Square. Lots of restaurants close by. Very close to main transport routes ie BART, buses, cable cars, and streetcars.

review.title: Location, Location and Location for a good price.
review.reviewText: Hotel was clean and comfortable. The elevator, hallways and rooms were a bit too "cozy", AKA small, but that is to be expected for the price and the area.
review.negativeRemarks: D√©cor could us some sprucing up

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: Always a great place to stay. The price is reasonable and it's in easy walking distance to so many places...Union Square, Chinatown, great restaurants, even North Beach for the physically fit.
review.positiveRemarks: Proximity to attractions, comfortable space, great staff

review.title: Close to Union Square.
review.reviewText: The rooms were very small, and cramped. This was a 2-3 star hotel, with a price tag of 4stars.
review.negativeRemarks: It is just a "basic" hotel, the price is not basic!

review.title: Nice hotel with reasonable rates!
review.reviewText: We stayed here on a brief visit to San Fran. The location is excellent, the hotel staff was wonderful - including the bartender at Winston's, their in-hotel bar/lounge. The rooms were small, but quaint, and seemed very European. With the prices in San Fran, this was definitely a steal, and I would stay again. Highly recommended to those who are traveling on a budget but still want good location, clean hotel, friendly & welcoming staff, and a good experience.

review.title: Small, city-type hotel
review.reviewText: Great location right in the middle of Union Square, right across from a parking garage. The staff was very helpful and friendly but the rooms, while clean , were quite small(but thats what you're going to get in the city if you have a budget)

review.title: Close to Union Square
review.reviewText: The elevator broke temporarily when we arrived, the rooms were very small, there was no A/C, there were gunshots in the middle of the night the night before we left.
review.negativeRemarks: Pillows

review.title: Good location

review.title: Very nice hotel near Union Square.
review.reviewText: My wife and I have stayed in several hotels in the Union Square area, and for the money this was one of the best. The rooms are clean and the staff was very pleasant.
review.positiveRemarks: Just a block up from Union Square, the King George provides a very comfortable room and very friendly staff.

review.title: Water issues.
review.reviewText: Shower head was coming apart and needed to be tightened up before it would work. Water pressure varied from ok to low, and hot water temperature fluctuated,
review.locationRemarks: Water issues.

review.title: Quaint older hotel, in the heart of everything...
review.reviewText: I felt like I was taking a step back in time when I walked into this hotel, especially when I got up to my floor. It really felt like I was staying in a stateroom on the Titanic or something, that was my first thought. Staircase is tiny, twisting, and old-fashioned; it was actually fun to walk down all 9 flights of stairs. Room was decorated nicely, with period decor.. My only complaint was that the bathroom was tiny and did not have any room at the sink to put on makeup, etc. The beds, though comfortable, were smaller twin size beds, and my feet went over the edge. Our room was sort of towards the side/back of the hotel and we had no problem with street noise or noise coming from other rooms - it was quiet even though the hotel was booked up that weekend. This hotel is close to EVERYTHING! Many places to eat and shop surround this hotel. You can walk to Nordstrom and Macy's. Parking is across the street and pricey, though this is San Francisco so that is to be expected. My advice is to take the underground trains/yellow cable cars, which are inexpensive and run nearly constantly. You don't want to drive. Take the tourist trolley car once for a treat, but don't rely on them for transportation, the line was two hours long to get on those.

review.title: I Always Stay Here
review.reviewText: I've stayed here a bunch of times. For the money, it's the best hotel in Union Square
review.locationRemarks: Union Square - Premiere shopping location on the west coast - many good restuarants - In the heart of SF's theater district.

review.title: 5 nights in San Francisco
review.reviewText: Great staff who went the extra to help us secure our lost bags. Handy to the centre of SF and the transport systems. Clean & tidy with a great bar.
review.positiveRemarks: Character hotel. Comfortable room. Close to most amenities & transport

review.title: a convenient place

review.title: Nice hotel in excellent location for a full SF exp

review.negativeRemarks: Need one more elevator or at least one separate for the hotel workers to use.

review.title: Would Definitely Recommend This Hotel!
review.reviewText: My daughter and I enjoyed our stay at the King George Hotel. The room was perfect and not too small. The staff was very friendly. We would definitely stay there again. 7/2013

review.title: Good hotel near Union Square
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a good location, nice atmosphere and mostly in good condition, albeit somewhat dated in places. No air conditioning, but decent, quiet fans that more than make up for it in the typically not-too-hot SF. Overall I had a great stay.

review.title: Nice Older Hotel
review.reviewText: Great staff and room was more than adequate for an older smaller hotel. Desk space for work was small but usable and bathroom was recently upgraded to very nice. Location was perfect for Moscone, Powell Cable Car, Union Square areas. Will stay there again. Nice little bar and sitting area and good restaurants nearby.

review.title: Would definitely stay there again.
review.reviewText: This is an old hotel in a great downtown location. The small rooms were very clean. The staff was very helpful.

review.title: This was a good hotel for a short business trip.
review.reviewText: The room was somewhat small, but very clean. It was just fine for an overnight stay. The bathroom looed newly remodeled and farily roomy for a boutique hotel. The air conditioner did not work very well and had to leave it on all night.
review.locationRemarks: Good locatioin near Union Square. Parking and restaurants were across the street or adjacent to the hotel.

review.title: Tough two days
review.reviewText:
The water pressure was the worst and the water stopped half way through the shower. I had to call outside of the hotel to arrange the internet because no one inside the hotel could attend to it. The elevator was very small (3 people and a bag max). I walked down all 9 flights instead of waiting most times. The lobby was always full of people (the hotel gets a lot of bus tours.)

I asked the concierge to help me get a cab and he was uncaring and unhelpful.

The room itself was okay but near the baseboards there was some wear and tear and there was a hole in the wall.

It's probably a good hotel if you're on a tour but a terrible hotel if you are an individual.
review.positiveRemarks: Location was okay but not safe at night.
review.negativeRemarks: Water pressure, internet signal could be stronger, get HBO. Room needs to be cleaned better.

review.title: DECENT LOCATION
review.reviewText: DECENT LOCATION . ROOMS ARE A BIT SMALL BUT UTILIZED WELL . NO TUB . PILLOWS ARE HARD & COULD HURT THE NECK . COULD IMPROVE THE TOILETRIES. MARIA AT FRONT OFFICE IS HELPFUL & KNOWLEDGEABLE.
review.negativeRemarks: PILLOWS
review.locationRemarks: CENTRAL , NEXT TO UNION SQUARE

review.title: Handicap-accessible means just that
review.reviewText:
Unfortunately we had been confirmed for a handicap-accessible room, meaning an accessible bathroom, which we did not get. I had called ahead to make sure there would
be an accessible bathroom as we are amputees. There was only a stall shower, so they
brought up a shower seat. This helped, but there were no grab bars to use, thus getting
in and out of the shower proved a tricky maneuver. Also, the elevator was extremely slow & we ended up using the stairs (also not advisable for an amputee).
review.negativeRemarks: Not given an ADA acceptable room
review.locationRemarks: Wonderful location near Union Square

review.title: King George Hotel SFO
review.reviewText:
very happy with this hotel and staff were very helpful and friendly. Complimentary coffee each morning, free wireless and computers available in lobby was added bonus.
Area a bit noisy at night as room overlooked dodgy looking laneway. Overall a good experience despite the noise. Will travel with ear plugs next time :)

review.title: Just right.
review.reviewText:
An older hotel, but they are doing renovations to it. Our room was smallish, but clean and certainly enough space for us. The staff were friendly and helpful.
Basically, if you need a safe, clean, private space to crash after exploring San Francisco, this is it. No pool, just a small bar, and no breakfast - not a hotel you could spend endless time in, but really if you're staying here you won't be spending much time in your hotel, the city is gorgeous.
review.negativeRemarks: Mild street noise.
review.locationRemarks: Great location, about 20 minute walk from the Embarcadero, and 2 minutes from Market street.

review.title: Nice hotel, small/clean/functional, bring earplugs
review.reviewText: Union Square is a bit of a zoo, or at least this part of Union Square. Immediately surrounding the hotel are Lori's Diner and Mason diner, both good places to eat and hang out, open late or 24/7. This part is good. Once you venture away from the immediate doorway of the hotel, the SF mentally ill homeless population is impossible to avoid day/night. Not unique to this hotel at all, just know it's a part of the SF 'experience.' Some are pitiable, some are also possibly dangerous. Some are hilarious, like the guy that played Fur Elise on the steel drum just after midnight. Over and over. For almost a half an hour. Hey, it's San Frandisco, it's part of the deal. Search youtube for 'Fur Elise Steel Drum Union Square', it's just what he does... Seriously, bring earplugs, the window in the bathroom is made of slats, not fully soundproof. Random street sounds are audible, even on the 6th floor. I'll stay there again, knowing what to expect and taking it with a sense of humor.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff are friendly and professional. Water in the shower is hot. Clean rooms.
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms are small but if you're in SF, you should be doing stuff outside the room. Shrug.

review.title: Funky older hotel next to Union Square
review.reviewText: Rooms are nice, if a bit small. Staff is courteous and helpful in all needs. Comfortable little bar next to lobby. Biscuits and Blues club right across the street is a fun place for music.

review.title: San Francisco Getaway
review.reviewText: Perfect location near Powell Street, streetcars, Bart Station, shopping, restaurants - everything! We walked the whole city from our hotel and loved it.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location to city center!!

review.title: Convenient for Me
review.reviewText: Worked well for me - right near where I was working!

review.title: Overnight in San Fransisco
review.reviewText: This is a nice place to stay if you want to be centrally located in the city. It was in a nice area not far from China Town (10 min or less walk) and Union Square (3 min walk) We actually walked to Fisherman's Wharf and (45 min one way) back but you can also catch the trolley just a couple blocks away. The building is old but well kept, the rooms are small but adequate. The staff was outstanding! Very accommodating and friendly! We opted for the Valet parking it was a few dollars more than self park and they had our car ready in less than ten minutes each time we took it out. We were very happy with the price compared to all the hotels nearby. Will definitely stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: The Staff was great! and the location was just right to see all the sights we had planned.
review.negativeRemarks: Air conditioning, we couldn't find any
review.locationRemarks: There is a nice little store on the corner where you could get fruit or snacks etc.

review.title: Nice downtown hotel, staff was very helpful
review.reviewText: We had a great time in San Francisco, the hotel was comfortable and the staff was very helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Update a little
review.locationRemarks: Location was good, bars and resturants near by we're very good

review.title: Good choice if on a budget
review.reviewText: A pleasant quaint hotel with smallish rooms compared with some we have stayed. There was a bit of renovation taking place but that did not inconvenience us. Was difficult to navigate to and parking over the street was very expensive and I did not see a solution except questionable locations blocks away. Other than that what an ideal location for seeing things and the diners in the area are very good value.
review.negativeRemarks: None
review.locationRemarks: Very handy for transport to Fishermans Wharf. Walk west of 39 and find Cioppinos Restaurant, great value. Don't miss Catholic Cathedral.

review.title: very noisy
review.reviewText: It's very noisy. Anybody talking in the hallways can be heard loud and clear in the rooms on the floor.
review.positiveRemarks: Located rather close to Union Square Park.
review.negativeRemarks: The locks on the doors should be replaced with ones that provide you with some sense of security.
review.locationRemarks: Well, there's parking nearby. It costs a lot of money, but it's nearby. The Sushi Boat is just around the corner and it's very tasty.

review.title: disappointed
review.reviewText: Staff was not helpful. Room small but clean. One morning without hot water.

review.title: Inexpensive hotel good for business travel
review.reviewText: For travel on business, King George is an inexpensive hotel that's easily accessible to the convention center. I like it because it is a good deal and it has character of the old city. It isn't elegant, but it's clean and the bed's comfortable, except for the stiff foam pillows (thank goodness I bring my own!). There was a lot of construction on my floor (replacing doors). You probably shouldn't have had guests on that floor during the construction. They didn't start working until a reasonable hour anyway.

review.title: Great Downtown Hotel!
review.reviewText: This was my 3rd stay at this hotel and service has always been impeccable. On this stay I need the room to have a refrigerator and thought that I had. When I checked in there was no refrigerator, the front desk responded to my request immediately. A couple of caveats, this is a very old hotel that has been kept up very nicely, so there are things that look a little different from a modern hotel. The elevator is very small, and hold probably 4 people, but it is speedy. The water pressure on the 9th floor took a few seconds before it kicked in. Other than this a very nice Hotel. I especially liked the proximity of the Diner next door for room services and other meals.
review.negativeRemarks: Shower water pressure and small bathrooms
review.locationRemarks: Near Union Square, access to other sites, Walgrens one block away, Trolly, one block over with access to Fisherman's Wharf and all of San Francisco.

review.title: Great for shopping
review.reviewText: It's a little bit expensive for the rate they are charging but the staff and convenient of the location make up and justify what you paid

review.title: Tourists needed a little guidance
review.reviewText:
Everything was fine, but one thing would have made a WORLD of difference to my whole experience of San Francisco: a little direction from the front desk staff. To explain :
The hotel is in kind of a border area. In the immediate surroundings are many beggars and (apparent) street denizens. This in itself is not troubling to me. I work with the homeless and downtrodden in my own town,and I don't feel uneasy about these folks. However, just a few blocks away is an area altogether different, kind of shiny and lovely and rich, with a mall and restaurants, as opposed to the convenience stores and more diner-like eateries immediately surrounding the King George Hotel.
During our stay, I walked all over the city, took the public transport to see friends, etc., but in my exploration I just never happened to turn in the direction of the prettier part of the neighborhood around the hotel.
I admire the generously of spirit toward the homeless in the heart of the city. But it would have been nice to see the other side. One word from the desk clerk offering to acquaint us with the various areas within walking distance would have been so very welcome.
We found the more upscale area on the last afternoon we were there, by accident. I would not have spent a lot of my time shopping or dining in the shiny places, but I would have liked to know it was so close.

review.title: Good value
review.reviewText: Good value hotel in a great location (very close to union square and Powell street cable cars).
review.negativeRemarks: Very noisy, as the windows filter little noise.

review.title: Good for young people who dont mind climb steps.
review.reviewText:
We had a room on the 8th floor. And the first morning allready the elevator was broke.
After walking down all the steps, we asked for a lower level room since we had 4 more nights to go, but when they fixed it, they said it happened very seldom.
So no lower level room.
Day nr 4, again elevator broke down!
Staff did not know how to handle disappointed guest.They could have offered something to drink, while we were waiting!But I guess they knew it wouldnt get fixed soon anyway. So after a while we went up the stairs, 2 levels at the time, as to not get a heartattack or something! It wasnt untill the next morning that we could use it again.
review.positiveRemarks: It was close to Union Square.
review.negativeRemarks: Small room, bathroom had dark tile grout that was suposed to be white.
review.locationRemarks: Location is nice.

review.title: So bad it was laughable
review.reviewText: Lift didnt work, workman started on renovations in rooms around us at 7:30am, after many complaints it took me to threaten them with immediate walk out and demanding my money back along with a bad write up in every online hotel website. having said that, the hotel should be shut down and blown up or totaly remodeled, nothing short of a DIVE.
review.negativeRemarks: staying
review.locationRemarks: cant beat the location

review.title: Great Vintage Character
review.reviewText:
Hotel is 1914 vintage. Lots of character, has been updated not decrepit. Outstanding location to the theaters, train station, and Union Square! Never the less it is old, so rooms are more typically sized for the era, and bathrooms were added some years later - so they too are small. But it all works quite well. Unfortunately the same cannot be said for the one and only elevator. We were on the 5th floor (out of 9), so using the narrow winding staircase was not bad at all, and the staff did offer to retrieve the luggage for all guests. 2 floors higher and I don't think we would have stayed when the elevator quit. Since there is only one elevator, I would have expected more attention to it. It partially failed 2 days before it went out all together, the hotel staff did not seem to include a mechanical service person.

All that said, I would still stay there next time I'm in town.
review.negativeRemarks: Older things need more care and upkeep.
review.locationRemarks: Multiple bars, restaurants and transportation in keeping with the price range of the hotel all in the same block.

review.title: Cute Quaint Hotel
review.reviewText: Great location near all of the tourist attractions. It's close to the BART, taxi stops and bus stations. The hotel is cute and quaint. It's small, but perfect for those who aren't looking to spend a lot of time in the rooms. It was very clean and the beds were comfortable. I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to SF.

review.title: Great place to stay for a weekend in the city
review.reviewText: The hotel was charming. All members of the staff were gracious and helpful. The restaurant recommendations were wonderful. Out weekend was made better by our stay and the King George.
review.positiveRemarks: It was comfortable when we were in the hotel, and walking distance to shopping, restaurants, and art galleries..
review.locationRemarks: Ideally located in Union Square.

review.title: great for tourist or confention guests
review.reviewText: Old hotel in downtown for the price the right thing
review.negativeRemarks: bar and coffee service
review.locationRemarks: just right

review.title: Good value for Union Square area
review.reviewText: I've stayed here a couple of times as location, staff, and price are good. Note that there is no AC in this building, so on those rare hot days in SF, you will be uncomfortable.
