review.title: Good Budget option for business travelers
review.reviewText: Great Location, close to Union Square. Easy access to Powell Station.
review.negativeRemarks: Slow internet connection, the heater kept boiling even when off.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Market Street and a bit away from Tenderloin District.

review.title: Perfect for weekend getaways in the city
review.reviewText: King George is affordable, convenient, and walking distance from Union square, shopping, bars, clubs, restaurants.

review.title: Enjoy the heart of the city
review.reviewText: A perfect hotel to stay while in San Francisco, classic SF style. Hotel is great, truly recommend it to everybody. Very pleasant, comfortable, budget friendly. Centrally located, in a safe part.
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel doesn't have it's own parking. Expensive city parking across the street.
review.locationRemarks: Powell, Union Square

review.title: Historic Hotel in Great Location
review.reviewText: This is my third time over a period of 7 years. As always, the location of the hotel is great, close to Union Square and transit. The hotel, while historic in age, is very clean and well kept. My only complaint is the noise from the street. You might want to get a rear facing room, or wear earplugs, especially on the weekend.
review.negativeRemarks: Street noise.
review.locationRemarks: Great location!

review.title: Not a bad hotel for the price
review.reviewText:
The room with a "queen" bed was extremely small.
Recommend it if you have business in the immediate area (ie within 5 min walk), otherwise the area is dirty and with nothing much to enjoy as a tourist.

review.title: Great location!!!
review.reviewText:
Excellent for the price and great location.
This hotel is located at union square, really close to Market st, Cable car's and Bart station (metro station).
review.negativeRemarks: Just one elevator

review.title: Great location... earplugs recommended!
review.reviewText: Excellent location! Walking distance to lots of restaurants, shopping, Union Square, Market Street, street car, BART, etc. Staff were very helpful - hotel has a great happy hour every day. The hotel is older so rooms are smaller, but still comfortable and bathrooms are clean. Good place to stay for a quick trip if you want to be in the middle of the action. My only 'but' is that the walls between the rooms are thin and you can easily overhear conversations occurring in other rooms or in the hallway...that being said, I would stay here again - but would bring ear plugs!

review.title: Great hotel, central location
review.reviewText:
Central location - My friend and I stayed here on vacation from New Jersey; it was perfect for any traveler, especially those without a car. Less than a 1 mile walk to fisherman's wharf (without even walking up a hill), one block away from union square, 3 blocks from Chinatown. We were able to easily take a metro train from SFO airport directly to union square and were in the hotel/ready to site-see less than 90 minutes after landing. The area is very safe, don't listen to the other reviews.

Staff very friendly - Our first day there the concierge was able to recommend to us the best ways to see the sites, and the best ways to walk around the city.

Room Quality - The hotel is older, but charming. It's extremely clean and well-kept. It is in the heart of San Fran, so the structure of the building is reflected in the smaller room size. However, if you're just a few friends or a couple looking to go away, there is certainly enough space to be comfortable while you're there.
review.positiveRemarks: central location - easily accessible from airport and to major attractions
review.negativeRemarks: Sometimes there is a homeless person or two on the hotel's block, but they aren't creepers and it's like that in all of San fran
review.locationRemarks: CENTRAL - 1mile walk to fisherman's warf, 1 block away from union square and train that comes directly to/from SFO

review.title: SF weekend retreat
review.reviewText: I plan to come back. The location is swell, and I love the atmosphere. Do put on screens to your windows though please.
review.positiveRemarks: The old fashioned classic European atmosphere.
review.negativeRemarks: No screens on the window.. That could be a hazard.
review.locationRemarks: Centrally located in downtown, easy to get to, on a more quiet street which is hard to find.

review.title: Great price, great location.
review.reviewText: Great location, and a comfortable room. Staff were nice.
review.negativeRemarks: When the elevator was busy, as it is small.
review.locationRemarks: Close to most popular attractions and shopping.

review.title: Good Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel overall was great. Needs sound proof windows as to block out the noisy streets of SF.
review.negativeRemarks: Bit squishy and no sound proof/thick glass windows.
review.locationRemarks: Right next to Union Square. Excellent location.

review.title: great value
review.reviewText: Fantastic, safe location. Helpful friendly staff. Comfy clean room. Not five star luxury but hard to beat value for money.

review.title: Nice Hotel, near 24-hour places, for a brief stay
review.reviewText:
I loved the ambiance of the King George Hotel lobby - it felt VERY European and nice. The staff was friendly, and put me in a room on the 10th floor (which in American terms, is the 11th). And they had free Wi-Fi, though I had to call the front desk to get the login info.

The only complaints were (1) the power outlets are very hard to get to - I had to move the television furniture to be able to charge my iPhone; and (2) the ice machine is on the first floor.

A plus: there are a bunch of 24-hour diners and a 24-hour Walgreens nearby. Worth the stay if it's brief and/or you need 24-hour access to things.
review.positiveRemarks: Ambiance, Paintings on wall, European Decor
review.negativeRemarks: Some, but not a lot of sunlight in room; Power outlets HARD to reach!
review.locationRemarks: Location is the best aspect. Right next to Union Square, public transit & 24-hour diners and 24-hour Walgreens!

review.title: Great location, nice price!
review.reviewText: The King George is located close to Union Square and is a perfect, comfortable base for a trip into San Francisco. The staff are really friendly and helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfortable rooms, great staff, hotel bar!
review.locationRemarks: Brilliant, central location, close to main transit lines.

review.title: Great location but not comfy
review.reviewText: Very clean and great located. On the other hand, beds and bedrooms were super tiny! The double bed was very uncomfortable . Sure noisy

review.title: Great hotel for a couple.
review.reviewText: Great Experience, I was looking for a Hotel to get a full experience in San Francisco, close enough to down town and a classic style, and I found it... This hotel was a good decision, small room, but just like a movie scene, very clean and all conditions to get a comfortable experience. I was there for two nights with my girlfriend and we was very satisfied with the selection. The personal was nice and help any time we need some. I'll stay in that hotel again.
review.negativeRemarks: The heater in the room was to old...
review.locationRemarks: Amazing location, close to everything.

review.title: Pleasantly surprised
review.reviewText: Located only a couple blocks from BART. Perfect location! Smaller room, but very clean and friendly staff. Tea service every morning too :)
review.negativeRemarks: kind of small
review.locationRemarks: 2 blocks from BART. Great central location to get out and about throughout all of San Francisco.

review.title: Great little hotel
review.reviewText: We loved the location of this hotel. There were a few homeless people hanging around the hotel when we stayed there and there will most likely be homeless people if you choose to stay here, because it is San Francisco and they seem to be most everywhere. We did not however feel especially threatened by them, there are a lot of tourist areas only a block away so there were always lots of people around. There are lots of restaurants close by and it is only a short walk to Union Square and many other popular spots. Would recommend to a friend and would return again in the future.
review.positiveRemarks: We found the location to be very central. Also the free wifi came in very handy in keeping our friends and family updated back in Australia.
review.negativeRemarks: The only negative was constantly having to wait for the the hotel's only elevator. It was very small and slow.

review.title: Good for a first time in San francisco
review.reviewText:
THe place is good, it has a good location and you are near to multiple bus lines and subway.
I will not recommend this place for a family trip becuase the area is loud and the rooms are small, but if you are visiting the town for the first time and to go everywhere then this is a good option

review.title: King George Hotel
review.reviewText: It was a great value, comfortable, adequate. So close to Union Square!

review.title: Definitely King George
review.reviewText:
Quiet hotel - excellent access to activities in mid downtown
San Francisco - restaurants, theater, etc. As well cable car
and walking make China Town, North Beath and the wharf
very accessiable.

review.title: Pleasant hotel close to shops
review.reviewText:
I arrived in San Fran after a 14 hour flight from Sydney and went straight to the hotel earlier than the check in time. The staff at the front desk was friendly and checked me into a room so I didn't have to wait until the official check in time.

Only flaw of the hotel is the lift, there is only one lift so it does take a long time to get to your floor. I only had to stay one night so it wasn't too bad. I would be weary of the number of homeless in the area as well.

Aside from that the hotel overall was good and I would choose to stay again with them in the future.

Also many places to grab a nice meal like Laurie's diner next door and Macy's just around the corner.

review.title: No more
review.reviewText:
I did not like the smell of the room.
Our closet was VERY small with cables all over the place.
review.negativeRemarks: I did not like the smell of the room
review.locationRemarks: Near to Union Square

review.title: Centrally located, reasonably priced.
review.reviewText: Centrally located hotel. Small bathroom. Slow elevator.
review.negativeRemarks: Elevator. Too slow.
review.locationRemarks: Central for the conference I attended.

review.title: Good location hotel in downtown SF
review.reviewText:
Staff was very nice, allowed us to early check in around noon on a rainy day in SF(normal check in time is 3pm).

Great location, just a few blocks from every transportation in town.

Room was a bit too small for prices but can be compensate with great location.
review.negativeRemarks: Room was a bit too small

review.title: You get what you pay for
review.reviewText: It's an old hotel about to be renovated, so don't expect much till it's been redone. My small room and tiny bathroom were clean but cramped. The staff were fine and internet/computer access in the lobby was a nice convenience. The homeless population seems to be growing around Union Square and can be noisy at night - so beware.
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel's location was perfect for the meetings I was attending.
review.negativeRemarks: The bathroom was tiny, water pressure was awful and the steam heat banged loudly
review.locationRemarks: A great location in a declining neighborhood

review.title: not a good hotel for leisure
review.reviewText: the hotel street is unsafe at all full of drunk people and homless. The hotel is noisy easpically at night we couldnt sleep because of the noise.
review.negativeRemarks: noisy, unclean, no good food in room service
review.locationRemarks: the location is ok but not save at all

review.title: Good price, great location.
review.reviewText: The place is old which accounts for the slow elevator and thin walls. However, it was plenty clean and close to everything I wanted. It also had a comfortable bed and pillows. I would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Right in the middle of everything
review.reviewText: it was a great experience, the staff was real nice, and our hotel was in the middle of everything for San Fransisco.

review.title: Cozy!
review.reviewText: I loved my stay here. The best part was the super helpful concierge. He was awesome whenever we had questions and even stood outside in the cold to hail us a taxi when he couldn't get ahold of anyone on the phone. A muni stop is close, and I felt the location was safe, too. The room was small, but not uncomfortably so. Overall, it was a great stay.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: The staff was friendly and responsive. The rooms are what you would expect for a hotel built in 1933, but it was lovely.
review.locationRemarks: Great location near union square and transit systems

review.title: Suitable for familly
review.reviewText: The most intresting thing about this hotel is the location.

review.title: Business traveler haven!
review.reviewText: Perfect location with a friendly and helpful staff. I used this for one nights stay during a short weekend conference in the Union Square district. There is a bounty of shopping, dining and nightlife choices as well as a short walk to the Chinatown Gates. Although this area of SF is always busy, weekends tend to have the most noise so if you are looking for a place quiet you are in the wrong part of town. I was able to check-in early and they held my bag until I could leave for my flight. Just a few blocks away from Moscone Center and the BART station it was perfect for my stay. I enjoyed the bar downstairs and will consider returning as a weekend getaway. The room and bath was cozy and clean.

photos.caption: we liked it good enough to snap a pic

review.title: Well Satisfied
review.reviewText: The hotel is no frills but very nicely done. It was very low budget for the center of town, and as we did not have high expectations, we were pleasantly surprised. It had the basics of what I need. Clean rooms, friendly staff, comfortable sleeping, good tv., all the bare necessities. We were disappointed it did not have breakfast, but pleasantly surprised by incredibly rich catered coffee. SF sourdough or pastry Bfast is available at any number of nearby places to bring back to the hotel. The dining room is stylishly decorated. The computer and printers work well and were often free. For the price, I would stay at King George again. It is also nice that it has some history.
review.positiveRemarks: clean rooms, comfortable beds, accomodating staff, excellent coffee
review.negativeRemarks: could be a challenge to get a steady lock on the shower temp I guess due to other users
review.locationRemarks: can't ask for more central location to downtown central, surrounding streets safe to walk at night, excellent restaurants and nightlife nearby

review.title: Despite low expectations, still disappointed
review.reviewText: Based on the hotel's history, I was expecting a older hotel, and I was skeptical of what it would be based on the price (less expensive than most I looked at in the San Francisco area near Moscone Convention Center. But even with my fairly low expectations, I would have checked out early if I had the chance. It was older in person than it looked in the pictures I saw online. On the up side: a decent diner next door and within walking distance of Moscone Center. But thin walls, one small slow elevator, beggars on the sidewalk, exposed wiring in the closet, worn carpet and tile, and uncomfortable bed all contributed to a less-than-satisfying stay. I don't think I got my money's worth.
review.positiveRemarks: Diner (Cafe Mason) next door. Reasonable meals for the money.
review.negativeRemarks: Exposed wiring in closet
review.locationRemarks: Half block up the street from Nikko but homeless beggars on sidewalk

review.title: Great hotel within a reasonable budget
review.reviewText: We had a nice stay. The room was cozy, the staff was friendly and helpful.

review.title: Excellent hotel - will definitely be back
review.reviewText:
Beautiful older style hotel. We felt very at home here.
The staff we very friendly and helpful.
It's located in a really convenient location near union square. We were able to explore the whole city using the public transport system.

review.title: 3 star hotel for a 2 star price.
review.reviewText:
Great location, great deal, and a friendly and helpful staff. I read the 1 star reviews before my trip and they are not true except for the street noise. I stay here two nights and the 2nd night I was awaken by some street noise and put in my ear plugs and went back to sleep. I am a light sleeper. It you are a sound sleeper you will not have a problem. I you are a light sleeper then you should know to take your ear plugs with you when you travel.
Remember this: People are paid to write reviews so take them with a grain of salt.
I have not been paid to write this review.
review.locationRemarks: One block from Union Square.

review.title: Perfect location, excellent hotel for the price.
review.reviewText:
Great location. Extremely friendly/helpful staff. The rooms were small but I wasn't expecting much, it's SF. Free wifi. Computers in the lobby to use. Refrigerator by request. Don't pay to
Park at the hotel. There's a lot 3 blocks over on jones St for much cheaper!
review.negativeRemarks: Expensive parking. Small rooms
review.locationRemarks: A few blocks from union square. Super easy to pick up public transportation.

review.title: Small but fine
review.reviewText: There were two of us travelling (not a couple) and we found the stay very pleasant. It was only a 2 minute walk to union square and surrounded by restaurants which is great. The rooms was a little small but it did not matter to us although others who think size is an issue probably better look somewhere else. Many people have commented the noise was an issue.. We had no issue. Would be happy to stay ourselves again. The people were lovely.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to union square, friendly staff, comfy beds, clean
review.negativeRemarks: One elevator and small rooms
review.locationRemarks: Really good if you want a centre spot. A bit of a walk to the what though

review.title: Dont recommend
review.reviewText: In desperate need of sound proof windows! The staff that t I came in contact with were nice, but early in the mornings the cleaning staff was very loud and I could hear them speaking contantly when I was trying to sleep. very rude! they also kept slamming doors constantly. The rooms are very very small. Also the linens on the bed were very uncomfortable. I think they falsely advertise how nice their hotel is and the accomodatins they supposedly have. also they lock the door at night and make you enter through a dark alley, didn't feel safe at all!!!
review.locationRemarks: good location, close to shops

review.title: Good for Conferences/Great Thai restaurant close
review.reviewText: Great place to stay for conferences at Mascone. Old Siam Thai restaurant is right down the street and has wonderful food (and cheap!).

review.title: Location and cost performance are very good, but..
review.reviewText:
When was in SF, from the second half of business trip, it had been cold suddenly. At that night I didn't have any hot water. Of course next day, I could get it too. So I could not take a shower.

Other points were very good, and location also is suitable for shopping. And the room is clean.

On winter season, I cannot recommend.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and hotel itself. And very close to mini store.
review.negativeRemarks: Could not have any hot water
review.locationRemarks: Very good for shopping

review.title: Great hotel in many respects
review.reviewText: friendly staff, very helpful with planning excursions, always responsive

review.title: Small, gracious older hotel
review.reviewText: An older hotel with small rooms that have been updated. Bathroom is small but new, clean and bright. The staff was extraordinarily helpful. There are two computers in the lobby with free internet access and a lounge that serves free coffee and tea in the morning.
review.locationRemarks: A central location with diners as well as expensive restaurants.

review.title: Classic
review.reviewText: Convenient to Union Sq, good restaurants nearby, close to Bart access to SFO. Staff were superior, good price for SF, clean rooms. Would stay here again.

The promise is for a continental breakfast; the reality is coffee and tea. The hotel is 9 stories and there is one elevator large enough to hold 6 people without any luggage. It is old without remodeling (1914). It has been painted over and over. The carpeting wasn't too bad, but it did nothing to cheer the place up, the color tones were muted. The door locks had been upgraded to accommodate plastic card keys. The door jambs looked like they had used a crowbar to remove the old locks. The fragmented wood had been painted! Inside the room with a king bed, the space was limited.No place to put the suite case except the floor. The closet was adequate for us with 6 hanging items. A steam iron and ironing board were offered. The bathroom was tiny: sink, bathtub, shower and commode in a very small area. I lost my balance and fell in the tight space. Hot water was at least 3-4 minutes away. When it get hot it was very adequate and steady temperature wise. A horrible waste of a precious resource in the west. The staircase to the lobby was a tricky to navigate spiral. The outside fire escape was also painted multiple times and the paint was chipping off. The bar was the best, most up to date room in the place. The door to the street had shiny brass fixtures. There it stands, a survivor of the Loma Prieta quake! That's good, but will it stand the "big one"?
review.negativeRemarks: cramped bathroom

review.title: Great Staff
review.reviewText: We were very pleased with the staff during our stay. Everyone we encountered was friendly, cheerful and extremely helpful. The staff assisted with dining options in the neighborhood and suggestions of places to visit during our stay. Their helpfulness made our stay in San Francisco more enjoyable. The building is older but well maintained. It was convenient to shopping and transportation. The noise from the street was somewhat problematic since we had to keep our windows open due to the warm weather.
review.negativeRemarks: Street noise
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient

review.title: smelly room
review.reviewText: This hotel is Ok. Good location, but we checked in, and even though they made me sign that I understood it was a non smoking room, and there would be a charge if we smoked, they checked us into the designated smoking room. The smell was unbearable, a combo of 2 packs of cigarette smoke, and the horrible air freshener they obviously used to cover it up. They did change our room, however we had to sleep in two singles rather than the queen we had booked. Rooms are small, but ok. For the price, I would choose another hotel. But if you are booking here, make sure to demand a non smoking floor

review.title: Pay a little more and stay elsewhere
review.reviewText: Dingy, small and dark. The only thing going for it is the location.

review.title: Wouldn't stay there again
review.reviewText: Hotel is in good location. Very noisy late at night. Alley outside of one side of hotel and cafe on other side of narrow alley with several dumpsters. We were on the third floor. Youth Hostel next to cafe. Teens hanging out in alley from the hostel late at night yelling and laughing, a homeless person going through dumpsters and throwing cans into shopping cart (two nights). A homeless man beating on 5 gallon buckets (woke us at 12:50 am and continued for over an hour. Called down to the desk the first night and complained. Said there wasn't anything they could do. Went to the desk after being kept awake or woken up by noise. Told to come back in the morning and talk to the manager. Went down to desk Saturday am and was told manager won't be in until Sunday. Two nice young ladies said they could move us to the 7th floor and the noise might not be so bad. It wasn't, and we were able to have one nights sleep. Unfortunately we were leaving Sunday morning and had tours booked for the previous two days and we were both very tired on the bus tours and kept dozing on the bus. Wouldn't stay in that area again. Would rather stay in an area where people aren't out on the streets all night.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise outside all hours of the night
review.locationRemarks: Great location. Easy transportation to everywhere, bus, trolley, cable car

review.title: not stay this hotel if you go with family
review.reviewText: It is not worth to pay such higher price but really worse hotel , espcially hotel room quite dirty and also the front desk woman attitude is not nice at all .

review.title: A senior's view
review.reviewText: I am a senior, travelling on my own. I found the room to be small but comfortable and the bathroom very small but adequate. Everything was clean. The staff were polite and accommodating. The location of the hotel is perfect, very close to Union Square and the theater district. Right beside the hotel is the Cafe Mason which provided a pleasant dining experience. At the foot of Powell Street, just a few blocks away, is a large shopping center which contains upscale stores, a large food court and a movie theater complex. I was at the hotel for four days and found it most enjoyable.
review.positiveRemarks: A quiet glass of wine in the very pleasant Lounge at the end of the day
review.negativeRemarks: The single, very slow, elevator
review.locationRemarks: Very central, close to the action

review.title: Interesting Experience
review.reviewText: Nice hotel. Problems: loud union demonstration one block away woke us at 6:30 am 4 of the six days we were there. Fire alarm(false alarm) went off at 6:30 am on one of the mornings the union demonstrators were gone, requiring us to go down 8 flights of stairs to the lobby. Water leaked through a vent above the tub, had to call front desk at 2:30am. Nothing serious. The bar was sometimes closed, sometimes open.
review.negativeRemarks: Location
review.locationRemarks: Noisy

review.title: Okay hotel
review.reviewText: The smell of cleaning agent was very strong and they could not exchange my room. The noise was loud outside since the windows didn't block the noise. Very clean and worth the price but it was those 2 things that bothered me
review.negativeRemarks: The smell
review.locationRemarks: Safe

review.title: Good Location if you don't mind street noise.
review.reviewText: Great location, very close to union square and cable cars. Staff very helpful and friendly. Down sides walls were paper thin and you could hear doors opening and closing. No double glazing so street noise could be heard, especially on Saturday night. 2 out of 3 mornings, I was woken abruptly. Firstly by protesters at 7am on Sunday morning when you had the noise from Saturday night not good and then the final morning fire alarm went off at 7am. It was a false alarm but still annoying.
review.negativeRemarks: being woken up by protesters and fire alarms
review.locationRemarks: excellent location

review.title: great location
review.reviewText:
The rooms were very small but we changed to a larger room with 2 beds and it was very nice.
We walked to ATT park for Giants game. long walk but a straight shot and easy to get there.
review.locationRemarks: good location on Union Square

review.title: Great family hotel
review.reviewText: Great Hotel very clean, very friendly staff, great value for money.
review.positiveRemarks: Turned up in jeans and T shirt and was made to feel very welcome
review.negativeRemarks: Locals are awake very early (bin men etc)
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location for seeing the main areas of San Francisco

review.title: Last Minute Vacation
review.reviewText: The hotel staff is fantastic! The rooms are clean and the beds are comfy! The room was a little smaller than I anticipated but the great staff makes up for it!

review.title: King George
review.reviewText: Enjoyed our stay! Highly recommended!!! Great location!!!!
review.negativeRemarks: One elevator
review.locationRemarks: Great location! Near everything

review.title: Poor customer service...
review.reviewText:
I booked online. Thankfully, before my trip I called to confirm my reservation. They had me booked for the 8th-10th when I had reserved dates for the 10th-12th. First, they told me they were sold out and had no other rooms available. I told them I had reserved the correct dates on the web and had received an email confirmation for the 10-12th that I could show them. They transferred me to a "reservations manager" who gave me the same run-around about having no rooms available. Upon my persistence, she adjusted my dates.
Additionally, I had specifically requested a two twin bed room. In both my original confirmation email and the second confirmation email from the "reservations manager" it was indicated that I had booked and would be checking into a two twin bed room. However, when I arrived at the hotel and checked in, the room I was put in was a single queen bed room. I explained I had reserved a different room and that it had been confirmed twice. The man at the front desk said the best he could do was bring in a roll-away cot to put in the room (which was definitely crowded).
After this experience, based on the "customer service" I received, I would not stay at the King George Hotel again. Furthermore, I would not recommend it to others.
review.negativeRemarks: Customer service, helpfulness, size of rooms
review.locationRemarks: Close to downtown/Union Square, within walking distance of MUNI stops, close to plenty of places to eat and/or get coffee.

review.title: Four days with an ancient monarch
review.reviewText:
The rooms are a bit cozy with an older layout, but clean, and the beds comfortable. Lots of restaurants around and within a couple of minutes walk to theatres and shopping.
A few homeless people around but San Fran is packed with them everywhere and the ones in this area were well behaved.
Nice staff. I would go back.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and staff. Not really close to the special SF sites but you need boutique hotels for anything better.
review.negativeRemarks: The worlds sleepiest lounge although lots of options within walking distance.
review.locationRemarks: Close to the Tenderloin but no real spillover. Three good breakfast places within 200 feet.

review.title: Decent hotel in a Decent Location
review.reviewText: This was a nice hotel and was in a good location in Union Square. The room was a bit stuffy and it does not appear that the air conditioning system was in the best working order. The shower water also took about ten minutes to turn warm/hot. However, the staff was accommodating and the room was small but a decent size. The windows did open, which was a plus and relieved the room of some of its stuffiness. The prices were affordable, which is definitely a concern, particularly when staying in a place like San Francisco (which can run a bit costly).
review.positiveRemarks: Good staff; good location if Union Square is your desired place in San Francisco
review.negativeRemarks: stuffy room; the size was OK but I'm not sure if the air conditioning system was working properly.
review.locationRemarks: Decent Location; however, I would recommend staying in Fisherman's Wharf for those tourists in San Francisco that don't mind being "touristy"

review.title: King George- thumbs up!
review.reviewText: A great place to stay- friendly and helpful staff, very central- it was easy to get to everything, and a very clean, spacious room to come back to and relax in.. perfect!
review.positiveRemarks: It was very central and the staff were were always helpful and friendly. It was a good sized room and it had a very comfotable bed
review.negativeRemarks: There was sometimes some noise at night or in the early morning (from the street). I guess older hotals in the city often don't have soundproofing.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location just 1 block and down a side street from Union Square

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great location for easy access to all of San Francisco. Surrounded by restaurants and shopping. The hotel doesn't have a continental breakfast but the rooms were clean albeit small and the staff was friendly and helpful. Definately a place I would stay again.
review.negativeRemarks: No continental breakfast
review.locationRemarks: easy access to everything

review.title: Good if your just looking for a place to sleep.
review.reviewText: Door locks were tempermental. Sometimes the door got stuck too when even when the key lock turned green. Talked to a maintenance worker there who said that they just got approval to have all the doors replaced. So that problem should get taken care of eventualy. Glass window in the room was very thin, not very sound proof for a busy section of the city. Would be nice if the rooms had mini fridges. Staff was very profesional and friendly. Not a lot of extra space in the room. A good place to stay if you are not planning on spending too much time at the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Could hear a bit through the walls, windows not sound proof, problems with door keys.
review.locationRemarks: Ok location just outside of Union Square.

review.title: Friendly and helpful
review.reviewText: Wonderful staff, very friendly and helpful. Kept our baggages on our last day so we could visit more of San Francisco without carrying our luggage. Friendly maids. Very nice decoration and very quiet.
review.positiveRemarks: The Green & gentle bath products, the overall environment, walking distance to almost anywhere & the quietness.
review.locationRemarks: Walking distance from shopping, restaurants, activities, cable cars, muni, buses and much more.

review.title: Charming
review.reviewText: Hotel is centrally located which was fantastic. Older style was charming but makes for a noisy room. Otherwise experience was good.

review.title: Small for the money, but ok.
review.reviewText: The rooms were very small. More expensive than the price was worth, but maybe thats just the way it is in San Francisco!
review.negativeRemarks: Size
review.locationRemarks: Lots of bums nearby

review.title: Great for city center stay at reasonable price.
review.reviewText: Clean but small small rooms and bath. We planned to spend more time out of Hotel in the city so this worked great for the price. Very accommodating with checkin and helpful concierge.
review.positiveRemarks: Location. Charming and old not dull and new.
review.negativeRemarks:
Need more shelf space and small fridge would
Be nice.
review.locationRemarks: Perfect for easy walking to Mission, Ferry Plaza, Hayes Valley

review.title: Outdated Hotel
review.reviewText: The entire hotel is outdated and dark. It needs remodeling or thorough make-over. The room is small, has no air conditioning unit, limited tv channel/station available for viewing, and bed was not comfortable. There was no continental breakfast. I will not go back to this hotel nor recommend it to family and friends.
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel is outdated and dark. The room is small, has no ac unit, limited tv channel, & bed was not comfortable. There was no continental breakfast.
review.locationRemarks: Hotel is located in Union Square, San Francisco. It is close to restaurants, shopping, public transporations, and tourist attractions.

review.title: Good Place to Stay
review.reviewText:
The service is very good. Staff courteous and helpful. Room small, but clean with good bed.
I'd stay there again.

The Duck

review.title: Downtown SF gem
review.reviewText:
This is a very nice boutique hotel located in downtown San Francisco a short walk from Union Square and other points of interest. If you are traveling to or from San Francisco Intl Airport, it is a very short walk from the Powell Street BART station, which can take you to or from the airport in about 30 minutes or less.
The room was very comfortable. There was no a/c, but in San Francisco, who needs it? The ceiling fan and an open window takes care of things nicely. There is an in-room coffee maker, but complimentary coffee and tea are available downstairs from about 6:45 a.m. onwards. (The in-room stuff is nice though when you have to catch an early flight out, as I did.)
One minor issue - the door lock/key card tended to be a bit cranky at times. The trick was to swipe it very quickly and if that didn't work, keep trying. It generally gave me the green light on the third or fourth try.
review.positiveRemarks: Short hike to/from Powell Street BART station.
review.locationRemarks: Right near Union Square, a short walk to Chinatown, Nob Hill and other sights. And John's Grill nearby for Maltese Falcon fans!

review.title: "RELAX IN AND ENJOY SAN FRANCISCO"
review.reviewText:
Location is great--near buslines, trolley, parking, restaurants and Union Square.
Hotel atmosphere is very clean and quiet and relaxing.
review.negativeRemarks: lack of a continental breakfast
review.locationRemarks: near Union Square, parking, restaurants, public transportation

review.title: A Great Hotel for Exploring the City!
review.reviewText: My daughter and I were in town to visit area colleges, and did not expect to spend our days lounging at the hotel, so our tiny room was perfect for us. We felt comfortable leaving our belongings in this hub while we explored the City, testing all of the available public transit. The King George Hotel was ideal for our needs.
review.negativeRemarks: it's not too sound resistant... the city sounds could be heard for most of the night if we were awake. They didn't tend to wake us though.
review.locationRemarks: PERFECT!

review.title: Nice hotel, central, but noisy
review.reviewText: The hotel was up to date, clean, comfortable and overall pleasant. The rooms were small but had everything I needed. The elevator was old, small and slow. The location is a good thing and a bad thing. It is right in the middle of the action, easy to get to shopping, all types of restaurants, public transit, tourist sights, etc. BUT that means it is NOISY. Street performers at midnight, protests at 7am, tour buses going by with loudspeakers, not to mention normal street noise, sirens etc. If you get a front room, be prepared for noise. It may be quieter in different parts of the hotel, make sure you request a quieter room if that matters to you.
review.positiveRemarks: Location was central, rooms were clean and well-stocked, free wi-fi that worked
review.negativeRemarks: Rooms were small, rooms on the street were very noisy
review.locationRemarks: Easy to get to everything including public transit, fun location, but noisy and close to areas of the city that are very sketchy.

review.title: Good experience in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The hotel is located in a very good place, but the facilities are poor(restaurant).The bedroom smell bad.
review.negativeRemarks: odoors and the poor rooms. Is very old
review.locationRemarks: excellent

review.title: Good value, simple City hotel to sleep at.
review.reviewText: Rooms are small and there is only one elevator, but staff are very nice and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Some tour groups
review.locationRemarks: One block off Union Square and across the street from public parking garage.

review.title: Good one!
review.reviewText: Nice staff, good room and most importantly - awesome location specially if you are looking to go around SF downtown.

review.title: a little small, but nice, clean and decent.
review.reviewText:
It was an older but still decent and nice hotel.
Love free wifi of couse : )
I just wish there was a larger elevator and more than one elevator.
But the location was near Union Square so many stores, shops, restaurants and eateries were not far away at all.

review.title: perfect for couples
review.reviewText: The room was pretty small, perfect for solo travelers or couples. There wasn't a fridge or microwave, which was inconvenient. Overall, the location is great, and the room was really comfortable and nice.

review.title: Ok for one or two nights
review.reviewText: The rooms are quite noisy, you hear the people next door and the toilets flushing in the neighboring rooms.

review.title: Nice little hotel, well worth your money
review.reviewText: The room was on the small side, exactly what you paid for. It would have been nicer if there were fridge and microwave in th room. The location is at Union Square, right at the heart of downtown, really nice. Shopping and food are everywhere. There's a loud music outside that starts at exactly 7 am. I couldn't go back to sleep. Rental car companies are across the street. You could rent a car for the day, return same day to save at least $35 for parking. You don't need a car if you are staying in the city. Local buses run all the time. They are very efficient.

review.title: KIng George is a great hotel in a perfect location
review.reviewText: Quaint, clean hotel. Staff were friendly and helpful. Excellent location for public transportation, restaurants, and anything you might need. We really enjoyed staying here and the concierge was helpful in recommending and assisting with tours and anything you could need. I found it really tough to choose a hotel from pictures and other people's recomendations but I was not disappointed with the King George. I would also highly recommend San Francisco. There is so much to do in this city. Alcatraz, Lombard Street, Chinatown, PIer 39, Fishermans Wharf, Wine Tours, Haight & Ashbury, The California Academy of Sciences, .......
review.negativeRemarks: small bathroom but it has everything you need
review.locationRemarks: great location; close to restaurants, public transportation

review.title: Try another hotel
review.reviewText: We had stayed at this hotel several years ago because of the cheep price and were happy with it then. However I don't think there has been any improvements since. If we had not gotten a deal on the price I would have been very upset. The noise from the street was extremely loud and we are used to living next to a busy street. We were woken up several times every night from the noise. The room was clean but very small and the staff was nice. We never did see a bartender at the bar, maybe its only open during their happy hour specials. I think we will try another hotel next time.

review.title: Good old noisy San Francisco!
review.reviewText: We were hardly in our room except to sleep. We didn't get a lot of sleep due to people shouting in the streets and street performers. The noise subsided at 4am, but due to being right next to the elevator shaft, we heard noisy people leaving the hotel beginning at 4:30am. Bring your earplugs and a white noise maker!
review.negativeRemarks: Crazy noise
review.locationRemarks: Right next to Union Square

review.title: Good Cost and Hotel For the Location
review.reviewText: Staff was very friendly and the location of the hotel was great for the cost. However, it is a somewhat older boutique type of hotel. There is only one elevator so at times you have to wait before you can take it. Also, the rooms are somewhat small even for a king size bed. The room was very clean though. Unless you are big into kicking it at the hotel and enjoying a room that Hiltons and Mariotts offer, I would recommend staying here especially if you are looking more at the cost and location, rather than the amenities. I doubt you will find any place relative in cost in the heart of Downtown San Francisco.

review.title: Great location, small rooms
review.reviewText: Just over a block away from Union Square, close to all the shopping. Great location for the price. Small, but clean and nice rooms. Bathrooms are also small and at least in our room, there was no exhaust fan or other ventilation to keep the shower moisture manageable. We opened our window for a moment - by the way, no view unless you count the building next door and the alley below. If you bother to read the stuff in the binder, the hotel has a great history in San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: Thin walls.
review.locationRemarks: Between O'Farrell & Geary on Mason - which means it's about a block away from Union Square. Easily walkable to shopping and mass transit options.

review.title: Perfect Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel was excellent. The staff was always helpful and cheerful. The room was perfect for our stay. It's location was perfect for exploring the city. One block from Union Square and the cable cars and a very short walk to Market street and the street cars and busses. We will definately stay here again when we return to San Francisco.
review.negativeRemarks: No breakfast
review.locationRemarks: Perfect if you are there for a vacation. The location is a few minutes walk to the cable cars, street cars and busses.

review.title: Good experience
review.reviewText:
We got a nonsmoking regular double with twin beds for 3 nights. The room was clean and comfortable, on the smaller side but not unreasonably so. We could hear some talking from the hallways but people kept it brief enough while we stayed there. The wireless internet was fairly fast and reliable. The staff were professional, friendly and helpful, allowing us to leave our bags at the hotel for a few hours after we checked out, and when I noticed the day after leaving that I had forgotten some items of clothing in our room, I had no trouble coordinating with the housekeeping department in getting those items mailed to me.

Location-wise, it's around a lot of good and affordable restaurants. We weren't looking for that in a hotel, but after some long days of walking, we ended up being very grateful for it. It's also across the street from some car rental places.

Some of the buttons in the elevator didn't light up, and/or pressing the button wouldn't work and you would need to go to a different floor for the button to start working, which would probably kinda stink in an emergency-type situation, but that is really my only note for this place. Overall we enjoyed our stay, were satisfied with our experience, impressed by the customer service and would definitely recommend it to anyone looking to stay in the Union Square area.

review.title: Room So Tiny I Had To Go Outside to Change My Mind
review.reviewText:
I needed a cab. The concierge got up from his desk,out into the street,ran all the way to the end of the block until he secured a cab for me. King George himself would have been impressed with that kind of service.
With hotel rooms, size isn't everything. Get out and enjoy the city.The queen size bed is still queen size.
review.positiveRemarks: Cheerful helpful staff. The elevator was just fine and so were the stairs
review.negativeRemarks: That I had leave and go home. Having served on a submarine, the room seemed spaceous.
review.locationRemarks: You couldn't get closer to Union Square unless you pitched a tent on the grass.

review.title: Lovely funky, charming hotel
review.reviewText: This is a cool old hotel with lots of funky features. The elevator is old and slow, the stairs curvy and treacherous, but the hotel is clean and well-maintained, and very very picturesque and charming. The location is right by Union square - very convenient to Chinatown and downtown. Loved it!

review.title: To Avoid
review.reviewText:
Beer bottle caps left from previous guest, no hot water, noisy, forgot to leave soap and shampoo, and the list goes on.

The concierge was supportive. The location is OK - very noisy. The price exhorbitant.
review.negativeRemarks: Cleanliness, noice
review.locationRemarks: Very central, noisy (night singers till 3 AM)

review.title: Good hotel for the price!
review.reviewText: Friendly staff. The hotel is very well located! Good hotel for the price!
review.locationRemarks: Perfect

review.title: Great hotel experience
review.reviewText: Hotel was a great experience. I could hear everything on the streets but I loved it. After all, I was staying in the city. The staff went above and beyond to help me. I really enjoyed this hotel. The room was clean. It was a small room but I expected that. Hotel was clean. I really had a great experience in this hotel. I would stay again at King George.
review.positiveRemarks: It was located right in the city. Awesome, friendly staff. Great water pressure.
review.negativeRemarks: Bathroom was cold.
review.locationRemarks: Location was great. I could walk to any place I wanted. Cable cars only two blocks away.

review.title: King George Hotel Review May 2012
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was exceptionally nice and helpful. I needed to ship a few books and the staff gave me a box, packing tape and scissors. They also gave me directions to the Post Office.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was very nice and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: The tiny elevator.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is centrally located so it was a short walk to Chinatown, Union Square and several other locations.

review.title: Nice little boutique hotel
review.reviewText: Just about one block from Union Square this hotel offers a great location for exploring the city center. Plenty of restaurants in the area and a parking garage across the street. Looking for a great dinner close to the hotel? Step outside, turn right, turn right again on Geary Street and about one minute walk gets you to the Daily Grill. Great menu, great staff and prices not too bad considering you're in San Francisco.
review.positiveRemarks: Great internet service in the lobby with a printer that has paper in it
review.negativeRemarks: The rooms are small, but adequate for a two people.
review.locationRemarks: Good location with tons of restaurants nearby. Only drawback: street people panhandling outside.

review.title: x
review.reviewText: My stay was very good. The hotel is located in a centrical situation close to the Union square and the moscone convention center.
review.negativeRemarks: small rooms
review.locationRemarks: excellent

review.title: don't stay at the King George Hotel
review.reviewText:
Tiny, out of date rooms. Zero storage space for luggage.
Very noisy, obnoxious labor protest has been going on for 2 years.
Woke us up at 6:30 am.
Inadequate hotel bar (wine and beer only, few hors d'oevres.)
review.negativeRemarks: tiny rooms, exposed plumbing, steam radiator heating
review.locationRemarks: near Union Square, San Francisco

review.title: Short review
review.reviewText: Bery cordial and professional personnel, helpful and knowledgeable. Great location and fair orice.

review.title: Nice if you don't mind losing some sleep
review.reviewText: I just came back from the King George Hotel a couple of days ago. I will keep this review simple. The location is perfect, the staff is friendly and helpful, and the hotel is very clean. I would however not recommend this hotel to a friend for a few reasons. The rooms are very small and for two people we were tripping over each other and our stuff. The walls and doors are very thin, you can hear everything that is going on in the room next to you. Last but not least, the windows are horrible. They were probably installed before I was born. They are very thin and you can hear everything going on in the street. Which leads me to probably one of the most interesting points of my trip. Across the way, protesters gather outside the Hotel Frank and scream on bullhorns for one hour each morning (700am-800am). It has to do with an ongoing labor dispute at that hotel, and while this has nothing to do with the King George you can still count on being woken up everything morning at 7am on the dot. Also beware if you are traveling to San Francisco when it is hot (if it ever gets hot) because I did not see any A/C. The hotel is clean, the staff is very professional, and the location can't be beat but if you like to sleep I would look elsewhere.
review.negativeRemarks: Old, thin windows, loud protesters
review.locationRemarks: excellent if you aren't rattled by homeless people calling you names every morning

review.title: Quaint and fun!
review.reviewText:
I wasn't sure what to expect from the hotel... the rooms are a little small but the charm and atmosphere makes up for that. The staff are absolutely wonderful and always willing to help you with whatever you need.

The hotel is well kept and the employees seem very cheerful! The hotel bar is small but fun and Drew the bartender is fantastic, very funny and helpful and an overall good-guy.

The rooms have iPod / iPhone docks in the alarm clocks which is a nice touch!

The one thing I would say it to try and get a higher room that is towards the back of the hotel to minimize the noise. Also the wireless internet is very slow and unreliable but they are upgrading that.

I would definitely recommend this hotel and I plan to stay here again when I return on vacation.
review.positiveRemarks: The friendliness of the staff and the hotel atmosphere.
review.negativeRemarks: Speed of the wifi and the noise.

review.title: review may 2012
review.reviewText:
Nice old hotel but comfy and modern amenities

That is enough
review.negativeRemarks: far away from elevator/stairs

review.title: Convenient boutique hotel
review.reviewText: Great location, easy walking access to downtown. Not too far from waterfront (20 min walk).
review.positiveRemarks: Easy access to everything I needed.
review.negativeRemarks: If I got the room next to the elevator I would be upset. But I didn't.
review.locationRemarks: Location was walking distance (10 min) from Moscone Conference Center.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Nice Hotel in the City..friendly and helpful staff. Great location.
review.locationRemarks: Great location

review.title: THE BEST!! :-D
review.reviewText:
The staff were super friendly and helpful.

The hotel was gorgeous!

Such a pleasant stress free experience compared to all other places we stayed at so far in California for this low a cost. Just fantastic! You would think it was much more expensive than it was!
review.positiveRemarks: the staff, the decor, free internet
review.locationRemarks:
perfect central location for everything including public transport.
the neighbourhood is prefectly safe and not scary at all!

review.title: King George. Noisy bargain.
review.reviewText: Good value for money. Bring earplugs. The building is old. Be prepared to wait for the (only) elevator if you can't handle stairs, or are above the third floor.

review.title: Great Value and coming home feel
review.reviewText: The rooms are small but comfortable. The Hotel in affordable and everyone on the staff in kind and concerned about your comfort.

review.title: Single Traveller
review.reviewText: Hotel is in great area for a great price. Hotel room is very small but suited my needs as I was travelling alone and did not spend much time in the room. If you are looking for a good deal in a great location this is the hotel for you. It is only a block off union square and two blocks from Trolly acess. I felt safe walking around the area as a young female traveller on her own.
review.positiveRemarks: Location and price of hotel was best.
review.negativeRemarks: Only downside is no fridge in rooms
review.locationRemarks: Locatin is great for nightlife, restaurants, and access to local transit options including the Street Cars.

review.title: A Real Gem
review.reviewText: The King George is a wonderful hotel in an unbeatable location - close to shopping, museums and theaters. To top it off the staff is knowledgeable and very helpful

review.title: Noisy area
review.reviewText:
We have stayed at this hotel many times. The hotel is old and is starting to show its age.
The staff at the hotel is wonderful. The location is ideal. My biggest complaint is that the area around the hotel has gotten very noisy. The noise is especially a problem at night and makes it very difficult to sleep. I know the hotel can't control what goes on out in the street but no matter a lost nights sleep is a lost nights sleep.
review.negativeRemarks: Noise
review.locationRemarks: Close to Union Square. Good restaurants all around the ares.

review.title: Stay for the location, not the room.
review.reviewText:
Location cannot be beat! Even sits at the end of the must-take cable cars that run from fisherman's wharf! The sink had a huge crack and the room was small but
For the price, no complaints!

review.title: Another wonderful stay!
review.reviewText: This was my second stay at the King George. Again the staff was consistantly friendly and helpful- at check-in, check-out, and with assorted questions. The room was cozy comfy, which was very welcoming after long walks around the city. Would consider making this my regular SF hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: I heard a few doors in the hallway slam LOUDLY in the morning, which (fortunately) didn't happen often, but did startle me awake.
review.locationRemarks: Location is ideal. There are plenty of places to eat, public transportation hubs, and a variety of shopping options nearby.

review.title: Annoyance
review.reviewText: The one draw back that the employees don't have any control over is the pan handlers who sit/stand near the hotel. Another problem is that depending on the side of the hotel you're on you might get a lot of reverberation from someone yelling over a bull horn along with his minions who are protesting from a block away in the early morning or late evening hours. It is very annoying if you are trying to sleep or watch tv in your room. The reason for the OK score on the overall score is due to the pan handlers and the protesters noise a block away.
review.negativeRemarks: Pan handlers around the hotel along with union protesters a block away yelling, using whistles and so on.
review.locationRemarks: The location is okay for you have Union Square right there but it's getting past all the pan handlers to get to Union Square or to a bus stop.

review.title: Okay, but probably not twice
review.reviewText:
Overall, it was okay but I don't know if I'd stay here again. There was a demonstration around the block that started at 7am the mornings I was there, and carried on all day. With the windows closed, it was still very loud. Actually, the whole hotel was loud--the walls were very thin and if someone was in the hallway, you could hear everything they were saying. The second night I was there, the elevator broke. They fixed it quickly, but I still had to use the stairs that night. My room was also small and cold, but the bed was comfortable and the linens were clean.

The other thing to note is that the neighborhood is not the best. There are a lot of homeless people begging right outside, and walking back at night felt especially unsafe. It is close to public transit, and there are a lot of restaurants nearby, but if you're coming back after 9:30 or 10, you're probably safest to take a cab to the front door.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff was friendly and accommodating, room was clean.
review.negativeRemarks: Loud, cold, dodgy neighborhood.
review.locationRemarks: It's not a great neighborhood. During the day, it's fine, but at night it becomes really sketchy and the homeless people are pretty aggressive.

review.title: Good
review.reviewText: Room was smaller than in pictures but it was good. Walls look thin but could hardly hear anything from inside the room.
review.negativeRemarks: Room was small
review.locationRemarks: Location is great. Easy to get to and near shopping areas... Very accessible. Great parking across the street.

review.title: Birthday weekend away at the King George
review.reviewText:
I love this hotel. It started 2 years ago,3/24/2010. Came up to celebrate my Birthday. I loved my stay at the King George. Since that I visit SF 3-4 times a year for pleasure. I have shopped around for better deals,here and there and have stayed in other hotels, but The King George has been my favorite. I have stayed here 4-5 times. First of all, they have excellent customer service, and the location works really well. If I have any kind of issue, they have taken care of it immediately. The staff is friendly, and very helpful. I have had nothing, but a great stay while here at the King George, and have nothing but good things to say.
Thanks for eveything KG
review.negativeRemarks: I had an inside room. A lttle view
review.locationRemarks: you r in walking distance to anything you need and want

review.title: Old World elegant charm
review.reviewText: Very cute and comfy. Love the old world charm and compare to newer hotels in the area. Very close to Moscone Center, shopping, eating, cable cars, Market Street, etc.

review.title: Drafty and cold
review.reviewText: The room was very small and the window was cracked making the room drafty and cold. The staff was very helpful though.

review.title: OK for the Budget Conscious Traveler
review.reviewText: Good location. Staff was friendly and room clean. Room was very small and there was only one elevator, which means you sometimes have to wait to go up or down. If you're on a budget this is a place which is nice but not posh. Good price to value ratio. I would stay there again.

review.title: You get what you pay for
review.reviewText:
This hotel is in convenient location and fairly affordable. However, the comfort is rather on the disappointing side: rooms are very old, small; bathroom is very tiny. There's literally a smell of an old house in the room. Curtains do not move which makes it difficult to achieve privacy from outside views.
Personnel is friendly. WiFi is complemantary free but slow, only good for basic web serfing. It was mid of March and hotel was not heated in the afternoon until night time. We had to explicitly ask to enable centralized heating and it took about 30 minutes until it started heating.
review.negativeRemarks: Smell of an old house in the room

review.title: Decent Place to Stay if the Price is Right
review.reviewText: Overall, The King George Hotel is a decent place to stay; however, it is an absolute no frills hotel. The rooms are extremely small, the elevator (only one) is slow, and you'll hardly be able to fit into your bathroom. Additionally, the heating in the room was nonexistent. There is a "selector" on the wall with numbers one through five (one being the lowest heat and five being the warmest). Even with the heater turned up to five, the room stayed extremely cold with noticeable air coming through the drafty window. With that being said, I simply asked for a space heater and the problem was solved for the week. The staff at the hotel front desk are very helpful and knowledgeable of the area which was useful to me since it was my first time in San Francisco. Again, I would not go out of my way to stay at this hotel, but if the price is right, this may be a good place to say.
review.negativeRemarks: Small Room and Drafty Windows
review.locationRemarks: Perfect location next to Union Square

review.title: Great for night owl, but be wary if you like sleep
review.reviewText: The hotel is a good value and the staff was superb overall. I had issues with noise from the street even though I was on the 8th floor. Turns out there is a homeless guy that sets up each night and plays "drums" from 9 to 1 am. Very loud in room and turns out something the hotel staff knows about. The hotel provided ear plus on my first night and called the police to get him to leave. On night two, they again called police but fortunately the rain drove him away. It was only when I expressed my extreme displeasure that the hotel agreed to move me. My third night, which was on the side facing an alley, was blissfully quiet. The hotel also some some hot/cold water mix issues. The location is great. The staff very friendly and helpful. But if you are like me, the top two criteria for an outstanding rating is the ability of the hotel to deliver a good nights rest and a hot shower the next morning. To that end, the hotel fell short. My rating would have been higher if the hotel had been proactive and suggested moving me the first night as they know this guy has been setting up shop every night just outside their hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: had character; staff was very friendly
review.negativeRemarks: noise
review.locationRemarks: excellent - right off union square and close to BART

review.title: Location ok but you can find better
review.reviewText: On the face of it this hotel should be good but the rooms are very small, the water system means you have to wait for hot water, they do not serve breakfast and the place looks shabby and in need of a refurb. They keep the rooms clean enough but the hotel itself not so good, example being the same piece of dropped chocolate in the lift corner for 3 days in a row. Outside the hotel you will be constantly asked for money by the homeless. You can find a better hotel and this is definitely an example of you get what you pay for.

review.title: Too small.
review.reviewText: It was very cramped. I'm not a huge guy (6ft) and everything was just too small

review.title: Nice stay!
review.reviewText:
Staff is extremely accommodating. We were upset at the lack of sleep we got due to homeless man's orchestra (playing free of charge at all hours of the night) which was being conducted in the alley which our room overlooked. We brought the issue to the attention of the hotel and we were permitted to change our room. The next room, which was off the alley, was perfectly quiet all night long.

Overall a great place to stay on a budget. The staff members are very friendly and the hotel is in a great central location, at least for a tourist. Would stay again next time. Thanks!
review.locationRemarks: location is central to all things touristy. lots of public transportation nearby.

review.title: Girls Getaway
review.reviewText: I had not seen my sister in 2.5 years. I live in Orlando and she lives in LA. My husband had a conference in SF for a couple of days so us girls decided to have a mini vacation. I found the King George by accident, the reviews, location and price were good so I booked it for 2 days. This hotel is super clean and the staff was so nice and helpful. It is small but a beautiful historic hotel. If you know that going in, you should have no problems with your stay. Thanks King George for making our reunion a weekend we will never forget.
review.negativeRemarks: the pillows
review.locationRemarks: perfect for market street shopping, catching the trolly, great restaurants and lots of sightseeing

review.title: ok hotel great city
review.reviewText: hotel is clean and employees friendly and helpful. rooms are small, and sounds easily come through the door. several homeless people hang out around the outside of the hotel and can get aggressive when begging for money. san francisico is a great city and the hotel is in a good location to walk to several attractions
review.negativeRemarks: room size
review.locationRemarks: great location

review.title: Handy Location cose to transport
review.reviewText: Hotel is very easy to find, close to transport and has restaurants close by. No breakfast or food available in the hotel but the diner next door does great breakfast. Tourist desk service knowledge can vary by the person. Our room was clean and towels regularly replaced, occasional noise at night but did not really trouble us.
review.locationRemarks: Tours to Napa Valley, Sausalito, Alcatraz, there is plenty to do and see.

review.title: Great Time at the King George
review.reviewText: We stayed at the hotel for 5 nights in February 2012. The location and price are the main attractions to this hotel. We were able to walk and take public transit easily from the location on Union Square. There are many nearby options for coffee, restaurants and shopping. The nearby Walgreens is great for picking up affordable supplies as well. The hotel is not a brand new hotel, but is kept in good condition. We enjoyed the character of the decor. There are some basic amenities missing in the rooms - for example, there are no towel racks in the bathroom so it is difficult to reuse towels. Overall, the staff were polite and helpful and we would stay at the King George again.
review.positiveRemarks: Proximity to public transportation and shopping

review.title: nice staff, small room
review.reviewText: nice staff, small room. The bathroom is freezing ...

review.title: Good Location!!!!
review.reviewText: This hotel is centrally located. Easy access to most of the places. One thing about it is that there are a lot of bumps around the blocks, that's the only complain, but other than that the staff are nice, clean rooms and reasonable price

review.title: Very good small hotel
review.reviewText: Great location. Clean, pleasant, very helpful staff.

review.title: Its the location, only!
review.reviewText:
The pretty much only advantage is the location of this hotel.
Downside is the very noisy and and not really closing windows. (Beware of the temparature!)
ALSO PARKING IS Daily 32 USD plus, no Discounts, We paid more in parking than on the rental car (SUV from Hertz!)
It is really only good for over night or two night stay if you not taller than 1,80 meter and dont have big luggage and are dead tired.
Complementary WiFi mostly disconnects automaticly and is slow.
The guys at the reception did everyting to please us for our 2 weeks vacation after a business meeting of 4 days. But even cleaning the room was not regularly done.

The hotel has a very small layout in rooms and bathrooms, is too old (only one leift for 10 floors) and definetly not more than a two star quality compared to our global experiance.
review.negativeRemarks: Dont expect any hotel quality, its like visit to dusty old grandma with no space!
review.locationRemarks: Exeptional for Dining, Going out and around with no car, Cable Car and Muni Transport around the corner.

review.title: Great Value
review.reviewText: Great value, central location, free wi fi. Average room size, comfortable beds, average bathrooms. Water pressure good. Plenty of hot water.
review.positiveRemarks: location and free wi fi, plus access to 24 hour room service from nextdoor diner
review.negativeRemarks: no breakfast at hotel and bar only stocks beer and wine
review.locationRemarks: central, don't want to wander too far in certain directions, but easy access to cabs, and walking distance to many parts of the city

review.title: The best option for its location and price!
review.reviewText: I had been to this hotel about 6 years ago. Location was great but upkeep was not that good. Since I had a short business trip I decided to try it back. It was the best decision I could have made. The hotel had been renovated, the staff was very helpful and again the location was great (1 block from Union square). I would return to it any time!
review.positiveRemarks: It has become my favorite hotel in the Union square area.
review.locationRemarks: One block from Union square, location is THE BEST for its price.

review.title: San Francisco central hotel at reasonable cost
review.reviewText: A good comfortable hotel of the old style, has everything needed at a reasonable price and a good location.
review.negativeRemarks: None for the price.
review.locationRemarks: Good for sights of SF

review.title: Good weekend
review.reviewText: Great location and helpful staff. Great bartender. No issues wih hot water.

review.title: Average
review.reviewText: Convenient location but rooms are far too small an not particularly comfortable. Complimentary free wifi internet access was nice

review.title: The Goodness of King George
review.reviewText: Great place. Stay here every time. Good location. Nice staff. Comfortable.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Great location, comfortable bed. Walk to anything.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: A very nice hotel in a great location. We found it very comfortable and will gladly stay there again.
review.locationRemarks: very central

review.title: A little small but cozy place to stay.
review.reviewText: It's a very good price to stay in down town San Francisco. There is a Lori's Diner next door, a 24 hr restaurant across the street, and a Jack in the Box across from that. Very convenient to Union Square and a short walk from the BART. The bed was comfortable. Ask for a room away from the street if you are easily bother by street noise.
review.negativeRemarks: A person drumming on plastic buckets across the street late at night into early morning.
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient.

review.title: Commoner George Hotel
review.reviewText: Extremely disappointing! Booked the hotel through Expedia and made sure I requested a nonsmoking room. When I got to the room, apart from being real tiny without any room to open my suitcase, it strongly smelled of air freshener, an obvious sign of a smoking room. I asked for another room and when we got to the door, the key card would not work. The bell boy tried a couple of times in vain, he went downstairs, got another card and again, it would not work... he even forced his foot on the door to make it more stable, still it would not open. They changed me to another room (a much bigger oner) and this time I made sure everything was working... or so I thought... Wanting to take a brief nap before heading to the streets , I pulled the covers and voila, another surprise... HAIR all over, on BOTH beds!! After another trip to the front desk to complain, the problem was solved... which by the staff"s attitude, was my problem, not theirs! The only reason I stayed is that I was so exhausted I did not have the energy to look for another hotel. Thumbs way down.

review.title: Antique Gem
review.reviewText: The room was smaller than I'm used to but that seems to be the norm for larger cities and it served the purpose for my trip (taking my son to college). The room had two twin size beds which worked better than doubles for the size of the room. The hotel seemed to be quite old but was in good working condition and well maintained. Its age gave it a certain ambiance, like a well cared for antique. Bath fixtures were modern. Expedia price was well below posted price in the room itself. Location was central to the area we were visiting and there were several good restaurants within walking distance. Hotel staff was friendly and helpful. If I need to travel out to San Francisco again, I would definitely stay at the King George Hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Old world charm. The hotel definitely had character.
review.negativeRemarks: Room size was a little small. Bathroom window wasn't insulated and it was chilly in the morning and late at night.
review.locationRemarks: Location was perfect for learning about the area where my son will be going to school. Everything was within a reasonable walking distance.

review.title: Bargain
review.reviewText: Bargain in convenient location. Perfectly service-able option though WiFi can be sketchy.

review.title: Great value
review.reviewText:
Being a very old hotel, I must compliment the hotel for upgrading it within the small rooms. The staff were just great!
The reason I like your hotel, is I like the small rooms, unlike most other people.
I will stay at the King George each time I am in S.F.
If I have a complaint, it was I could hear my associate, through the wall, in the next room, snore all night.
Thank you for a very nice stay.
review.locationRemarks: Great location for my business activities and great restaurants.

review.title: Hooray for King George!!!
review.reviewText:
An excellent hotel. The staff were knowledgeable and helpful. Plenty of places to eat in the immediate environs. Easy to park briefly in front, for loading/unloading. we would be
happy to stay there again.
review.negativeRemarks: Too many beggars nearby.
review.locationRemarks: Good; close to Union Square

review.title: Good value
review.reviewText: Clean hotel, good service...great value near Union Square. I'll definitely stay here again.
review.negativeRemarks: Dark room...lack of electrial plugs.
review.locationRemarks: Very close to Union Square and other hotels.

review.title: Noisiest Hotel in SF
review.reviewText:
Rooms are extremely noisy. Bathroom window is louvered and completely open air. As a result, it feels like you are sleeping outside due to the noise. I seriously woke up about 30 times both nights I stayed there because of the intolerable noise. Come on King George, put some decent sound proof windows in the hotel.

The pillows were hard as a rock. When asked if the hotel had any alternative pillows that were softer the answer was no.
review.positiveRemarks: Very nice staff and the hotel itself is pretty nice.
review.negativeRemarks: If you are deaf this is the hotel for you. The noise is very difficult to deal with.
review.locationRemarks: Excellent location close to Union Square. It is really very close to where a lot of the action is in SF

review.title: Cute Hotel!
review.reviewText: Great location! Rooms are small but tidy. Lobby area is nice for meetings.

review.title: Customer Service at its worst!
review.reviewText: I've been to a lot of hotels lately. But never have I experienced an incident wherein I requested a towel for my kid and was refused because the 'manager refused to do so because we have to check out already'. For me that's not only bad customer service I think that's already low class.
review.negativeRemarks: small elevator & tiny rooms
review.locationRemarks: OK. It's near Union Square. But without air-conditioning the street noise can be a little annoying.

review.title: New Years Eve
review.reviewText: The staff was excellent, friendly and very helpful in providing directions to where we wanted to go and arranging transportation.
review.negativeRemarks: pillows could have been softer
review.locationRemarks: very convenient to Bill Graham Civic Auditorium, surrounded by restaurants

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText: Great location, close to a lot of the places worth seeing. Small but cosy rooms. I would stay here again.

review.title: Clean and comfy in a great location
review.reviewText: Room was large and comfortable, and very clean. The bed was also very comfortable. Location was great: only a few minutes walk to Union Square. A little bit of general city noise some nights, but mostly fairly quiet. Some homeless people around, but par for the couse in the area.

review.title: Old...but OK
review.reviewText: This htl was cheap and in the middle of Union Square.....very central....the on/off trolley bus comes down the htl street.....the htl is 97 yrs old and it shows......whilst the room we had was repainted and the bathroom clean, the door to the room was flimsy. Free WiFi was appreciated....staff were friendly. Ok for the price...
review.locationRemarks: This was very central.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Value-priced older hotel, but clean and comfortable. Two blocks off Union Square. I use this hotel for business trips and intend to go back.

review.title: Awful!!!! Don't stay at the King George!
review.reviewText: Room was small, shower was horrible... I will never stay there again.

review.title: Free Internet & good location to Union Square and shopping
