review.reviewText: For business in weekdays, free Internet is must. Then, this is a good location to Union Square and shopping for weekend. Decent service and clean is good!
review.locationRemarks: There are good shopping area, around Union Square and on Market street & Powell. At the end of Powell street at Market Street, there is a terminal of cable car where you can see "Change Direction" of every cable car on a turn table, hand pushed by staff.

review.title: Convenient and central
review.reviewText:
This is a fairly old hotel but is kept clean and tidy and the staff were friendly and helpful. Lack of breakfast is a shame but there are plenty of places close by to eat.
The location of the hotel is fantastic, cable cars, numerous shops and eateries are within 2 or 3 blocks. Compared to rooms we had stayed in on the way here, the room was small but adequate. But the location near to Union Square makes up for that!
review.locationRemarks:
Fishermans Wharf is a must, so vibrant, and lots to see and do.
Union Square is the centre of San Francisco, surrounded by palm trees and fabulous shops.
Alamo Square has the special "Painted ladies" houses, and a street car will get you to all these places.

review.title: Quick weekend in SFO
review.reviewText: I recommend this Hotel, I went to SFO with my brother this weekend and I really enjoy the hotel, the room are enough to rest, is clean and el service is really kind.

review.title: Cozy, simple
review.reviewText: The hotel is not the place to go when looking for luxurious and spacious accomodations. It does, however, feature a comfortable bed, courteous staff, and good quality (not to mention "green") bath soaps. It also boasts a convenient location, with Union Square, and its associated shops and sights, as well as the BART within short walking distance. For a slightly longer but still manageable trek, one can also walk to the Embarcadero. While unlikely to host King George himself, it's a fine place to rest while away from one's castle.

review.title: We enjoyed ourselves yet overlooked the maintenance and room style.
review.reviewText:
Liked the location for Union Square and trolley access.
Nice, friendly Hotel maids and clerks. Extremely small rooms with non coordinated colors, creacked sink in bathroom. Has a nice newer bathroom off the main floor bar area. We really appreciated printing our airplane boarding passes on the guest computers.

review.title: "Wheels Up--- San Francisco, CA"
review.reviewText: An excellent location! A nice hotel that felt warm and comfortable. Friendly staff. Three excellent 24-hour restaurants within a few mere feet of hotel entrance. Close to everything you might want to do while in San Francisco.
review.locationRemarks: Any and all. San Francisco is a city that should be thoroughly explored.

review.title: expensively atrocious
review.reviewText: Entire hotel is super cramped. Bathroom fits one person and my bed had a huge depression in the middle of the mattress. My back hurt constantly while I was there. No HBO/Cinemax with the TV. Room was clean but I can't imagine that you can't do better for the price.

review.title: Satisfied
review.reviewText: For the price it was quite good. Needed to have the window open and the fan running of a night as there is no A/C
review.locationRemarks: Depends on where you want to go. City for shopping, Fishermans Walf for sight seeing and super eating.

review.title: The King of George
review.reviewText: I've stayed at a lot of places in San Francisco. Is this my favorite? No, but for what it was it was good. The location is 1 block from Union Square. When I went, my normal hotel was more than twice the price, and the others i've been to that I would want to return to were either booked or expensive as well. So, this isn't the fanciest place, but it is serviceable, and it isn't bad.

review.title: not bad for the price
review.reviewText: A basic boutique hotel and a good value for the money. I was by myself so that helped because it would have been crowded in the small room for two people. Got a good workout climbing the stairs to the 6th floor because as mentioned in the other reviews the elevator was slow. Internet was poor so had to use my own wireless card. Comfortable bed, good location.

review.title: Cute hotel
review.reviewText: Very comfortable and cleanly. Great location.

review.title: Vintage hotel with charm and a great location
review.reviewText: We chose the King George Hotel from the information and ratings on Expedia. It was built in 1914 and has had some renovations in recent years. The exterior is attractive and the vintage feel of the public areas is nice. The reception desk staff are very friendly and helpful. The rooms are typical of hotels of its age: basic and quite small, meaning that the comfortable queen-size bed doesn't leave a lot of extra space. However the room was clean and adequate, especially as did not spend much time in our room...and who would want to when visiting San Francisco? Also, you are well situated close to Union Square, as well as many attractions, great restaurants and bars, services, car rentals (Reliable Rent-A-Car just across the street rents perfectly good, if not brand new, cars at very low rates) and drugstores. The King George is reasonably priced, especially given its location. My only gripes: the hot water supply was sometimes iffy and the street noise is quite noticable in the room at all hours.

review.title: It was an OK hotel
review.reviewText: It was an OK hotel, in a very central location (5 mins to Union Square). The rooms were rather small, but they were clean. If you are looking for a prestigious or luxury hotel, then it's not King George. But if you are looking for a good location, fairly good price, then that's the one.

review.title: Nice and convenient but noisy neighbourhood
review.reviewText: Generally quite satisfied, but hard to sleep because of the noise in the surrounding streets and alleys.
review.locationRemarks: Quieter residential neighbourhoods

review.title: Perfect if your on a budget!
review.reviewText:
This hotel is a great stay if you are on a budget. It is is dated, and the main negative issue is that the hotel has one small elevator. Combine this with a staircase that comfortably allows one person at a time, then you could be waiting a while. We are early risers so it didn't cause us much trouble.

Also as with all older city centre hotels if your a light sleeper yo will need ear plugs as this hotel does not have sound proofed glazing.

The staff and their service were excellent, especially the room cleaning. The hotel is dated but the rooms were cleaned to perfection every day.

The hotel doesn't do food but has two great diners on either side. Our favourite was Lori's.

In summary a great hotel if you just want somewhere to crash and get a deal as we did through Expedia where we payed half the walk in. I would not stay here for the walk in price, there are better hotels in that price bracket.

review.title: 4 Stars a Stretch for Old King George
review.reviewText: This hotel is old and dated--let's just call a spade a spade. They are doing the best they can, I guess, but there is only 1 very slow elevator, the room doors are old and don't lock well, and the amenities are minimal. The location is not bad for Union Square but can be noisy and seem a little unsafe. There are several nicer hotels in the area, but they probably cost more, so it's up to you. I recommend this hotel on price alone, but for an overall nicer experience I don't think I'd stay here again.

review.title: Very old but we did not spend alot of time in the room. The consigner was excellent.
review.reviewText: The neighbourhood was very sketchy as everytime we came out of the hotel or restaurants we had street people begging for money.

review.title: Perfect location
review.reviewText: Perfect location, however the first night was horrendously noisy but the second and third night were fine - think some people were leaving in the middle of the night. Walls are a little thin and rooms are very small but if what you're after is just somewhere to put your head down at night then this is it.

review.title: Okay
review.reviewText: The only thing negative during our stay was the fact that the room was very small and there was a slight musty smell. The bed was comfy though and we weren't in our room other than to sleep so we were satisfied overall with our stay.

review.title: Nice hotel, good location.
review.reviewText: The King George is a lovely older hotel in a good location. A couple of minutes walk from Union Square and the main shopping districts. Also walkable to SOMA and Chinatown. We didn't walk to the whafe as temperatures were topping 90 (yes in September) but it would be doable. There are plenty of cabs / tourist transport around. At night there were a lot of homeless people directly outside the hotel but they were not threatening and no alcohol allowed outside so really only depends on your conscience. The staff were very pleasant and helpful, the in house bar closes early and serves only wine and beer but perfect for a pre dinner drink. Our room was small (as per previous reviews) and it was small by European standards, just enough room to walk around the bed. The bathroom the same. However, it was well appointed, with coffee maker and really very pleasant. A slightly larger room would have been better but this is reflected in the price you pay. Don't let this put you off unless this really is a big deal for you. The loaction, service and cleanliness make up for this. The bathroom products are also really nice. We would recommend a stay here.

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText:
Hotel in great location (5 minutes walk from Powell Street BART station), and literally around the corner from Union Square.

Lots of places to eat within a few minutes walk from the hotel.

Staff friendly and informative.

Excellent value for money - would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Average hotel in rough area
review.reviewText: Hotel is average - rooms are clean but very small! Proximity to union square and cable cars was great but Mason street is one block away from a really rough area! Loads of homeless People and beggars that hassle you! Spent a lot of time at the wharf and it was a nicer area!!

review.title: medieval themed mid-class stay
review.reviewText: King George is a not bad stay in San Francisco. The location was really good - close to the shops and public transport (eg. BART, cable car) but the area can be a bit dodgy at times though. The hotel facilities maintenance can be improved though I don't know if they intentionally kept the old-ness for the theme. Overall, it is an OK hotel to stay.

review.title: Good hotel with excellent location
review.reviewText: Nice hotel, clean rooms and access to internet and computer in the lounge

review.title: it's OK
review.reviewText: not enough lighting in the room ,needs more furniture to put clothing in

review.title: The Concierge made the place...
review.reviewText:
The only sense of comfort and help we got was from the concierge, Joseph. He was awesome. We got a great tour to Monterey and Carmel from him. He also let us know we would save more from getting a 1 day passport. We saved double what the passes cost us. He was welcoming, greetings and so helpful. He was the center and anchor of the hotel.
Union Square, unfortunately is in the center of town. San Francisco has NO homeless programs for their mentally ill, poor or addicted people. There are homeless people all over. It is very sad to see the condition of these people. It is also difficult to enjoy yourself while people are going hungry, needing a safe place to sleep or pacing back and forth. You know that no matter how much money you give them they need a program that will support them on an on going basis. San Francisco you make millions off the tourists. Why haven't you done something to help your most needy people? The day we left we heard you were hiring more police. You need social programs to help these people otherwise they will be out on the street again.

review.title: So/So
review.reviewText: The hotel was quant and the rooms were small, the service was to be expected. Overall we thought it was way over priced but then again what in SF isn't? The biggest frustration/disappointment was the extremely expensive overnight parking. You would think that the hotel would give some sort of voucher. Valet parking was only a tiny bit more than the overnight parking. Overal we liked it and it was perfectly located for what we were doing (partying at Ruby Skye). We would go back now that we have a better idea what to expect.

review.title: Unfair treatment
review.reviewText:
Mostly a nice hotel, except we were charged an extra half day after being locked out of our room. This has pretty much killed any chance of a return for me, as I do not think we were dealt with fairly.
Earlier discussion with reception about booking airport shuttle and bringing the bags down just prior to 4pm mentioned nothing about strict checkout times, or extra charges. In my experience if this had been so strict it would have been mentioned as we discussed checkout and shuttle bookings. All they had to do was tell us, and they did not mention anything about this incurring extra charges, when we said we'd come down just prior to 4pm.
So on our last day we returned to find ourselves locked out of the room, with the only option to get back in being to pay for an extra half day.
I asked why this was not mentioned to us in earlier discusion or why we were told it would be ok to come down with our bags just before 4pm, but the woman at the desk was not interested. A pity as it was otherwise a very nice stay.

review.title: Great place!
review.reviewText: I really enjoyed this hotel and found their service to be excellent. It is small and has an intimacy that larger hotels can't match. It feels very much like a European hotel.....rooms are small and cozy. Additionallly, many Europeans choose this hotel, which gives it a wonderful continental feel. The concierge, Joseph, is extremely helpful and fun to work with. Lori's Diner, which is right next door, is a great place for breakfast. I would definitely stay at the King George again.

review.title: Mother/Daughter trip to the City by the Bay
review.reviewText:
The hotel is in a great location. It is convenient to multiple modes of transportation - city and tour buses, street cars and cable cars. it is also close to Union Square and the high-end shopping district that surrounds it. There are restaurants on either side of the hotel that serve wonderful breakfasts.

The rooms are small, as should be expected in a city hotel, especially the bathroom. However, there was plenty of space to store luggage and clothing. And the bedding, TV and furnishings appear to have been recently updated.

The front desk and concierge were all pleasant and helpful during our entire stay.

I have already recommeded this hotel for others wanting to visit the city whom are looking for a good location and need decent accomdations at a reasonable rate.

review.title: Great English Hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel was awesome! Great location (except the few homeless people in the neighbourhood, no fault of hotel), large enough room with king bed- perfect for my husband & baby! Helpful staff minded our bags after the late 12noon check out. Safe in room useful, and room was very clean. The only thing I would include would be a fridge in each room. We would definitely stay again.

review.title: Old but very easy hotel
review.reviewText: It's not very model hotel, but very easy one, more life styel.

review.title: Very Impressed
review.reviewText: Great Hotel, staff very friendly and helpful. Though there is no restaurant in the hotel, that is secondary, as there are a number of very good restaurants within a 10 minute walking distance. Only a 5 minute walk to catch Powell and Hyde Cable Car. Well worth the visit.

review.title: King George Union Square San Francisco
review.reviewText: The location of this hotel was our main draw. Candidly if not for a few frustrating issues, I would have rated our stay a solid 4+. Continual issues with the key card reader on the door caused us to have new cards issued half way through our stay. This did not resolve the issue. The front desk did advise me to simply use the phone by the elevator next time and they would send someone up. Definitely a positive action but still not a resolution. More frustrating was the scalding to ice cold shower if used after 7:00am. Moving the handle did not affect any change. This single issue set the tone for the stay and likely would be a deal breaker for future reservations. There is only one small elevator and this was not totally unexpected given the age of the building. The challenge was the only other method of acending/decending was an extremely tight spiral stairway. Staying on the 7th floor this was not a real viable option. The hotel was very clean and well kept, the staff was always polite, and its location is outstanding. Ultimately the above listed issues would not stop us from contemplating a stay at the King George in the future but we would put a price on the drawbacks.

review.title: Nice, reasonably priced hotel
review.reviewText: The room was tiny but clean and comfortable. I appreciated the free wifi and the good assortment of cable tv channels. The location was perfect, close to Union Square and public transportation. I would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Borderline
review.reviewText:
Internet too slow.

Fellow travelers had MAJOR concerns about hot water in showers.

Screwed up my airport transport.

Will not return. Lots of better options in neighborhood.

SF frequent traveler. Two of my kids live there.

review.title: Great central location
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a fantastic location - one block from Union Square, two blocks from Market Street and all the public transport you could ever need, and a 10 minute walk from Embarcadero and the wharves.The staff are helpful (you need to make sure they don't drift off to something else, though) - they fixed a small problem with our booking without any quibbling, and held our baggage for 10 days whilst we went off on a side trip. The neighbourhood, like all of central SF, is a bit dodgy in parts - take the staff's advice on where to go after dark. Despite its central location, noise was at a minimum after 23.00 - a few sirens, but little disturbance from within the hotel itself. The hotel is well maintained, but no disguising the fact that it's getting on a bit, which is part of its character, and didn't stop us enjoying our stay. We were not on a breakfast-included package, so can't comment on the food, but a 24/7 cafe next door provided everything from a full breakfast to a cup of tea at prices that were within our budget.

review.title: Not the brst
review.reviewText: Great location but very small rooms, historic means old and small. While we were there the one and only elevator was out of order for 3.5 days - very inconvenient. Staff was friendly though. Maybe good for a night or so but not for a longer stay.

review.title: Definitely recommend
review.reviewText: I stayed at the King George for 6 nights in June. The room was clean and comfortable and the staff were friendly and attentive. The location of the hotel is great with lots of choices of restaurants and bars. Free wi-fi was also great. The only negative was that the elevator was out of action for most of the stay, however the staff were very helpful in organising for luggage to be carried up or down the narrow stair case. This hotel is well priced for a central location.

review.title: Location and Price = Best in Class
review.reviewText: We booked this hotel based on customer reviews, location and price. The price was unbeatable at under $600 for 4 nights including tax. The location was 1 block from Union Square (Think Times Square if you have not been to San Fran). The customer reviews were dead on if they were positive and off base if they were negative. This is an old building and an old hotel, as such you will deal with the rooms being smaller than the chains but what you will gain will far outweigh that one detriment. You will have a level of service and character that you will never find at a name brand property. You will not be disappointed with the comfortable bed, clean room and windows that open!

review.title: Great Value; Great Location
review.reviewText: The King George Hotel offers a great value for your money at a really great location one block from Union Square and in the heart of the Theater District. If your plans include a show at the Geary or Curran Theaters, this is the place to stay! Everything is within walking distance, including the Market Street "F" Line vintage streetcars. Our room was very clean and comfortable. That said, this is not a "luxury" hotel, so don't expect that. It's a good, clean & very comfortable place to stay. Wifi/computer access is available. Plan on eating at local off-site restaurants; there are many to choose from. This was our second stay here. I know there will be a third stay in the future!

review.title: A Good Option
review.reviewText: My wife and I found the King George Hotel to be a good option if you're interested in being in the heart of the San Francisco. The building is old, but it is clean. Our bed was slightly off it's frame, but the friendly staff had it fixed in no time. TV and style were outdated, but everything worked. The best part of the hotel was its location and price. Although I plan to try some other boutique hotels in the future, I wouldn't mind staying here again.

review.title: Tiny Rooms
review.reviewText: My first room was only a few feet wider than the queen size bed and had a view of ventilation shaft. My second room was slightly larger although you had to close the door to the bathroom to even see the toilet. The staff was nice and it was reasonably clean, but the bathrooms and rooms are tiny and dated.

review.title: Lovely Place
review.reviewText:
Very lovely Hotel, very nice and friendly staff, everything clean and very well maintained and that all right in the middle of San Francisco next to everything to a very reasonable price.

Only two downsides, rooms are very small - but why would you be inside in San Francisco? The other thing is, it is very noisy outside, but I guess that is normal in the middle of a big city. From all the activities we were tired in the evenings and slept like babys anyways - very comfy beds! Also they have a nice bar in the Hotel, all you need is there.

Don't miss to eat at Lori's diner around the corner, great 50s place with 40+ beers on tap!

review.title: King George was Great!
review.reviewText: I was pleasantly surprised at the accommodations of this hotel. The staff were great, the amenities were great, the location was perfect. The room size was also nice for one person. It had a walk in shower and no counter space in the bathroom, but that was just one room. I had a business partner stay in another room and theirs had a full bath. For choosing blind never been to SF before and stayed in the city, this was great for the purchase price. Thank you King George! Definitely will stay again!

review.title: Decent hotel for price
review.reviewText: We thought the hotel was adequate for the price.

review.title: Wonderful Hotel in Superb Location!!
review.reviewText: The King George Hotel is such a gem! It is a beautiful old building with such character, we Loved all the artwork. The location of it couldn't have been better for our first time in San Fracisco, right in Union Square walking distance to everything!!! A short trolley or taxi ride to the wharf. Lori's Diner is right next door and is a great spot for breakfast! The conceirge at the King George were extremely helpful in assisting us with all our plans for seeing San Fracisco. We would definately stay there again.

review.title: Dusty...
review.reviewText: We stayed in this hotel from March 22 to 25. The room was so small and the image was very different from the pictures we looked at in Expedia. Also the room was so dusty. First we thought the room was just dry, but actulally dusty. I don't know why. When we breathed, we coughed a lot. We used a mask when we slept. It helped us a lot. The location was pretty good and we got free coffee in the morning. That was good. But we don't want to stay here again.

review.title: Totally recommend.
review.reviewText: Room was small, but I did expect that. Staff is pretty polite and helpful. I had some issues with the hot water in my first room and they promptly provided me a new room with no hassle whatsoever. Location is perfect. Rates are affordable. I do recommend.

review.title: A Best buy surrounding the union square area.
review.reviewText: compare to the rooms in those five star hotels, it's clean, comfort and cheap. Unless you need to show up your money, I'd say it's a best buy for its price around the union square.

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText: This is a nice hotel, excellently situated.

review.title: Good Choice
review.reviewText: Very pleased with the King George Hotel. Especially the front desk personel, I want to say his name was Erik. Tiny elevator made you realize the age of the hotel but everyone was good about sharing the space. Worth the money, felt safe even when traveling as a lone female for business.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Wonderful experience, small quaint hotel, small rooms but very clean and great customer service

review.title: A Wonderful Holiday
review.reviewText: made even better with our stay at the King George Hotel on Mason. Location is wonderful - staff so helpful and friendly - restaurants and shopping abound - rental cars on the next block we couldn't have asked for better. Okay - the hotel is a bit old and probably hasn't been rennovated for a time, but the room was clean, the bath clean, ample space for our luggage - just an overall super place to "call home" for 4 nights. We'll be back!

review.title: would definitely go back
review.reviewText: great location,small, but nice room, great price for downtown location. parking in lot across the street $$

review.title: Noisy!
review.reviewText:
Room was very small, bathroom tight space with no area to place items. The walls were paper thin. In the halls you could hear conversations in the room and in the room itself you could hear everything from the rooms adjacent. We were awakened in the middle of the night by neighbors.

It was convenient to Bart, Transit, but not worth loosing a nights sleep.

review.title: Stay away
review.reviewText: we didn't ever unpack, room was small and smelled like an adult theatre. We took our luggage and went to the Hilton. Didn't even ask for my money back for that night or the next. If you're a very drunk male and just need a bed to sleep- maybe. Keep the family away from here.

review.title: DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL IF YOU NEED RELIABLE INTERNET ACCESS
review.reviewText: Do NOT stay at this hotel if you need reliable internet access. The wireless network is way over-capacity, and there are not enough wireless repeaters. Internet is very slow and drops out regularly. The management will not do anything to solve the issues beyond resetting the server, which does nothing to address the basic deficiencies of the network.

review.title: JPM Trip
review.reviewText: Arrived early morning expecting afternoon checkin but they had space. Nice. Reception desk was friendly and helpful for the 3 days/2 nites. They include internet connection at no additional charge but it is a "B" and not only slow but dropped connection so often it was nearly useless. The bed was ok but needs to be updated. The pillows were hard and not very comfortable. The shower was good (important to me), the room was clean and while small just fine. Lots of old world charm.

review.title: good
review.reviewText: great

review.title: Excellent staff, great location
review.reviewText: All the staff we encountered were more than helpful and genuinely nice. Juan was especially helpful in looking for a nearby business for us and cheerfuly let us in our room when we locked ourselves out. The location is central to so many things: BART, Chinatown, obviously Union Square and all the theatres too. We didn't use the parking garage right across the street, but rather the one less than half a block up, it was a couple of dollars cheaper. I will return!

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: A short walk from BART and the Powell-Mason cable car line, as well as numerous buses, the King George Hotel felt surprisingly quiet, a feature I liked. Three diners, literally steps from the front door, offered really wonderful breakfasts. My few questions about stores and locations were answered very helpfully by the concierge. When I go back to San Francisco, I'll return to the King George Hotel.

review.title: Will definitely come back!
review.reviewText: The room was small and there's no view outside the window at all, but it's clean and it had everything I need. The location makes it convenient to go anywhere while avoiding the crowds in Union Square. If I visit the city again, definitely I'll go back.

review.title: Great boutique hotel
review.reviewText: So, the King George was a perfect boutique hotel in SF. Some might say the rooms are too small and the city noise too much, but why stay in a city filled with so much energy and life to spend all your time in the room. The rooms were comfortable, the bathroom good (great water pressure in the shower), and clean. The location is unbeatable for the price. You're right around from Union Square and close to so much good fun, music, and shopping. My GF and I enjoyed the character and class, especially the exquisite service.

review.title: Location, location, location
review.reviewText: This is a great location to access all parts of SF. The rooms are small but and clean and have everytbing needed.

review.title: small room in a great location
review.reviewText: The rooms are small but adequate, clean, with comfortable beds. The location is great for anyone who likes to walk. The staff is pleasant and helpful.

review.title: Character Hotel Great especially for the price
review.reviewText: This hotel has a lot of character and free internet. It is close to everything. I would stay again for sure

review.title: Cozy Place
review.reviewText: The King George is an older, but well maintained hotel in a great location in Union Square. It's a short walk to cable cars, shopping, great dining. The staff is VERY polite and knowlegable. They were helpful to me, a single female traveler, and answered many questions. Their recommendations and directions were spot on. San francisco does have a problem w aggressive panhandlers and that was obvious within a block of the hotel, but also all over the Union Square area. I definately would recommend this hotel.

review.title: Great centrally located stay
review.reviewText: We had a late arrival and had called ahead to notify they as such but the hotel had run out of rooms in our category. The front desk immediately gave us an upgraded room without a hassle! This is our second stay at this hotel and we have not been disappointed. This is a quaint older hotel with lots of character in keeping with the feel of San Francisco.

review.title: Good deal, great location
review.reviewText: The room was small, but clean and efficient. The staff was especially friendly and helpful. You're in the city, so there is a bit of street noise (plus the Giants won and were going to the series the first evening I was there), but I think that is to be expected, and a fair tradeoff for the convenient location.

review.title: Well worth it
review.reviewText: We were attending a wedding that was held at the Clift hotel and wanted to save some money so we stayed here instead. Friendly and helpful staff, very clean, right by union square and plenty of different restaurants to choose from. plus there's a hertz parking garage right across the street so the was no need to check in with the valet. Definitely coming back here.

review.title: Great small hotel
review.reviewText:
We have stayed at the King George 6 times over the past few years. It is a great small hotel. The staff at the hotel is always very efficient and pleasant. Rooms are small but very clean. There was a strike in progress at a hotel 1/2 a block away
and it was a bit noisy late into the night.

review.title: clean and comfortable , great location .
review.reviewText: safe and comfortable location , clean and friendly , internet , tv and coffee. What more do you need ?

review.title: Great Staff!
review.reviewText: The staff members at this hotel were outstanding. Very friendly and helpful.

review.title: Location and cleanliness
review.reviewText: Although this hotel is is fairly old and the rooms are on the small side, it is extremely well maintained, location is probably the best in SF, close to stores, metro, Chinatown etc. It reminds you of a good 3 star hotel in Paris. It offers all the conveniences at a much cheaper price than the big chain hotels. For an enjoyable stay, try this hotel, it is fantastic. If you are into spas, overpriced restaurants, swimming pools, dont go there, but it just means that someone else will experience this great place.

review.title: King George Hotel a good pic
review.reviewText: I took my daughter to SF for her 21st birthday. I based choosing the King George on what others had to say about it. Most of the comments were positive and I didn't expect it to be the Carlton as I wasn't paying Carlton prices. The room was clean; we don't care about the age of TV's and such as we don't 'live' in our hotel room. The staff was awesome. The only thing we wished had been better was our twin beds...the mattresses were too soft and by the end of the week our backs were feeling it. We did mention this in the 'comment card' left in the bedroom. Yes, I would use the King George again because it was good value and conveniently located. Lori's dinner (a 50's experience) is just next door and is open 24/7. There is no eating facility at the King George at the moment so you have to find your meals else where. If you plan on visiting different areas requiring a coach, wait until you get to the hotel as they have good rates with various companies, IE: Napa Valley and so forth.

review.title: Close to the action
review.reviewText:
Staff was very helpful and friendly. The room was clean but very small. The bath was also very small. Not much to do to move around but watch TV.
The location was great though close to several restaurants. Most of the time we were checking out Fishermans Wharf and downtown so didn't have to spend a ton of time there. All in all a charming place, just not the most comfortable.
Really close to shopping at the big downtown stores, and not too far from Chinatown. We walked a lot.

review.title: Lipstick on a pig
review.reviewText: This is an old hotel which you cannot hide with a few coats of paint. Old is not always bad but it is here. My room was barely big enough to contain the queen bed and the small circa 1980 tv on the shelf to the side of the bed. The bed was like sleeping on a mattress roll on the floor. It was clean enough and the price was ok for SF but I will not stay here again.

review.title: Great location and friendly staff!
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel was great! There were great restaurants close by (Mortons) and close to cable cars and buses to easily get around town. We loved this hotel and would love to stay here again! The staff was more than helpful, our room was small, but very comfortable. It was clean, and by the second day it felt like we were staying with friends. And you have to have a drink at their bar during happy hour, because they have a bartendar there, Drew, who is full of personality and lots of fun to talk and laugh with. Again, this hotel may be small, but has alot of heart and soul for your money. We'll be back.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText:
The hotel is in a great location near Union Square with Market Street, Chinatown and Little Italy located nearby. The rooms were small but clean and nicely decorated.

Our only disappointment was that there was no complimentary wine but a charged happy hour.

review.title: Best & Safest Place in Town, especially for Children
review.reviewText: The location is great and easy to get to - weather you are driving on the 101 or from the marina. Restaurants, shops, parking lots, are exremely close by...and the surrounding area is safe. I was there with my daughter and we lost track of time and were out til like 10pm - I was so surprised to how close and convenient all the restaurants and shops are - really safe. The hotel was very neat and fun - extremely clean and the room even thought the hotel is old it smelled CLEAN - and it was not noise like other hotels in the same area. Hot water and AC were just fine and no complaints at all - will return to the same hotel in November for our anual trip.

review.title: Would definitely go back.
review.reviewText: King George is a friendly, busy hotel in the middle of San Francisco. It's extremely convenient if you don't want to rent a car. Me & my family got all around S.F. by using public transportation and walking. I would definitely recommend it to friends and would definitely return in the future. And, the deal we got through Expedia could not be matched.

review.title: Good location, reasonable hotel
review.reviewText: We had a room on the street-side, which was very noisy at night (no possibility of opening up the windows and trying to fall asleep at the same time). Hotel feels a bit old, but free wi-fi in the rooms, free computers in the lobby, great location (very close to Union Square, BART-station, loads of breakfast possibilities in surrounding streets). If you're looking for a hotel to spend little time in, this is your pick. But if you sounds wake you up, ask for a room at the backside of the hotel.

review.title: Will go back if there is no rooms available at Baldwin hotel:)
review.reviewText: Location is perfect, price is very good. Definitely will be be back if there is no room available at Baldwin. They offer almost the same for the less price.

review.title: Go see Drew at Happy Hour
review.reviewText: great litle hotel

review.title: Going Back for the price
review.reviewText: The location is great. I checked in and asked for a view and I was given a room facing the street and it was tiny on the 3rd floor. We couldn't sleep during the night because we heard trash trucks all night long, and there is a parking lot directly across the street. The next morning we asked for another room on a higher floor it was much larger and much quieter. Yes, we would go back again for the price. The rooms were clean and comfortable and you are in Union Square.

review.title: Reasonable rate for a nice room
review.reviewText: Rate available through Expedia was very reasonable. I was attending a conference in another hotel about one block away. By staying at the King George Hotel, I was able to save about 45%.

review.title: Central Location
review.reviewText: Hotel rooms were small as previous reviews have said. Corridors were noisy and staff filling up cleaners cupboards late at night were not welcomed. Hotel close to all amenities. Something to be aware of, the parking rate per night is very expensive.

review.title: Enjoy San Francisco reasonably
review.reviewText: I was satisfied with the hotel. I was older but it was clean. The rooms were small but I felt that was fine since we just needed a place to sleep. The only other thing to know is there are a lot of homeless people and the area they live in is a few blocks away from the hotel. Otherwise the location was great. We had drinks at the bar one night which was wonderful and the staff are very accomodating.

review.title: If You Just Need a Bed and Shower
review.reviewText: The King George is conveniently located near Union Square and Chinatown and is only a quick walk away from City Hall. It's also very close to BART and other forms of public transportation. As for the hotel itself, while the rooms are very small, it has more than enough for those who spend the majority of their time out in the city. If you like your hotels to be great places to relax and kill a few hours then the King George may not be for you. If you simply need a place to sleep and shower then the King George is the perfect spot.

review.title: Convenient and a great price!
review.reviewText: The King George Hotel was conveniently located and not expensive. The hotel staff was helpful and courteous. There was no restaurant in hotel but many restaurants are nearby, so this was not a problem. We would stay there again if given the opportunity.

review.title: In Noise Zone
review.reviewText: This is an older multi-story downtown hotel with an outstanding location one block from Powell Street and Union Square. But there are several items that could be of concern for some. There are no ice machines nor are there fridges or microwaves in the room. Also, most rooms tend to be on the small side as is the single elevator. The stairway is in a spiral which can be somewhat uncomfortable to negotiate for older clientele. Otherwise, you'll find that the location allows for 24/7 food and other services, and great public transport throughout the Bay Area. A concierge is on duty to help with travel plans and the diner next door provides 24/7 room service. However, because of the busy Union Square location, the street noise from the nearby clubs can be heard into the twilight hours. Buses on Geary can take you to points west toward Land's End. The transport along Market takes you to all other places.

review.title: Excelent! will go again, no doubt!
review.reviewText: I will surrely recomend these hotel!

review.title: Just Right
review.reviewText: The hotel reminds one of European hotels ... small, friendly, convenient to everything we needed. No restaurant, but an extremely friendly lounge and convenient to some very find diners and restaurants. The concierge staff was excellent and made getting around San Francisco very easy. And the rate was very good compared to other San Francisco hotels.

review.title: A hidden jewel
review.reviewText: A recently remodeled boutique hotel located only 1 block from Union Square, the Powell Street Cable Car and Macys. The KG is between the Hilton and the St Francis megahotels. The the King George is a hidden gem. And a best buy. They have everything but a restaurant however there are two 24 hour facilities in the same block. We have stayed there for years and never been disappointed.

review.title: Very solid, not many amentities
review.reviewText: Staff pleasant and helpful. Not a lot of amenities, but I didn't need them. Bed was comfortable. Water was hot. Internet was dependable. My single room was quiet (away from the street). Many restaiurfants within 0-5 blocks. On the border between Union Square and the Tenderloin. Didn't know what to expect, but could have been much worse. I was completely satisfied.

review.title: Small. Spic and Span clean. Great bargain w/flight.
review.reviewText: Friendly Helpful Clean Convienent

review.title: Great location and clean. Good price.
review.reviewText: Would go back again.

review.title: Quaint hotel, great location
review.reviewText:
The staff was very friendly and went the extra mile to help us when we missed our shuttle to the airport, even though they were very busy since it was over the Memorial Day weekend. The hotel is old and has a very historic and quaint feel about it, and I just loved it. The rooms are maybe a bit smaller than newer hotels which is to be expected, but certainly comfortable and nicely appointed.
I am really happy with this choice, and would definitely stay there again.
It is also very conveniently located with great breakfast spots just steps away.

review.title: Great deal and great location. A Gem!
review.reviewText: I got a great deal on Expedia and the hotel is true to its 3 star rating. Clean, neat, tidy; the room is a bit small. Most boutique hotels in SF have small rooms, though. The staff is very friendly and helpful as well. Everything in the hotel is well kept and it is just two blocks from Union Square and all the major department stores. I will stay there again!

review.title: Good location at a reasonable price
review.reviewText:
Very good location, helpful staff and excelente neighboorhood.

Free internet, unfortunately no breakfast.

The window was to small, not a big problem, but something to take into consideration.

review.title: Recommend this hotel for location and price. Would go back
review.reviewText: Staff are friendly and helpful. Got my wine tour booked through the hotel. Provided street maps and front of house generally friendly and helpful. Also the happy hour is worth having a drink at the bar - connect with other guests before heading out for the evening. Plus eating is so easy - every corner of Mason and Geary has a place and 24 hours.

review.title: Good Hotel convenient location
review.reviewText:
The hotel was in a good central position and the room although on the small side was comfortable and clean. There are 2 resturants each side of the hotel for breakfast and other meals.
Go on the Bus tour to get your bearings, the one we went on did 4 seperate tours, including one at night and the ticket lasted 48 hours which was very helpful in getting around

review.title: Good pick
review.reviewText: If just your looking for a simple hotel this is it. Good location, helpful staff and cozy rooms.

review.title: Very good hotel-great location
review.reviewText: A very nice hotel. The location and the staff were great. The rooms are a little small but comfortable. In room wi-fi access was a great bonus.

review.title: Great Value, Great Location
review.reviewText: Aside from rooms that are on the small side, you really can't beat this hotel as far as value for your money. It doesn't come with a whole lot of extra accomodations such as a pool or whirlpool tub, but it's right in the heart of San Francisco and it's easy to get to all of the major tourist attractions.

review.title: Great place, just bring earplugs.
review.reviewText: This hotel was adorable, safe, wonderfully located, clean, and the staff was extremely friendly. The rooms, elevator, and staircase are small, but it had all of the amenities (cable, wireless internet, even down to the q-tips and cotton balls in the bathroom and candy jar in the room.) The only complaint I had was the fact that the walls were very thin, and the couple staying next door to me felt compelled to remain in the throws of passion until 3:30 a.m. when I had a conference early the next morning. A quick trip to Walgreens for some earplugs solved that problem. I would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Great location, but a bit noisy
review.reviewText:
- reasonable price (expedia flight + hotel package)
- friendly staff
- helpful free wifi to look up info/to keep in touch w/ppl
- luggage storage service so you can use yr last day in the city to the fullest without hauling your bags with you for as long as you need
- convenient location, mins from cable cars (Powell and Hyde), shopping, BART station (great if you need to go to the airport), buses...any of the public transportation. Walkable distant to China Town.
- rooms are small but i don't mind that since i'm only there to shower and sleep
- It was noisy because our room was facing the alley direction where the recycling/garbage bins are visited nightly by homeless ppl. You can hear the loud glass/beer bottles hitting against each other even with the bathroom door closed because the bathroom windows are Jalousie windows.
- We requested for a quiet location having read another review and was given a rm on the 2nd floor, facing the alley- I understand that not all requests can be accommodated, but surely the higher up you are, the less likely you'd hear noise on street level?!
- Would not recommend to light sleepers
- if u go two blocks east it seems to be a sketchier area after dark. if i'm looking for another hotel than this one, i'd try something on the west side. it might be more noisy due to the busy streets but maybe they have normal windows. but anyhow, safety first when u're traveling.

review.title: San Francisco Surprise
review.reviewText: My husband didn't know he was going to SF until I said turn here, at the airport. He really liked the King George Hotel. It was built in 1914 and has 9 floors. The rooms were small but pretty good. The location was within walking distance of several stores and modes of transportation. We walked to Chinatown and Union Square from our hotel and caught the sight seeing tour bus near our hotel.

review.title: Cute, can't complain
review.reviewText: Hotel is decent, good location, good price. Rooms were bigger then most San Fran hotels but still pretty small.

review.title: For the Trifty and Practical
review.reviewText:
As to the "Pros"...Helpful Staff that tried to always satisfy our questions and needs. One particular day the conceirge gave us a suggestion for the San Francisco Movie Tour recommending we try it since we were movie buffs. It turned out to be the best outing in our stay. Most important was location too.
As To The "Cons"..A bit noisy the 1st night ...sound travels too well in Frisco. Also the T.V. was less than quality. (I'm Spoiled w/ Plasma T.V.) The T.V. was located to the side of the bed instead of @ the Rear of Bed.
Would I recommend this Hotel? Yes! Because I appreciate value. What King George lacked in pizazz it made up in effort & polish in a quaint hotel.

review.title: Good location value for money
review.reviewText: The location is extremely ideal - just behind Macy Store. The only complain i had was the hissing sound from the heater throughout the night. Can't control it and cant do anything to reduce the sound unless to switch off the heater. Other than that, everything was perfect and up to expectations. I will go back there again for sure.

review.title: Location great but nothing fancy!
review.reviewText:
The location is great! Hotel is nothing fancy so dont get your hopes up for that.
Our only complaint was that we got stuck with a room on the 3rd floor that had a fogged glass window and no screen. We could not even open the window because the lint from the dryer was blowing. For sure ask for a higher floor and check the window.
One more thing- we could hear EVERYTHING going on in the rooms surrounding us. Old hotel so not very soundproof. Staff was very friendly.
The price is right but if you are looking for a romantic getaway this might not be the place.

review.title: Almost like home!
review.reviewText: Though not top of the range, this hotel was very comfortable and the staff very friendly. The location was great, close to Union Square and transport to other locations. Check out the breakfast restaurant Lois' right next door and if you are too tired to go far there's another simple but satisfying restaurant right next door too.

review.title: Best Deal for the Money in San Francisco
review.reviewText:
I've stayed at the King George twice now, several days each time, a few years apart. My opinion today is as it was after my first stay -- simply an excellent hotel for the money. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The furniture is tasteful and well-maintained. The staff are friendly; everyone goes out of his/her way to greet guests (and I'm talking right down to the maintenance staff). Everyone who works at this hotel seems happy to be there.

It's true, the rooms are small by American standards. The surrounding neighborhood is...well, it's the Tenderloin. It is a bit grimy, but there are so many people on the street, day and night, that it's hardly unsafe. Several good restaurants have popped up in the area (there used to be only lousy, overpriced ones in the vicinity). And as close as it is to Union Square, Powell Street Station, Market Street, and all the downtown action, the rooms are remarkably quiet. The little pub behind the lobby is a quite comfortable place to enjoy a happy hour brew (and the beer selection is rather nice -- no Bud or Miller here).

All in all, you won't find a better deal in the City by the Bay.

review.title: Very satisfied
review.reviewText:
The location was perfect, only a block from Union Square and the Powell Street cable cars and just four blocks from the large shopping center at Powell and Market Streets. The hotel was flanked by Lori's Diner on one side and the more upscale Cafe Mason on the other. Many other restaurants and cafes nearby. Several theaters are within easy walking distance.
Although my room was compact (the bathroom may be a bit cramped for people of size), the hotel was clean and comfortable. I liked the in-room safe, large enough for my small laptop computer. The staff were courteous and helpful, especially the concierge.
On my next trip to San Francisco I will certainly stay at the King George Hotel again.

review.title: Nice stay in SF downtown
review.reviewText: Hotel's nice and conveniently located in downtown, a few steps away from Union Square. Rooms are very small, but romantic.

review.title: Not Impressed!
review.reviewText: Too noisy! And the room is too small. The people are nice. I would like to try the other hotel next time.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: We booked the No-smoking room,but after opening the door, a terrible cigarette smoke can be smell. The room is small, and the facility of the hotel is somewhat out of date. However, the best advantage of the hotel is it close to the Union Square.

review.title: Great location and decent price - unremarkable hotel
review.reviewText:
Location location location!
As for as the hotel itself, it was very decent (clean and service was fine) but don't expect anything fancy. I liked that there was free internet, but it was extremely slow.
If you find a good rate, then I do recommend it...

review.title: Great Staff, Very Good Value for the Price Paid
review.reviewText: It is decent hotel in a central location. Price is modest compared to 4-star hotels, yet I got what I need: internet, a regrigerator. It would be nice they could have a microwave (even in a common area). Their staff did help to heat up my dish.

review.title: Will return.
review.reviewText: Excellent location. Parking structure across the street and diners on either side of the hotel were excellent. Room was small but very clean and in good condition. Excellent overal location and value.

review.title: Friendly helpful staff and great location
review.reviewText: Excellent location and great tidy place. Staff were very accomadating an dhelpful.

review.title: Cheap but Cute and Comfy
review.reviewText: Had a great stay at a great price!

review.title: Great value
review.reviewText: This is a small, friendly and well maintained hotel. The staff were very friendly and helpful. My room was adequate size and was well maintained. Being about one block from Union Square, this was a great location.

review.title: East Coast
review.reviewText: Everything went well. I even added on another nights stay. Great location but less expensive than other neighboring hotel. Rooms are small but that was fine for me. Free wireless internet in the rooms!

review.title: Next time should choose a bigger room.
review.reviewText:
It was a short walk to everywhere,especially union square.
The hotel room was kind of small for a queen size non-smoking bedroom.
It was so clear that every morning house keeper would clean the room.

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: Check in was easy. Room was cute and quaint. Location was absolutely perfect from union square and the bart station. Only cons were the tiny and slow elevator (ended up taking the small stairways most of the time) and the light shining around the doorway from the hall.

review.title: Great location and value.
review.reviewText: You can't beat the King George for location and value in San Francisco. The rooms vary in size but all are clean and comfortable. The staff is warm and helpful. Lots of places to eat around the area. The free in-room wi-fi, however, is painfully slow. As is the lone elevator at peak times.

review.title: Decent price, small but decent.
review.reviewText: if you are looking to stay in the Union Square area, then King George is ideal. When we arrived, the vallet area was completing blocked so we had to park in front of the restuarant next door and pay a meter so anticipate heavy traffic in that area (you are in SF!). I realized that the valet parks your car in a parking garage a few blocks away so make sure you don't leave any valuables in the car & it cost $30 for parking! And when you leave it might take awhile because they have to go get your car so again, anticipate a wait. The staff was very friendly upon arrival, checkin was a breeze. However, the elevator to our room was the slowest and smallest I have ever been in (it literally only fits 2 people). Our room was very small but clean. We didn't have a veiw but we did have all the necessary amenities that all hotels should provide, in-room safe, hair dryer, free wifi, a comfortable bed, and a tv. The bathroom was extremely small and there was only hot water. In addition, the hotel is close to good shopping and restuarants- there is even a 24 hour diner a couple doors down and the Mason Restuarant next door was good. However, if you leave your hotel at night (we went to watch Wicked at 8pm at the Orpheum) be weary of walking down Mason Street and stick to Market at night. We made that mistake and it was the shadiest street ever. Overall, the hotel was decent. I would reccommend to stay if you want to get away from big chain hotels and looking for a bargain.

review.title: Good hotel at good price
review.reviewText:
Hotel was in the very convenient location - near by beautiful union square and whole bunch of restaurants down the block. Everything would be very nice if not homeless people. Those booms are annoying and aggressive. I didnt feel safe walking on the streets at night. One of them through at us garbage !

And hotel is very nice inside, friendly people, rooms were clean and nice. Only bathroom was inconvenient - so small ! I have never ever see bathroom small like that. When you are taking a shower you have only two places to put your clothes - toilet or the floor.
Room by itself was very nice, painted green, beds were big and comfortable.

review.title: Great hotel for the money
review.reviewText: Everything was great

review.title: Great Deal!
review.reviewText: King George Hotel is clean with a very friendly staff. The location is great and the price was perfect.

review.title: King George hotel San Francisco
review.reviewText: Very good hotel with extremely friendly staff. My room is spacey enough and is very well maintained. Location of this hotel is superb. Two minutes to Union Square on foot, and close to all major public transportation/ attraction.

review.title: Excellent Vacation Experience
review.reviewText: The hotel was located in a prime Union Square location, the front desk staff and the concierge were beyond helpful and extremely knowledgeable. The room was small, but very clean and the bed one of the best I've ever slept on in a hotel. Only a very short walk to Market Street and Powell Street cable car, and all the downtown shopping, easy to navigate the entire city. Great value in a great location. Will definitely stay there again.

review.title: The BEST hotel ever
review.reviewText: This hotel was amazing. The people were nice and very helpful, the rooms were clean and the location was perfect. The room and the feel of the hotel really brought a true sence of the culture of San Francisco. I will with out a doubt come back and stay and recommend this hotel to everyone I know.

review.title: Fantastic
review.reviewText: Everthing were excellent.

review.title: Good hotel experience
review.reviewText: We were very satisfied with this hotel.

review.title: See you again soon King George
review.reviewText: Great little hotel for the price and location. All of the staff were friendly and helpful. Room was on the small side (but that was expected) and was decently decorated and comfortable (except the bed pillows could have been a little softer). You do hear some noise from the street but that was also expected especially being in downtown. I will definately stay at the King George again.

review.title: Perfect hotel
review.reviewText:
Perfect location for a tourist, 2 blocks from Union Square, and very close to the shopping malls and Market Street. There are two cafes right next door, and plenty of restaurants within walking distance if they aren't your style. I never checked out the restaurant bar.

The staff were extremely polite, friendly, and efficient, my reservation and room were ready even though I had only booked 1 hour before arriving.

The room was small, but still had a comfortable bed, TV, desk, and a bathroom. The hot water in the sink was a bit lukewarm, but the shower was fine. The free wireless internet is fairly fast, and I had no connection issues. Check-out was quick and flawless, and I was able to store my bag for the whole day until my flight.

I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling on a budget, especially a single traveler. I think the service and comfort that I received was worth far more than the rate I paid!

review.title: Good choice in San Francisco.
review.reviewText:
My experience on the King George was good, the hotel is in a good location, the room was small, but clean, and all services working.
I make a mistake and one day I walked at sout of masson st closer to Elis st and Taylos St and is very ugly and weird people.

review.title: union square deal - bring your own sheets you ll sleep better
review.reviewText: The hotel was chosen for price and location. On both counts it delivered. Dont expect anything fancy and you wont be disappointed. The linens and towels and room cleaning were in line with the extremely low price. Everything worked - the tv was very old and not great but ok. - noise level was not as bad as i expected. i was a bit worried about their comforter and sheets/pillows but thats life in this price point.

review.title: Tiny Poorly-Maintained Hotel Room
review.reviewText: To my surprise at my arrival I found the room was pathetically small, almost no space to move around after a king bed. Windows were out of maintainance, an obvious violation to standard safety codes (not recommened if you have young children, as there are no safety measures preventing fell-through once opens). Heater switch was broken, I wasn't unable to adjust the temperature throughout day. carpet and tile look dirty. The location was within walking distance to union square, but the quality of room experience was among the poorest of 3-star hotels.

review.title: I shall return!
review.reviewText: The King George hotel is ideally situated about a block from Union Square in San Francisco. The staff was extremely congenial, the room was comfortable and the bathroom was impeccable. I will return!

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Good location and nice staff.

review.title: convenient and inexpensive
review.reviewText: Hotel had a lot of charm - Victorian English decor. Room was very small - that might be a deterrent for some people. But, room was clean and bed was comfortable and the price was very reasonable.

review.title: Nice LITTLE boutique Hotel
review.reviewText: Didnt expect the hotel to be so small but everything worked out just fine. Overall Experience: Good Location, Good Service, Friendly Staff,

review.title: Great European Feel
review.reviewText: The location was terrific, just a few blocks from Union Square. Good restaurants close by. Everything within walking distance. Parking garage across the street. Staff very helpful. I would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Great Deal
review.reviewText: Hotel staff were very pleasant and helpful - booked airport shuttle for me, got directions, answered local questions. Rooms are in very decent condition (little worn) but you can't beat the location and price - literally around the corner from Union Square and public transportation!!! Would definitely return next time in San Fran!!! Only negative was that street noise was little bothersome at night (though very infrequent). If you're a light sleeper, request an interior room.

review.title: avoid
review.reviewText:
Pros: Location, price, very friendly staff
Cons: Heating did work, but was very inconsistent. It was too cold most of the time. I woke up several times from street noise and ended up using my ear plugs. Sure some street noise is to be expected in this location. But I've never had it so loud.

Summary: Good hotel for the price, but it failed at providing a heated room where I would be able to sleep

review.title: Compact but comfortable
review.reviewText: Our room was tastefully decorated, very comfortably appointed, clean, compact but met our needs. Staff was friendly, helpful. Location was convenient. Price was right!

review.title: Probably won't go back!
review.reviewText: The room was small, but manageable - price was right. The bathroom had only a basin, no countertop - old fashioned. Large walk-in closet with chest of drawers which was convenient. Maid service was good and room was clean. Only one elevator with extremely slow service. Clerks were friendly, but not very helpful. TV movies didn't work until close to the end of our stay and we had other plans by then - disappointing. We were offered a room to move to, but it was given away before we returned to the hotel. Garage (across the street) has a plan with the hotel which worked poorly for us - More than one hotel clerk gave us conflicting and inaccurate directions for entering and exiting the garage causing us much lost time. The manager did offer us money back for two nights by contacting Expedia, which we have not done. There are too many reasonably priced choices in downtown S.F. to put up with these kinds of issues again.

review.title: Excellent value for your money
review.reviewText:
If you accept this hotel for what it is - a bargain hotel in the heart of San Francisco - then I think you'll be happy. The rooms are small, and there are not a lot of luxury amenities, but everyone provided great, friendly service, and the rooms were clean. There's also a nice diner right downstairs.

Pros - Friendly service, location, cleanliness and a really cozy bar/lounge in the back, where I spent many evenings with a book.

Cons - Small rooms, only one slow elevator, bar doesn't stay open late.

Overall, a very good deal for the price.

review.title: King George Hotel - Good Deal for the Price
review.reviewText: This hotel is an a great location. It's right in the heart of Union Square - walking distance from many of the major attractions and just a quick MUNI ride to some of the city's most popular attractions - Fisherman's Wharf, Alcatraz, Mission, Castro, Delores Park, etc.

review.title: King George Hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: I would highly recommend this hotel to other travelers. The hotel is small, but conveniently located. The employees are extremely nice and very helpful.

review.title: Will Stay Here Again
review.reviewText: Conveniently located-only a couple of blocks from Union Square and Westfield Center. Valet parking was worth the few extra dollars. It wasn't easy to find a taxi, since the hotel is on a side street, but the concierage was very helpful. It's an older hotel so the rooms and bathrooms were plain but pleasant and they were larger than other older hotels we've stayed at. Liked the availability of twin beds. It is just down the street from the Curran Theatre. Only negative was being on an alley where someone banged the trash dumpsters around in the middle of the night. Would definitely stay here again, although would request a room away from the alley.

review.title: Above Average (Just)
review.reviewText:
King George is conveniently located for site seeing and the area seemed quite safe.

The property is quite old but it appears to be relatively well maintained. The staff were friendly and helpful.

The hotel room was small and did not have a refrigerator or air conditioning (not a problem in winter since there is a heater, but I would not want to be there in the warmer months). The housekeeping service did a consistently good job each day.

Wireless internet was available but slow.

This hotel is suited for tourists who are looking for value and a convenient location to rest at the end of the day.

review.title: Adorable hotel with a fabulous location
review.reviewText: This hotel is right in the heart of it all. It has all the character you could ask for. Clean and comfortable with great service. Loved it!

review.title: Right in the middle of it all
review.reviewText: The biggest benefit to this location is that it's about a block from union square, so your right in the middle of it all. I would say the room was pretty small, just big enough for a bed. It was in a pretty noisy location, even though we were on the 5th floor. The employees were very friendly except for the concierge. He was extremely rude and condescending. Basically unless your willing to go to the finest places in town, down ask for information from him.

review.title: Great alternative to the expensive giants nearby
review.reviewText: Have picked King George for the past several times I have been in SFO. A nice value compared to the big guys. I prefer spending my money on good food instead of overpriced rooms.

review.title: Very good boutique hotel
review.reviewText: The value for money was on point. The rooms were very well maintained and the staff were generally friendly. The only thing I didn't catch on the room description was the lack of a refrigerator (I guess this was my oversight). But it didn't really matter because it was close to good restaurants, shopping, sights, and public transportation.

review.title: We will stay here again!
review.reviewText: Excellent location, one block from Union Square. There are three good all-night diners on the block and several other fine dining rooms. Although this hotel is old and the rooms are small, it is clean, well kept and comfortable. Concierge service was excellent and we found all staff friendly and helpful. We would definitely stay in this location again.

review.title: basic 3 star with a great location
review.reviewText: Location was the best - as well as price - older typical SF hotel. A block from Union Square - theaters etc.

review.title: Satisfactory Hotel
review.reviewText: The King George Hotel is satisfactory. It was close to the hotel where my meeting was, at a cost much less than the meeting hotel.

review.title: Excellent location and outstanding service at a bargain price
review.reviewText: Only a couple of minutes walk to Union Sq. Friendly and helpful staff. Nicely appointed room. Comfortable bed, sheets, comforter etc. Outstanding value! Will stay at this hotel again for sure during my future visits to SF.

review.title: King George Inn SF Noisy but Nice
review.reviewText: The hotel was perfect for what we needed. It was across the street from a conference where rooms were much more expensive. We requested a queen but apparently they don't guarantee because we got twin beds, but for one night it was okay. My only complaint is that they do street work all night long in SF. This is not the hotel's fault, and hopefully the work will be done for the next guests. The tea room at the hotel was a nice place for my husband to hang out while I attended conference sessions.

review.title: King George is a very good value
review.reviewText:
The hotel is a great value based on its central location. It's old, but the rooms are not overly small and the whole atmosphere is very pleasant. The staff is great and helpful.

Parking is expensive at the hotel, which is typical for its location.

review.title: Good for a short stay
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was excellent; polite and accomodating. The roomshowever, were very small, but cozy. Only one elevator, and stairs were very narrow and spiral, making maneuvering them difficult. Bathrooms very clean, but small. Not much room for toiletries; had to keep them either in cosmetic bag or at end of tub. Excellent location, close to Union Square and to bus and cable lines. I would definitely go back if for a short stay - 2 or 3 nights; for a longer stay, I would like more space, especially in the bathroom.

review.title: Great for quick business trip in the city
review.reviewText:
I selected the King George based on location - walking distance to both BART and the conference I was attending (not at the Moscone, but at PG&E's headquarters about a mile away), price and free wireless internet access. Was perfect for my 2 night stay. No hassles or problems. I just need a clean, comfortable room with internet access, and I'm happy. Yes, the rooms are on the small side, but not uncomfortably so, and the plumbing was a bit noisy, but nothing major. Plenty of restaurants in the area - I tried Dojima-Ann for dinner, a Japanese place around the corner and the Pinecrest Diner across the street for breakfast, both reasonable - and 2 Starbucks also right around the corner, and Walgreens seemingly everywhere for picking up water and snacks.
Would probably be a good base for a leisure trip as well, the location and access to all the public transportation options (BART, bus, cable car etc.) being excellent.

review.title: Good Stay At Union Square
review.reviewText: We went to stay at Union Square. It was exactly what we expected. The hotel room was fine, The elevator was small, but I've seen smaller. The hetel room had twin beds, and they sloped slightly toward the center of the room, but they were ok to sleep on. And, of course it was San Francisco, so there were plenty of places to eat.

review.title: Special rate was okay
review.reviewText:
The room was tiny and had no air-conditioning and would have been worse had I not been staying by myself. The location was pretty close to the BART and cable car stops, but just off the beaten track enough to become a bit seedy after dark--not dangerous as such, but definitely a little unsavoury.

I got a special half-price rate and that made the stay tolerable, but if I had have paid full price I would not have been impressed.

review.title: Great romantic weekend!
review.reviewText: We loved our stay at the King George. The staff was very helpful and courteous. The rooms were indeed small, and so were the bathrooms, but they were exactly what me & my fianc√©e needed for our romantic weekend in the City. It was within 2-3 blocks from many attractions & fine restaurants. We really liked the charm of the entire hotel, and were not bothered by the size at all. The only complaint we have was that there was no ice machine, as we brought our own bottle of bubbly. We would definitely stay at the King George again.

review.title: Great location! Great Price!
review.reviewText: I have all good things to say. Staff was great. Rooms are small but cozy and nice. Bathrooms were very clean. The location is perfect for anyone wanting to really explore San Francisco. It's about 3-4 blocks from BART and a short cab ride to anywhere.

review.title: Fab Hotel - Stay here!
review.reviewText: An excellent hotel, great location - a two minute walk from Union Square and a 5 minute walk to Market Street with the trams and shops, clean, friendly - would definately recommend!

review.title: Great Value
review.reviewText: Room was small and a bit to warm, but hotel was immaculate and the staff very friendly. Check in was a breaze and it was very close to shopping, many great resturants and within walking distance to the theater (saw Wicked). I would recommend it to anyone who wanted to save some $ a didn't plan on spending alot of time in their room.

review.title: A decent hotel
review.reviewText: Very clean and attentive staff. There was no noise internal to the hotel but the neighborhood is noisy - pedestrian traffic, garbage trucks and ambulances in the middle of the night. Light sleepers might look for a quieter location.

review.title: Great for price
review.reviewText: Rooms are small (as are all with this type of hotel in SF) but you have everything that you need and the staff are friendly and helpful. This was much more comfortable and enjoyable than other places I have stayed in the same price range in the same great location.

review.title: A life-saver
review.reviewText: Another online service over booked us in an SF hotel during a big convention so we called Expedia and booked the King George in a panic. It was more than the first hotel but worth it. The location is great (as long as you don't wander SW to the Tenderloin) and we had an amazing stay. It ended up being a great time and a great base for our explorations.

review.title: The KingGeorge is Good
review.reviewText: a quaint hotel. it is in the city, and you feel it bustling it has a nice hip bar/lounge downstairs. the rooms are small but they fit the year of the hotel and the city style. Nicely decorated and clean, and wonderful staff. it is in the heart of down town so it is a good base for exploring.

review.title: The rooms did not have any air conditioning
review.reviewText: The rooms did not have any air conditioning

review.title: Nice, but very small rooms
review.reviewText: We stayed in a room with a single queen bed for five nights. The room was tiny. It was a bit tough to get three suitcases in there and actually open them. Otherwise it was fine. Great location. Friendly staff. Good wifi. Valet parking was expensive (about $37 per night including tax), but it worked *very* well. We would definitely go there again. But I wouldn't bring much luggage. ;)

review.title: Great location, would definitely go back.
review.reviewText: Due to the thinness of the floors and walls, and the sounds that travel, beds should periodically be lubricated/tightened. :)

review.title: Excellent Stay at King George
review.reviewText: Thank you and the staff at King George for providing great accommodations. From room cleaniness to very friendly hotel staff--I enjoyed my stay.

review.title: very small rooms, but really wonderful service!
review.reviewText: I confess wishing the rooms - especially the bathroom - were a bit bigger. But, the service was so outstanding plus the location is the best. Also the lobby is very charming and fun. Good restaurant right next door. ACT less than a half block away. The bed was very comfortable with really soft cotton (Egyptian I believe) sheets.

review.title: Great Place
review.reviewText: Really enjoyed my stay at the King George. People were great and a great help to get around the city. I would recommend this place.

review.title: great location and wonderfull hotel
review.reviewText: the rooms are amazing, big and cozy. the service is very good, and the location is just near the market st. with all the transportaion in it.

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText: Good Location for cable cars and Bart. like a 2 min walk (everyone says 5 min but it's really 2 min.)Union square is right around the corner.
