Good thai food place down the street in pac hotel back lobby. Rooms are small but comfortable.Adult movies are over priced. Cleaning ladies make lots of noise in the morning. overall cute hotel.

review.title: central location
review.reviewText: We were pleased with the friendliness and courtesy of the staff. The location was ideal for our purposes. The rooms were a bit small but we didn't spend much time in our rooms as we were on the go all day and into the night.

review.title: Nice Hotel and Staff small room
review.reviewText: The room was very small. It was hard to fit the cot in the room with the bed. But overall the hotel was good and the staff was nice.

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Great stay, would return. Very easy to get to from airport via Bart.

review.title: Location is great
review.reviewText: This is the best location we've stayed in on our San Francisco trips. It's close to everything - Union Square, lots of theaters, good restaurants, and fun things to see - galleries, Chinatown and shops. We'd stay here again.

review.title: King George
review.reviewText: Good location, well maintained room, easy check in / out. Very nice breakfast / late night diners right next door.It's a rather small venue so don't expect anything super fancy, but it's clean and the price was right. Only 1 elevator too so sometimes there was a bit of a wait, but its not detrimental to the overall experience.

review.title: Can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: My husband and I went for our anniversary and I loved staying at the King George. It is centrally located in San Francisco and the staff is marvelous. Rooms are small and elevator is slow but its location and staff make up for it. :-)

review.title: okay for a basic hotel
review.reviewText: Very good location when visiting SF. You are close to everything: Union square, public transportation, market street, car rental... If you don't request a luxury hotel or don't want to spend too much for the hotel, it is a good deal.

review.title: Better than expected
review.reviewText: We had a great stay at the hotel. All special request were granted - away from elevator, high floor, quiet room. We heard no outside noises & slept amazing well. First impressions of the lobby were not great, but we were very pleased with the hotel, the conceire & our room.

review.title: review
review.reviewText: Not too impressive compared to other places. I was very disappointed that they told me valet parking is $30 but charged me $34 instead. I would not stay there again.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: It's at a good location especially if you're getting a rental car. There is a public parking building just in front of the hotel. Moreover there are great walking routes up North & East from the hotel.

review.title: I would stay here again
review.reviewText: I enjoyed my stay at King George. The staff was helpful and the room comfortable and pleasant.

review.title: Great little hotel
review.reviewText: I stayed with a friend in a room with two twin beds. The room was small (and bathroom was tiny), as we expected, but very clean, nicely furnished and comfortable. We were in the back of the hotel; the view was the side of another building, but it was extremely quiet and we both slept very well. All of the hotel staff were very courteous and helpful, and you can't beat the location or price. I would definitely go back...in fact we extended our stay an extra night!

review.title: Great Find in SF!!
review.reviewText: Super deal. The concierge (and the whole staff) was incredibly friendly and helpful. They made sure we knew where to go and how to get there. It was a beautiful little space - quaint and modest - great charm. The room was very clean and comfortable. It's also a great location w/ lots going on close by.

review.title: great experience
review.reviewText: Great hotel, great location,great price. Nice sized rooms. Helpful and friendly staff. The ONLY drawback may be that the spiral stairs make you dizzy-but they do have a small elevator. Would definitely stay here again when I'm back in SF.

review.title: M'eh
review.reviewText: Slightly more expensive than a double bed (private bathroom) at a local hostel, and slightly better quality overall. I'd say that in general it was lackluster, but appropriately priced. Location was very nice though. I stayed at a SIGNIFICANTLY nicer hotel for slightly more money a few days prior, so my opinion is skewed, but basically I think better bang for the buck can be had.

review.title: Small enough to be personal; very attractive; helpful staff
review.reviewText: I appreciated the decor -- understated design, wood, cotton and glass rather than acrylic and plastic. Very clean. Staff nice and helpful. Many inexpensive places to eat in a one block radius. Good location -- walk to busses and cable cars. . As a single woman I felt well looked after, and felt safe coming and going day or evening. I'm sorry they have stopped serving breakfast. In addition to being convenient, it's a nice way to associate with the other guests and feel part of a community, however transitory.

review.title: Decent
review.reviewText: Hotel pillows were hard and the room was small. Everything else met expectations of a hotel, but didn't exceed any. A basic hotel for a decent price.

review.title: A great hotel with a great location
review.reviewText: Rooms are small but very clean. Superb staff. Location is perfect and the price is right. Near everything. I highly recommend The King George.

review.title: Nice hotel in the middle of the action
review.reviewText: The hotel and staff were very nice and the rooms, albeit a little small, were clean and comfortable. The lack of air conditioning had no adverse effects at all as the temperature fell into the 50s every night (1st week in June). The location of the hotel is great with good access to Market St. and the cable cars running north.

review.title: can't wait to go back
review.reviewText: Is a very nice clean and quite Hotel I"ll recommend as a place to stay.

review.title: Love this hotel!
review.reviewText: We've stayed at the King George before and weren't disappointed on this return trip. Very friendly staff, nice room and great location made for an ideal stay. It's an older hotel, but everything is well maintained. We will be happy to stay at the King George again on a future visit to San Francisco.

review.title: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay!
review.reviewText: Hotel staff were very helpful! Location is GREAT, convenient to shopping at Union Square, BART and the cable cars. Rooms are a bit small but comfortable and clean. No restaurant onsite, but the 2 restaurants next door are open 'til all hours. Would definitley stay there again!!

review.title: Very nice
review.reviewText: We thoughly enjoyed our stay.

review.title: King George Himself would still stay there.
review.reviewText: We stayed there for 4 nights and it was great. The decor is really nice, and stays true to it's character, and most hotel staff were friendly. It seemed as though staff there aren't willing to bend over backwards for you, so if you're lower mainanence you'll love it. The housekeepers were friendly and kept our room spotless. PS the shampoo and conditioner is great - bring some home if you can! :) It's a green hotel so for those of you who are green yourselves you'll appreciate it. The rooms were on the small side, with no mini fridge, but what they lacked in ammenities they make up for in comfort. It felt great to come back to the hotel after a long day of walking. They have a concierge there to assist you in travel plans around the city or tourist stuff you're wanting to plan out. They also arrange a shuttle back to the airport for you. The hotel is situated in the heart of the city, it's only a few blocks walk to anywhere, really, including restaurants and coffee shops and trolly's. Overall, this hotel suit us perfectly and I highly recommend it to anyone. Have fun on your trip!!

review.title: Good Location
review.reviewText: The hotel location was excellent. One block from Union Square and all the shopping. The rooms were small but comfortable. There is no restaurant onsite but there are restauarants on either side of the hotel that are open 24hrs. I would stay there again. One block from the cable cars and five blocks from Chinatown.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: The hotel was in good condition and the people were friendly and helpful. Location was very convenient to shopping and mass transportation. I would definitely stay again.

review.title: Great location, but small room and a little old and dusty
review.reviewText: King Goerge was in a great location. Roughly about 2 block from Powell Station. Heaps of restaurants and shops around. But the room was very small. And the bathroom was even smaller. As they say YOU COULDNT SWING A CAT IN THERE. The room had no airconditioning, only an old dusty ceiling fan. Generally the room was clean, and housekeeping changed the sheets and towels every day. HOWEVER, I had a few coughing fits because the room was so dusty and I think it was because the carpet was very old and dusty. Im not an asthmatic but the dustiness in the room cause me a bit of discomfort. Overall, if I was able to get another good deal on Expedia (like we did in April 09) then I might stay here again, due to the good location and the good rate. Only moments away from Union Square and fantastic shopping. But this next time I would know what to expect.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Barely one step up from a Hostel.

review.title: Uncomfortable mattress
review.reviewText: The room was small but cozy. Our twin bed mattresses were uncomfortable, should be replaced.

review.title: Great place to stay
review.reviewText: I loved this hotel. The King George was in a great location, very affordable, and very comfortable. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others.

review.title: Charming Hotel in heart of San Francisco
review.reviewText: I was really happy with staying here, it was in the Union Square area so close to shops and all transport. The hotel was very charming with lovely decor, the room was small but had all you needed. The staff were excellent and helpful, it was very clean if I go back to San Francisco I would want to stay there again. There is a Lori's Diner right next door for some great food and at the other side of the hotel Cafe Mason also had great food.

review.title: Quaint and Centrally Located
review.reviewText: The King George is small, but quaint. It has charm of years gone past, but nothing is run-down. The plumbing worked fine and the showers were terrific. The hotel is located by some of my favorite Indian and vegan restaurants, plus it is close to the BART and other public transportation and loads of shopping. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms are on the small side, but this is San Francisco. If you want a large room, then you'll need to go elsewhere. They have free wi-fi and coffee in the room. One of the best traits is that they recycle and use biodegradable shampoo bottles.

review.title: King George Hotel is a good deal
review.reviewText: I stayed at the King George during my recent trip to San Francisco for four nights. The room was very nice, bed comfortable and shower TERRIFIC. I must say I was overly satisfied with the room in general and especially with the shower head. Not having proper pressure is a BIG pet-peeve of mine and The King George Hotel satisfied my showering needs 100%. The only negative thing I could say about the hotel is that there is a gap of several inches between the floor and the door of the room that allowed for "some" noise to be heard once in a while from the hallway. But, it was only occasionally and not long-lasting. This is just a side effect of old architecture. The walls are rather thin, but if you are a heavy sleeper or carry earplugs with you, I think you will be fine. I had a very restful stay at the King George and I would recommend it to you.

review.title: worth every penny and then some ...
review.reviewText: pleaseantly surprised with this hotel, great location, great sevice, clean and comfortable. could improve on internet access but overall, very satisfied. concierge desk...very helpful

review.title: Exceptional Staff
review.reviewText: Hotel staff was extremely helpful!

review.title: I'll be back!
review.reviewText: Amazing location, great customer service, great hospitality amenities...as long as you are not looking for a room w/ a view.

review.title: Terrific location
review.reviewText: One block from the trolley, 2 to the Muni. Sandwiched between 4 wonderful eateries to start the day with, or get that 3am coffee (24 hour diners). Next to the theater district and easy walks to Chinatown and the Ferry - the Saturday farmer's market is a must. The only drawback to our room was a shoehorned retro bathroom. The mirror wasn't in front of the sink which made shaving a chore and, with no fan, you have to open the window to clear the steam. The staff was great and responded quickly to all requests. Like all hotels these days, you have to request that sheets be changed but that and extra sets of dry towels are delivered happily. If you are always in a hurry, don,t stay here. The one elevator only holds 4 people and the stairs are tight squeeze spiral all the way to the ninth floor. For relaxed, comfortable, cost effective covenience, however, this is a very good choice.

review.title: Nice stay
review.reviewText: The location is perfect. 24 hours dinner is both side of the hotel such as Cafe MASON which opens from 6AM. The room is actually small but it is very clean. Very comfort. Front desk and concierge service is also very good one. I do recommend. If I return to SF downtown and look for better cost performance, I will definetly choose this hotel again.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: We had never been to San Francisco before so had no idea where to stay. The location was perfect- we could walk or get to the bus lines with ease. The room was a bit small, but that only encouraged us to get out and see the sights. Staff was very friendly and I would stay here again.

review.title: Worth every penny
review.reviewText: Great location, great service.

review.title: Good location, small rooms
review.reviewText: it was fine, walking distance to most things

review.title: Perfect stay.
review.reviewText: Everything was perfect, from room to staff helpfulness.

review.title: Comfortable Bed, Clean Room
review.reviewText: I stayed four nights (Tues -Fri) in March at the King George for a professional conference. I chose it because of its great location and the room rate I got through Expedia. The bed was one of the most comfortable I have encountered in a hotel. Everything was very clean and the staff was quite helpful. The room appeared to be recently painted, and carpet, bedspread, drapes and other furnishings were in good shape. Lots of hot water and good water pressure. The room was small - so small that I almost wished the upholstered chair wasn't there (in addition to a desk chair), but it was fine for one person. Having only one small elevator is a potential problem, but there was only 1 or two times all week that I had to wait. My only real complaint was that when I had a question about the wireless service, the front desk told me to call a helpline. The helpline person quickly solved my problem, but I used my room phone to call (since I had used it to call the front desk) instead of my cell and they charged me a "connection fee." I should have used my cell, but I wasn't thinking about potential charges. I wish the front desk had reminded me about the connection fee when they told me to call. I had absolutely no problems with the FREE wireless connection after that - a good signal even on the 7th floor!

review.title: good location but ......
review.reviewText: The hotel is close to Union Square and is surrounded by restaurants,bars and good shops. However our rooms were dark, old fashioned and rather scruffy. The bed sheets and blankets were old and had moth holes. The bathrooms were also very old fashioned and after 1 shower there was no hot water.

review.title: very friendly
review.reviewText: Very friendly staff in charming, affordable hotel. Rooms are small, but clean and in good shape.

review.title: Historic Charm
review.reviewText: A quaint hotel with historic charm. The rooms are small but have all the amenities of larger, more modern hotels (including free WiFi!). The staff were outstanding--I've never had better service! I'll definitely consider staying there again the next time I visit San Francisco!

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: The rooms are small but it is close to everything. Older hotel but all you need for this type of trip. Not much time spent in the hotel. There is sooo much to see.

review.title: Good choice for business or leisure
review.reviewText: Modest rates with good location and comfort for business or holiday guests. Convenient shopping and plenty of choices for food and drinks close by. Hotel staff members are very friendly and effecient. Would recommend to other travellers looking for value.

review.title: Acceptable accomodations
review.reviewText: The King George hotel should be classified as a old antique boutique hotel. The building is old and has all of the "old world charm" you would expect for it's age. The continental breakfast was not worth it. However it did allow us to grab a few fruits to bring with us throughout the day for snacking. I would recommend this hotel if you're looking for old world charm and not 5 star accomodations.

review.title: Cute and comfortable. Perfect hotel for a good night sleep.
review.reviewText: Our hotel room was small compared to other larger chains, but had everything we needed. The service was wonderful. The price is truly un-beatable for the location of the hotel. Everything for our touristy vacation was so close!

review.title: A hole in the Wall- Great locatio!!!
review.reviewText: Stayed February 18-20, 2009 I was stunned to see the size of the rooms. The room is so small that the tv was on a small table, the coffee pot was in the closet and moving around was almost impossible. If you are travrlling alone it is ok but, if it's a couple for get it.It is close to both the trolley and bus. Easy access to Fisherman's Wharf, shopping and fine dining.

review.title: Friendly and convenient
review.reviewText: The hotel was conveniently located, great price for it's location, very clean, and the staff were very friendly.....loved the room, though small, very comfortable.....also convenient parking across the street, and it was affordable parking.....

review.title: Excellent value
review.reviewText: Great location just one block from the cable cars and theaters. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Free internet access was great, room was clean & comfortable. The only thing missing was a free continental breakfast.

review.title: A great experience
review.reviewText: Very clean and bright rooms, plus friendly and attentive staff made this a great stay. The location was perfect for us. Rates were also very reasonable. Highly recommended!

review.title: SF on the Cheap
review.reviewText: The King George is a small quaint hotel ideally located in Union Square with small but comfortable rooms and a very helpful staff. The bed was firm, the water pressure was great and although I stayed in one of their smoking rooms, there was no evidence of any cigarette smoke smells. It's close to all methods of public transportation and local eateries and it was a great bargain for a very expensive city.

review.title: Excellent location, but not impressed
review.reviewText: The people of this hotel have always been kind to us. I suggest that instead of air freshener because in the halls we could smell of diaper.

review.title: An overall great hotel
review.reviewText: I stayed at the King George as part of a last minute trip to SF, the price was quite reasonable, and the staff was very helpful. The rooms were a bit small but by SF standards not bad. The rooms were clean and the hotel itseld was central to just about everything. BART, Restaurants, Bars, Coffee Shops, etc. I will likely stay here the next time I'm in town over the Holiday Inn or the Hilton that are nearby.

review.title: Great Value
review.reviewText: Great location, facilities, service. Clean and quiet. Will return next trip to San Francisco.

review.title: inexpensive but.....
review.reviewText: stayed on sixth floor...and each morning at 5am there was a loud water noise (sounded like rain hitting a collection pan) right above my room. Woke me up each morning.

review.title: Faded but comfortable
review.reviewText: In a convenient location, a block from Union Square, and between two diners. The rooms are small but comfortable. The reception staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel is old (early twentieth century) and does feel cramped compared to a modern hotel. There is no air conditioning in the rooms, only ceiling fans and openable windows. Because of this, I would not stay there in summer. There is traffic noise and ventilation fan noise (from the diner next door): these can be ignored with the single-glazed window closed but are intrusive with the windows opened.

review.title: Comfortable and Friendly
review.reviewText: The rooms are small but were very comfortable and cozy. I found the staff to be extremely friendly and attentive and the overall cleanliness of the hotel was exceptional. Centrally located and easily accessible. I won't hesitate to stay here again!

review.title: Good hotel for the value
review.reviewText: This was an good old hotel for the proximity and value, the room was comfortable but a bit chilly.

review.title: will stay here again!
review.reviewText: Nice hotel. Very helpful and friendly staff. Stayed during New Years Eve, and they issued bracelets to ensure safety for the guests. Great part of town-easy to get everywhere. Parking a little expensive, but right across the street,so convenient.

review.title: Great location, tiny rooms
review.reviewText: This hotel is clean and the staff is really friendly and helpful. It is located two blocks from Union Square and even though it is a busy area (and was a busy time of year when I was there) I couldn't hear any noise from the street. BUT... the rooms are very, very tiny. It was a little tight with two people staying in the room. Basically there is just enough room around the bed for you to walk and that's all the extra space you have. Also... the walls are VERY thin. I heard WAAAYYY too much of the activities going on in the next room. The price was good, except for the parking (but parking is expensive at every hotel within the city... believe me, I checked!). Overall, I would give this hotel an average rating. Not bad for two or three days.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: I stayed in a boutique hotel once and hated it. The King George Hotel was great, though. It was very cute. My hotel room was small, but it was the right size for one person. It was pretty quiet--I didn't really hear the other guests. The front desk staff was very friendly. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others and stay there again. It was in a central location near the Powell Bart station and there were two diners right next to the hotel.

review.title: This was a great hotel in a great location
review.reviewText: Overall, loved the hotel and the service. The location couldn't have been better, we had a short walk to all the major stops and were in the heart of the shopping district. Great hotel for a great price!!!

review.title: cleen and nice small rooms. good value.
review.reviewText: we found it cleen and nice but the rooms are small and have smallish windows (exept for the street facing rooms that are noisy). overall -good value and good service (they happily gave us a better (quieter, bigger) when we mentioned the noise from a fan outside the hotel.

review.title: a very satisfactory three star hotel
review.reviewText: i would stay there again.

review.title: Great area
review.reviewText: We have stayed here before and would definitely do so again. The hotel is located a few blocks from Union Square and is surrounded by excellent restaurants and theaters. Room is very comfortable and clean. Parking is available across the street, and is expensive, but one can park and then walk to most places.

review.title: 19th Century Charm
review.reviewText: Quaint, small, but friendly and comfortable. Walking down the hallway with the room doors from another era (though with modern locks) made me feel as though I had been transported back in time. Excellent stay!

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: We really liked this hotel. The only slight problem is the size of the bathroom. The sink is very small and very close to the door. There is very little space to place your toiletries. However, although the space was small, it was adequate.

review.title: A Quick Getaway
review.reviewText: All of the other reviewers talk about the downside - panhandlers and noise from the street. What they fail to mention is that in the mornings they sleep it off and they streets are empty, and when you have an inside room you don't hear anything. On the upside? Great dining, and an obscene number of choices but a few steps or a few blocks from the hotel. Live theatre, if that's your thing. World class shopping, galleries, etc. ad nauseum. We used to stay in the Marina District for a quick getaway, but my wife and I are quite taken with the location of this hotel. The service was good, but I do have to note that the rooms were quite small. If you have ever stayed in Tokyo, you get the idea about the size of the rooms. This building was obviously built before private baths were in every room. A must stay, especially if your wife loves Cheesecake.

review.title: Great Value
review.reviewText: The King George is a cute, cosy hotel just 2 blocks from Union Square. The rooms are small but well maintained and very clean. The staff are very friendly and helpful. I got great service from the minute I checked out until I left. They offer a continental breakfast for 7.95 which was quite sufficient. I enjoyed my stay at the King George and would certainly stay there again.

review.title: Great location....clean room....friendly staff
review.reviewText: It's not the Ritz, but for something affordable and in a good location, very satisfactory. Would definitely return.

review.title: BED BUGS!!!
review.reviewText: I went to San Francisco with my boyfriend for the weekend. I am a freak about checking for bed bugs. I checked for bed bugs and it was fine. We closed the curtains and took a nap. When we woke up 20 minutes later there were bed bugs. I don't know if the entire hotel is infested with bed bugs, but our room did have the bed bugs. The hotel was very understanding and gave us back our money. They quarantined the room so hopefully the problem will be taken care of. Just look under the mattress and in the pillow cases before you get into bed to check for bugs!!

review.title: Good Value
review.reviewText: King George is a nice older hotel with a good staff in a good location at a value price.

review.title: Great Location, Unique, Clean, & Friendly!
review.reviewText: As a female travelling alone, this hotel was very safe and friendly. It had ease of use and access to shopping, streetcars, trolley, and restaurants. The front desk staff was both helpful and friendly. The room was incredibly clean and comfortable. Wireless access was easy to access as well. It was a unique hotel. Room was not huge, but how much space to you really need? It was just right! Great breakfast next door at Lori's Diner!

review.title: Nice rooms, cramped bathrooms
review.reviewText: Perfect location, bathrooms real small and tight but fine for one person at a time. Some rooms have adjoining rooms seperated by a locked door, however, the door is very thin and I could hear the couple's personal activities in the next room while watching morning news. Elevator is tight too but the hotel is old. Avoid the staircase unless it's an emergency. The spiral stairway is treacherous and uncomfortable because the steps are spaced for midgets or dwarves. Lounge is nice and comfy. Overall, nice place for the money. Convienient location, parking across the street. Not far from where the city turns a little sketchy (down near market) but the immediate area is fine.

review.title: Good value, perfect location for tourist attractions, but noisy
review.reviewText: Stayed during 3 days in October 2008. Generally satisfied, the only main complain - it was really noisy. Probably it's a common problem for centrally located hotels, but nevertheless. At the same time location is super for the touristic activities, hotel is clean and service is good.

review.title: Great location, nice place
review.reviewText: We booked through Expedia and got a very good price for our room. This hotel has a nice,smaller lobby, a restaurant for breakfast and a bar. The staff was very helpful. One tiny elevator can make it difficult during busy hours. We requested a room on a higher floor which was great. The eighth floor away from the street was a good location with no unusual city noise. Our room had a king bed and a good-sized closet. The bathroom was adequate but we could have used a place to put a toiletry bag or two. The room was not cleaned as well as you would expect but we weren't there much. We loved being able to walk to shopping, restaurants and bars.

review.title: Enjoyed my stay
review.reviewText: Great location near the end of the cable car line, which provides easy access to all the tourist spots. Clean comfortable room. Due to the temperature, we left our windows open and there was a fair amount of noise, but nothing unbearable. The only drawback is that they only have one small elevator. I would stay there again.

review.title: Would not stay there again
review.reviewText: We were given a Handicap Room and were not told in advance. It was on the third floor, with a window facing the street. It was so noisey all night long that we barely sleep for 2 days. Partiers, police arrests, and plenty of vagrants were right in front of the hotel all through the day and night. When checking out we were asked how we liked the stay, we said we would never stay there again. When we complianed about the noise we were asked why we did not ask for another room? It turns out that the room we were in was considered large and the others were much smaller. The bed saw OK.

review.title: Would stay again
review.reviewText: The King George was a great value for the money. It is a terrific location for exploring SF. My room was small but cozy. The first night was warm as there is no AC and windows were closed. The next night with the windows open it was fine. Everyone was friendly and helpful giving excellent service. While it is older I think it is a wonderful boutique hotel. I highly recommend it...and the price through Expedia couldn't be beat!

review.title: budget travellers choice
review.reviewText: excellant location, good clean room, hotel staff friendly and helpfull.

review.title: Nice hotel, good location
review.reviewText: Not the most modern building, but nice hotel with friendly, helpful staff.

review.title: fair value
review.reviewText: Nice enough, clean rooms probably the smallest of all hotels we stayed in. Great location, especially if you like shopping. Lou,s diner next door serves a great breakfast.

review.title: Very Accessible
review.reviewText: If you want a inexpensive but clean hotel and very close to Union Square, shopping malls and cable car station, then King George is the hotel for you.

review.title: Great hotel at a great price
review.reviewText: I love the King George. The hotel is located downtown in the Tenderloin which is urban and gritty but not menacing. The hotel was most likely once a SRO rooming house that was renovated with style. Rather than totally destroying the key elements of the hotel's past the designers chose to save them and enhance them. The original wood doors to the rooms are preserved and brightly painted. The original exposed electric conduits in the hallways are saved with pleasant designer fixtures added to them. I'm sure that this is not for everyone. If you want an attractive price on a hotel that was purposefully designed to preserve its heritage then this is for you. The cable cars to Fishermans Wharf are a five minute walk. The BART to the airport(40 minutes to the international terminal) is a two minute walk. High end shopping on Post Street is less than a ten minute walk. I proudly walked up Nob Hill which begins just steps from the hotel. Nice restaurants nearby. My favorite was a sushi bar that had the food floating by your table on boats in a minuture elevated stream. The staff was courteous. I slept with the windows open and it can get noisy at night if you do that. However, it is no trouble for anyone used to sleeping in a city. Free WiFi. They let me keep the bicycle I rented to explore the city in my room. When the conference room is not used they allow you to keep bicycles there. I like this place and would be happy to stay again on my next trip to San Francisco.

review.title: Best Boutique Hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: We just spent 9 wonderful days at the King George Hotel, a quaint but comfortable boutique hotel, conveniently located a block from SF's Union Square. The most outstanding feature of the hotel was the helpful staff and managers who went over and beyond the call of duty to help us with our every needs. There are some nice restaurants as well as inexpensive cafes surrounding the hotel. There is a good variety of Continental as well as Asian/SE Asian restaurants nearby. The ACT and Curran theatres are located right around the corner from the hotel. Free wireless internet access in the room, free in room coffee and free fresh apples at the front desk were a few of the ammenities we enjoyed. WE also likws the reasonably priced continental breakfast which was available daily in a quaint Victorian setting. The King George is like a home away from home; we loved the ambiance, cleanliness, and most of all, the excellent service offered by the entire hotel staff; therefore, we have already booked another stay at the hotel when we return to SF in 8 weeks. The staff at King George truly exemplified "The true spirit of aloha" during our entire 9 day stay

review.title: comfortable
review.reviewText: this hotel is clean, quaint, very central and resonably priced. Will book again.

review.title: Nice place, would recommend
review.reviewText: Good location. Although the room was quite small, it was nicely decorated and had all the facilities you need. Only the bathroom was a little shabby and could do with a makeover.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Great location. The hotel was nice but not exceptional. The elevator was very slow. Plan on taking the stairs.

review.title: Compact and Central
review.reviewText: The staff at the Hotel ar every accomodating and always available. The one elevator is small, in keeping with the rooms, so you may have to wait a few minutes in order to get up or down. The circular staircase is not one you would want to try above 3 floors and definetly not up. Great location, great value, easy access to cable cars, buses etc. San Francisco is not a place you want to drive in. Mr. Toad's city tours and the other tours of the areas around San Francisco are tremendous and many of them will pick you up and return you to the hotel. There are a number of fabulous restaurants that need to be visited as well as the 67 Starbucks located everywhere. Friendly people, even the street people are polite wether you give them money or not. From Ghiardelli Square down to the Market, it is an interesting and very touristy area. Boudin Bakery is a must as well as the E Market Street vintage street cars.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Cheap, and the location was very convenient!!

review.title: small inexpensive room
review.reviewText: This hotel was great for the money. Great location, lots of shopping, dining very close by. Bart/transit station a couple of blocks away. Nice, small, clean room. Friendly staff. Would definately stay again.

review.title: Nice hotel; not as expensive as the fancier ones
review.reviewText: Just a good hotel 1 block from Union Square. Nice without having to be the extra location and 5 star price. Small room but plenty comfortable. Pleasant stay. Nice staff. etc.

review.title: For the money, is good!
review.reviewText: The hotel is service is very good and clean. However it is dated, and for some people that would be a dislike. I would go back and stay, since it did not bother me. thanks

review.title: If you're into theft, this is the place for you
review.reviewText: My first impression was okay of this hotel. It is rather old and 'boutique-y' (which really means extra small!!) Things were going well until the last night of our 3 night stay. We left for dinner and were only gone an hour- when we came back we found 4 bottles of expensive wine we bought in Napa missing out of our room. Soon after we called the police, we realized my brand new, Sony laptop was also stolen from my room. All in all, I lost 4 bottles of wine, a laptop, a laptop charger, designer sunglasses, and my car keys (thank god I didn't have my car or that may have been gone, too!) And don't think the hotel tried to do anything to compensate us either. We had to file a police report and thank god my renter's insurance is covering my loss. After all was said and done, the hotel basically said the theft was our fault for "leaving our room door open" because any rational and intelligent human being would leave their hotel room door open for anyone to come in and steal their personal belongings. So...to sum up my review I would not recommend this hotel unless you would like all of your valuable, personal belongings stolen from your room.

review.title: Clean, very good staff
review.reviewText: Very good hotel to stay in holiday trip! Clean room and very good staff... Close union square, not expensive...

review.title: Small but adequate
review.reviewText: Fine if you are not planning on spending much time in your room. When we were in San Francisco, it was fairly warm (for them) and our room was on the warm side. The ceiling fan helped. In-room coffee was good and a nice touch.

review.title: Amaizing for the Price
review.reviewText: his hotel is pretty much in the middle of everything. It has nightlife, shopping, and food right outside the front door as well as parking (for about $30 per night but it beats feeding the meeter). AT&T Park is about 10 blocks away and Fisherman's Warf is about the same distance, so everything is within a walkable distance.

review.title: Nice little european style hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel is rather charming with all kinds of details that you'd never see in a bigger corporate hotel. The service and information at the front desk was exceptional. The rooms are small and the bathrooms really small, but the wireless internet is free and fast! Score one for the little guy!

review.title: Excellent service but not a place for relaxation!
review.reviewText: The front desk service was excellent. They were extremely nice and helpful. The room (with one queen) was very small/tight. The biggest issue/complain was noise. The rooms has no air conditioning, therefore, everyone had their windows open which caused a weird external air pressure throughout the hotel, which in turn caused all the room doors to slam shut...all the time.

review.title: not a bad hotel for the price
review.reviewText: hotel was in an excellant location - breakfast wasnt bad for the price, but room service was not worth it. would definately go there again

review.title: Good value friendly helpful staff
review.reviewText: Very comfortable and central place to stay, rooms were small but when you're there to visit the city that doesnt matter. Our room was quiet and perfectly adequate. Price was good. Staff friendly and helpful.

review.title: Great location & great service
review.reviewText: We thoroughly enjoyed our 3-nite stay at King George. Staff was extrememly helpful and accommodating. Concierge service is great. Our King Deluxe room was very manageable in size. Roomy closet provided nice space to store luggage, etc. Great coffee maker. Bathroom is very small (no vanity) but, again, manageable. Hotel is nicely located and convenient to all transportation-BART, cable car, street car, and bus. Hotel continental breakfast does not provide a lot of selection but it is OK if you have to eat something light quickly because of time constraints. We definitely would return to King George Hotel.

review.title: Mixed Experience
review.reviewText: When we arrived to check-in, we were told that they were having maintenance issues and that because of that we had been upgraded to a double, but the room was smoking. The person responded, , "It's okay, it's not your fault" which I thought was a strange response, because of course it wasn't my fault (he definitely wasn't joking either). He then started speaking to me in Spanish (my last name is Spanish), but I don't speak Spanish. I had to tell him that I didn't speak Spanish. Again, very strange. The room was okay, and fortunately did not smell that smoky. It has very modern decor, and was very quiet. The bed was comfortable. The bathroom was very small, and I kept bumping into things. The other staff were very friendly and helpful. The location was great, and the price was also great. Hopefully I just interacted with the wrong people there, and they were going through an unfortunate incident with their plumbing.

review.title: not necessarily the king
review.reviewText: hotel was nice and clean and staff friendly and helpful, although some were a little green . Lobby was a little small, as well as rooms , and elevator was a problem. location is good, but can be noisy and there are too many panhandlers near the front some days.

review.title: Great deal, better location.
review.reviewText: We were very impressed with the King George Hotel. mainly because of the great location and friendly service. The front desk staff seemed genuinely interested in our holiday and how we were doing during our stay. They helped us with directions, restaurant choices, public transit options, and more. The rooms are small, but clean and private, and because San Francisco has endless attractions we were mostly out and on the go. The location is the best asset of this hotel, literally a few blocks from the cable cars, BART transit, Chinatown, Union Square, and shopping galore! We felt quite safe on the streets, and didn't hear any noise at night from our room. Why pay five star prices when you are never in your room? For a couple on a holiday this gem is well worth it. We will be back!

review.title: Central location, but at the price of being bit noisy
review.reviewText: Very comfortable and convenient to city centre with courteous and helpful staff. Good array of eating establishments around both in price and culinary variety. Being centrally located you expect to hear the sounds of a big city, but double glazing would have been appreciated at times.

review.title: Great hotel in good location
review.reviewText: The room was small but very comfortable and clean. Close to union square.

review.title: Would stay there again.
review.reviewText: Great location. Rooms a little small. Breakfast at the Hotel wasn't great value. Staff very helpful.

review.title: Little Gem in SanFrancisco
review.reviewText: I booked the hotel on line and you never know what you will get...I was very impressed with the King George Hotel, a great little hotel with a homely feel. The service was great and the staff were very helpful. A lovely place to stay, very central and within arms reach of everything. I would recommend it to anyone wanting to explore the city as the room rates were great value for money. Would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Great little gem!
review.reviewText: Very cute boutique hotel! Comfy bed, nice lounge, lots of character! Great location, very quick to Muni and Bart. Will stay here on our next trip to SF.

review.title: Friendly little place with 'character'!
review.reviewText: We recently stayed here while driving around California. The welcome we got was very friendly and staff couldn't do enough to help us during our stay! The hotel was very clean & I felt it had a lot of 'charater' - Great! My girlfriend found the room to be small, but we only really used the room as a 'base', anyway. Everything we wanted was here and it made our stay in SF very enjoyable! We'd definatly return!!

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Very good hotel in a fantastic location. Would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Good location, great for the price
review.reviewText: The hotel had an excellent location but parking proved to be a problem as there was no hotel parking. Expect to pay another $30 a day to park in the pay lot across the street.

review.title: Good Hotel for the money
review.reviewText: OK for the money, the pillows need up dating and the walls are paper thin so you can hear anything that is going on.

review.title: Will be going back!!
review.reviewText: The George is a great hotel will very friendly and helpful staff. The location is fantastic - smack bang in the middle of the shopping district and in easy reach of all of San Frans other tourist attractions. The hotels one and only lift results in "Q" at busy times of the hotel - not a prob to us - but can be if you are on the 9th floor!! Breakfast can be a little hit and miss - bog standard continental offer - however not very well topped up - so breakfast can be hard work trying to get all you want!! The rooms are well equipt, clean with tea and coffee making facilities. Not the biggest rooms in the world- however if you are in San Fran to explore and experience it you wont be in your room much!! For what we paid we can not fault the George - and will be going back on our next visit!!!

review.title: Friendly & great location
review.reviewText: The King George is very conveniently situated - close to Union Sq & Powell St cablecar, also close to Market Street for BART & MUNI transport links & the streetcar to the wharfs. Reception staff were helpful. Room small but clean.

review.title: Fine if you want a central location with no frills
review.reviewText: This hotel is really central to everything around Union Square and rooms on the back of the hotel are surprising quiet. The standard rooms are very small, barely enough room for 2 people and their luggage, but clean and tidy. I think you can upgrade, space allowing, to a larger room when you get there for a reasonable price. If you want a nice room, I wouldn't recommend this hotel - but it's fine if you aren't going to spend much time there and want something central.

review.title: Exceptionally nice
review.reviewText: The hotel was everything it advertised and more. All spaces were were-kept/clean and the rooms had all the basics--comfortable bed, TV, desk, wireless access, extra pillows/blankets, hairdryer,coffeemaker, iron, and the daily-refilled candy jar was the treat I really enjoyed! I wouldn't clasify it as luxuriously appointed, but quite clean and above average. The room was small, but suited a single traveler well, and would also suit two if they don't need excessive space. No street noise as I was facing an alley. The staff were incredibly attentive, responsive and helpful--from small requests for information to helping me reserve shuttles. A great location and bang for the buck.

review.title: Noice but old
review.reviewText: Older Hotel in down town San Francisco only a few blocks from Union Square. Clean Rooms very friendly Staff. Confortable place to sleep not alot of on site ammedities. would I stay again? yes.

review.title: Excellent Hotel & Service
review.reviewText: Staying at this hotel was a great experience. Within 300 feet of the hotel were four restaurants that were open 24 hours a day. The staff at the hotel was awesome! The morning/day conceriege was outstanding! He was extremely helpful, pleasant and could not do enough for us. He assisted with public transportation information and airport arrangements. He knew the answer to every question we asked. The location of the hotel was close to Union Square and the Cablecars, as well as all types of public transportation. We never needed a car. The whole experience was wonderful. I would recommend the hotel to anyone. People have indicated the rooms are small, which is true, however, you only sleep there. It never was a problem. I would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Good Deal
review.reviewText: This hotel is right in the midst of the Union Square area. It was pretty easy to find and a few blocks from the train. Staff was helpful of the area and with directions. Plus it was only a 15 minute walk to AT&T park/Pier 38&40!

review.title: Room was very, very small. Very clean and well kept.
review.reviewText: I was surprised at how small the room was even though I booked a queen room. The room was very clean and well kept but noisy at night. The staff were most helpful and curtious.

review.title: Good Value for the Money
review.reviewText: Hotel was well situated in the Union Square area, which makes it convenient to transportation, shopping, and sights. Rooms are small (only in it for sleeping)but comfortable and clean. Would stay here again since it was very reasonably priced!

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: The room was small and you could tell that the hotel was old, but everything was clean and well maintained. The location was great!! You could easily walk to any attraction in the Union Square area and it was in easy walking distance of the Powell St BART station, so we didn't have to use a cab or shuttle to get to the hotel from the airport. The room rate was also very reasonable.

review.title: Too crowded because facilities are small.
review.reviewText: Reasonable value for price considering location, but rooms are very small and lobby and only one elevator too small for the crowd.

review.title: skip it. It is not a boutique hotel
review.reviewText: Not worth the money. Room and bathroom is very small. Did not get the wake up call that was promised. Very Very average

review.title: Pleasantly surprised with room
review.reviewText: Had charm and comfort, although small, was cozy and clean, bed-mattres was comfortable. Staff was courteous and helpful. Location was great, could walk to shopping, tranportation, chinatown etc. Would definitelly stay there again and recommend to other travelers

review.title: Excellent D/T San Francisco Hotel
review.reviewText: A cozy older hotel near the heart of the city. Warm welcome and great hospitality by the staff. Close to everything you might want to do in the city of San Franciso.

review.title: I like this hotel
review.reviewText: Small, older hotel, European style. Some rooms are very small but they also have larger ones. Very clean, comfortable, good service. Reasonable rates for a very convenient location in downtown San Francisco. Wifi comes with the cost of the room. Great restaurant next door.

review.title: Charming Hotel
review.reviewText: My sister and I stayed at the King George Hotel during a class reunion week-end. We had a room with two twin beds. It was small but completely adequate. Nicely appointed and very European in look and feel. All of the hotel staff were extremely helpful and accommodating. We didn't get a change to try the breakfast. The only cavet I would give would be to bring earplugs. As with most older (charming) hotels, the walls aren't to thick. With that said, we will definitely stay here again.

review.title: Position, position, position at a price you can afford.
review.reviewText: This boutique hotel offered me, travelling alone post-business trip, the ideal location to explore, shop and eat in San Francisco. I made a special request for a bathtub, fridge and closet space and all were provided in my 'stay 3 nights for 2' deal. I slept better without the usual air conditioning and the ceiling fan was the quietest I've ever experienced. Concierge service was very helpful. Definitely great value for money.

review.title: great place great location
review.reviewText: great place...friendly folks

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Walk everywhere!

review.title: Budget traveler's gem
review.reviewText: The location is great. Rooms are kept very clean, and do not have the cleaning chemical smells that many hotels do. For the price, we were pleasantly surprised.

review.title: It was good for the price
review.reviewText: The hotel rooms are very small and the walls are paper thin, we were there through the weekend and could here people all night long, it sounded like they were outside our door. Other then that, the front staff was wonderful, very friendly as we came and went.

review.title: cramped and tiny, awkward room and bathroom layout
review.reviewText: Old and tired. Noisy area.

review.title: Heart of SF
review.reviewText: Very close to Union Square. Stayed on Executive Floor. Clean room, flat screen TV and free Internet.

review.title: Convenient, good value
review.reviewText: The King George Hotel - Union Square is very convenient, close to Union Square, Market Street and the Moscone Convention Center. My room was small but clean and comfortable with a well lit bathroom. The bed was very comfortable. Recommended.

review.title: This hotel is good value for money
review.reviewText: I would definitely stay at this hotel if I were to visit San Francisco again. The beds are comfortable, the staff really helpful and the location is great, less than 5 minutes from Union Square. The diner next door is great for breakfast or hot chocolate (It also does room service to the hotel).

review.title: Great Location, but Tiny
review.reviewText: When I arrived, I was greeted with a warm hello. Check in was a breeze. I even requested an early check in, which was granted. My room was on the seventh floor and though the hallways were narrow, it did have charming atmosphere and decoration. And though the room was clean, room remaining cool via the window, and having a large comfy bed (I had the King delux room), desk and armchair, there wasn't much room to walk around. In fact the larger dresser and coffee maker were located in the closet, which was a bit of a disappointment. And the service was great. The concierge was a great help when arranging a taxi to a from the hotel. I would stay there again!

review.title: Will use this hotel again and again
review.reviewText: The King George was an excellent choice for my family's vacation. The staff was professional & very friendly. The hotel was wonderful!!! I would recommend it to anyone going to SF.

review.title: Good value
review.reviewText: Convenient central location and easy to access via BART from international airport. Wish I had been given wireless internet log on details without having to chase up

review.title: We'll be back!
review.reviewText: Spent a week there overall and felt very comfortable and well looked after - the front desk's recommendations on restaurants were excellent ie. Kuletto's Italian and Colobri's Mexican - both highlights of our month away and only a short walk from the hotel. The reception staff and concierge were very friendly and made everything very accessible. Already planning to go back to San Fran and staying with them again.

review.title: King George is nice
review.reviewText: I was in San Fran on business. The rooms are small but quaint. The hotel bar downstairs is very nice and the continental breakfast was always fresh. I'd stay here again.

review.title: Quaint
review.reviewText: King George hotel was quaint with a great location near Union Square and friendly staff. We only stayed 1 night but was a nice stay.

review.title: very friendly and helpful
review.reviewText: breakfast not good, no choice, too simple,bad coffee

review.title: Small, comfy, friendly hotel
review.reviewText: Great, central location. nice, tranquil atmosphere. Tasteful furnishings. Very nice, intimate bar. Room small but comfortable and immaculate. Helpful, friendly staff. Would definitely stay here again.

review.title: Would stay again
review.reviewText: Very satisfied with our stay. Friendly, convenient, small but quaint. Not much of a view, but we were not in the room for the view.

review.title: King Geroge Hotel - Union Sq, San Francisco
review.reviewText: I stayed here with my 14 year old daughter. The hotel was excellently positioned adjacent to Union Square. Facilities weren't extensive, with a comfortable bar area and restaurant. Internet facilties were provided in the reception area, which were ideal for my 14year old daughter to email her friends. Staff were very polite and friendly. The room (twin) wasn't particularly large, but was very tidy with coffee making facilties and a large TV. The room did provide an in house safe free of charge. Also provided were iron and board. The only real criticism was the size of the bathroom. It was very small and cramped. Overll, for a *** hotel it was more than adequate and was very good value for money. I would happily stay here again.

review.title: It takes more than new paint to make an old building a boutique hotel
review.reviewText: I chose this hotel based on reviews here. Location is good, check-in service excellent. But this is not really a boutique hotel - it is an old building that has been nicely renovated and cleaned up, but at heart - is still an old building with new paint. It is not in the same class as nearby hotel such as the Serrano. Admittedly I chose this based on price since by "regular" Union Square hotels were much more expensive on the dates for this particular stay. Everything was adequate but there was really very little "charm" here.

review.title: This hotel is a keeper
review.reviewText: My son and I spent two nights here in May 2008 and found the King George Hotel to be a very nice experience. Our room had two twin beds and while small - it was decorated very nicely and was quite comfortable. One disclaimer - our room window was on the brick alley below where the garbage cans were ... so ear plugs would be recommended. Great location, we walked nearly everywhere. Cable car at Powell Street two blocks away. The cozy English lounge is very nice for a glass of wine after a long day - and the continental breakfast was a bargain at $7.95 per person. Staff very friendly, and concierge helpful. I would definitely go back here again.

review.title: very quaint, a little small
review.reviewText: I enjoyed my stay, I think that the breakfast should be complimentary.

review.title: lovely
review.reviewText: very clean, European style hotel. Hotel staff were polite & very knowledgeable. I had the best hotel stay I have ever had.

review.title: Everything you need during a short city break
review.reviewText: Good location, close to Union Square, cable cars, public transport, shops. Friendly and efficient hotel staff. Our room was not very large, but more than adequate. Clean room and bathroom, complementary wireless internet access, all good and we couldn't think of anything to complain about. Well recommended if you're looking for an affordable and decent place to sleep.

review.title: Over expectations, fab hotel!
review.reviewText: A gem! Perfect location, great service, clean rooms. I'm coming back!

review.title: Dont go in warm weather...NO air conditioning !
review.reviewText: Expedia's description should specifically include whether the hotel is air conditioned. Granted many San Francisco hotels do not have A/C, but most travelers assume a hotel has A/C unless it's really low end. The temp was an unseasonal 92 degrees. Luckily the windows opened but I dont know which was worse, the heat or noise. The gal who checked us in probably knew we would not be too happy as she encouraged us to call Expedia to cancel/change hotels, but we didnt want to waste 2 hrs plus the cancel penalty. The only good thing was the hotel allowed us early check-in and personnel were friendly and courteous.

review.title: The only hotel I will choose when I visit SF
review.reviewText: Good hotel, in fact one of the better ones I have stayed in for the price range. Hotels in SF tend to be a hit-or-miss thing. For the same price, you can get a totally cool bargain or get totally ripped off. King George Hotel belongs to the former, with its excellent service and well-maintained rooms, not to mention the fact that it's so near Union Square.

review.title: definitely not impressed
review.reviewText: What's slightly bigger than a bread box, has no heat in the bathroom and rocks for pillows? My room at the King George...

review.title: Vintage 1914 Hotel Convenient to Union Square at Reasonable Rates
review.reviewText: We got a lot of help from Expedia to select the King George Hotel from hundreds of hotels and motels in the San Francisco area. We were glad that substantial numbers of previous Expedia travelers had selected the King George hotel ... and thus placed it in the top 20 most-selected hotels (by Expedia travelers). We were looking for some classic San Francisco charm ... and found it at the King George Hotel. Thanks fellow Expedia travelers.

review.title: good hotel
review.reviewText: it is a great hotel

review.title: great place to stay
review.reviewText: hotel is very near union square. the staff are very helpful and friendly. definitely i will stay again when i am in town.

review.title: Fabulous service and great location
review.reviewText: The service was incredible--very attentive staff. The rooms were clean and fairly comfortable (though small). Great location. I would stay here again!

review.title: loveley place to stay in SF
review.reviewText: small but very nice little hotel.room was very comfortable and kept very clean..other reviews have stated that the bathroom was very small..well yes it was but hey what do you want to do in there.location was excellent and the staff were very helpfl and friendly.We will actively seek to stay there again.

review.title: great place to stay!
review.reviewText: Even though the rooms were small, they were very comfortable. The hotel staff were some of the friendliest and accommodating people I have encountered in my many travels. The hotel was in a super location next to great restaurants and shopping, plus the cable car stop was only a very short walk. I would recommend the King George to anyone!

review.title: Heart of San Francisco
review.reviewText: The King George gives everything it promises and more! It's location is great for getting everywhere, an easy walk to galleries and the theater. We felt safe too. The elevator is vintage, like the rest of the hotel. Keep this in mind when you're waiting in the lobby. Better to use your legs and the city transporation. However, in getting to the airport, they provide a limo ride for the same rate as a taxi. My advice is to take the Limo. The concierge was a great help, as was the rest of this attentive staff.

review.title: Long Beach Travelers
review.reviewText: Loved the hotel and the location was perfect. Very charming and quaint. I also appreciated the wine and beer bar with it's cozy ambiance. Overall, I was very happy with my stay at the King George and would definetly stay there again!

review.title: Great Location!
review.reviewText: This hotel is in an excellent location and the staff are very friendly. The only downside is the walls are very thin so you can hear everything!

review.title: Great value
review.reviewText: Great value for the location of the hotel, right in downtown SF.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: The king george hotel was alot smaller than we expected but it made it cozy. It is located right in the middle of the city close to everything you need! Service in the hotel was great, they helped us find our way around the city and were very helpful and welcoming. I would definitely stay again.

review.title: Great value.
review.reviewText: The bathroom could use a shelf. There is no where to put your toothbrush, etc. Otherwise everything was great. Good water pressure and temperature for the shower :-) Hotel location is great, very close to restaurants and the cable car.

review.title: The walls are thin.
review.reviewText: Nice, friendly hotel employees. Great breakfast recommendation next door at the Mason Cafe. Comfortable, clean room. Nice fan in the ceiling. Pillows were lumpy and the walls were thin-could hear people talking on their cell phones late at night next door.

review.title: recommendation
review.reviewText: I can really recommend this hotel if you do not want to spend a lot of money of a hotel in San Francisco. It has extremely nice service and they are customer oriented. You can really get anywhere from its location. If I go again to San Francisco I will stay there again. Joanna

review.title: can't beat the location
review.reviewText: We stayed for 4 nights. Great location, center of everything. EZ access to Muni and BART. Hotel room was small but cozy. We were comfortable in it. Bathroom small and a bit old but still fine. Noise from streets were heard but only b/c we had window open since it was so warm outside.

review.title: Very comfortable...
review.reviewText: This hotel is in a good location, albeit a small hotel, it is comfortable and quite afforable.

review.title: would stay at the King George Hotel next time were in San Fransico
review.reviewText: We were very pleased with the location of the Hotel. The rooms were a little small but very clean and comfortable. The staff were very friendly,pleasant and extremely helpful. We will recommed this hotel to friends(in fact we already have)

review.title: Great Location!
review.reviewText: The location of the King George is the best asset! We read that The King George was an older property and you could hear noise in the hallways/toilets flushing - that is still true - just bring earplugs. Overall, the staff, cleanliness and location made it excellent value!

review.title: NICE HOTEL
review.reviewText: FOR AN OLDER HOTEL IT WAS VERY NICE. VERY CLEAN AND ALL THE STAFF WERE VERY, VERY HELPFUL! THE ROOMS ARE SMALL, BUT, NOT TINY. MY HUSBAND AND I STAYED THERE FOR 5 NIGHTS AND WE HAD ENOUGH ROOM. WE WERE A LITTLE SCARED AFTER READING SOME OF THE POSTS, BUT, FOR THE PRICE IT IS A WONDERFUL HOTEL. THIS HOTEL WAS CLEANER THAN THE UPPER TIER HOTEL WE STAYED AT IN ST. LOUIS BEFORE OUR FLIGHT AND THE STAFF WILL TEND TO YOUR EVERY NEED!!

review.title: Great service, friendly staff
review.reviewText: The rooms are small, but it's a great value in the heart of the city. The staff was very helpful and friendly and in tune with our needs. The downside is it can be a big noisy at night if you have your windows open, but earplugs help.

review.title: I recommend King George
review.reviewText: Wonderful location, the center of San Francisco. Very helpful friendly staff, I needed luggage stored for a day, directions, bus information, and shuttle service. Staff also gave great restaurant recommendations.

review.title: Good location but way too small room
review.reviewText: The hotel is located in the middle of downtown and right between two restaurants. Extremely convenient but the room is too small. There's not enough space for luggage. Plus, the hotel doesn't have an air conditioner which freaks me out the most. (I've never seen any three star hotel without air conditioner!)

review.title: Consistently good service and convenient location
review.reviewText: My third stay at this hotel confirms that they consistently deliver high quality at a very reasonable price at a great location.

review.title: Tiny rooms, but good price and service
review.reviewText: Compared to other hotels in the area that offer similar rates, the King George Hotel is very nice. The staff is friendly and the location is good. The rooms are fairly small, but are decorated well. The hotel has a lovely bar behind the lobby that is very comfortable and looks somewhat upscale. They offer breakfast in the morning for a small fee, but it's strictly a "continental breakfast" and isn't worth the price. Overall: friendly staff, pretty but small rooms, good location and price.

review.title: Good value and great location
review.reviewText: The King George Hotel was a great value. Ask for a room off the street as people on the street tend to get loud. The room was very comfortable and had the feel of a European hotel (with better restroom facilities). The staff was very accomodating. I arrived before their check-in time and they were able to give me an early check-in. The location was great. The hotel was only about a block from the Powell St. BART station and close to all city transportation. Also was in walking distance to many restaurants and attractions as the King George is located in Union Square. Overall the hotel is a great option for people who want a clean, comfortable room and great location and can live without the modern feel of some of the "super hotels" (and the price).

review.title: WOULD STAY THERE AGIAN
review.reviewText: PARK ACROSS STREET

review.title: very knowledgeable and friendly staff
review.reviewText: we totally liked it; rooms were small but very clean. We were totaly impressed with the friendliness of receptionists and concierge staff. If you need a ride to the airport they also can offer a semi-limo for a flat fee, which comes in handy if you have a flight early in the morning when the airport shuttles don't operate.

review.title: Great Hotel in San Francisco
review.reviewText: A great stay, the satff is extremely helpfull in helping you getting around the city and organizing your stay. VEry cosy and sweet hotel in a nice area

review.title: Great Hotel
review.reviewText: Great place to stay if you want to be near Union Square. Rooms were small, but cozy.

review.title: great location near Union Square
review.reviewText: Older hotel with small rooms. However the room was clean,bathroom functional. Staff all friendly and helpful. Easy check in-out. Walking distance to all stores. Restaurant suggestions excellent (Daily Grill around the corner) Overall I would recommend this hotel but keep in mind it is old with small rooms. The price was right! I might stay again.

review.title: Nice for the Price
review.reviewText: The King George is great if you want to stay right in the city without spending tons of money. The staff was friendly, the room was clean--small but clean. The bathroom was bare bones but totally fine. There was some street noise nothing to complain about.

review.title: Will not stay here again
review.reviewText: this place is very small and the wall is very thin. You can hear your next door neighbor. The maids are super loud in the morning. I would not stay here again...

review.title: I Secret I would rather keep!
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a perfect spot for any travler to land in. But it is also a great place to be in to relax and then travel around San Fran. The apples at the check in are great . The privacy is wonderful once you get to your room. If your room seems small, remember you are in a really great space. The hotel has a great history about it. Check out the stairs and make sure to tip the bar tender on your way up again on the elevator.

review.title: The room was very small
review.reviewText: Friedly personnel, but really small room

review.title: Great Location!
review.reviewText: Hotel is in a great location in Union Square. Do not get a room facing the street because it can get loud on weekend nights. We really enjoyed being able to have everything right around us. We walked to Fisherman's Wharf, China town, and Little Italy. Everything is in walking distance if you are a walker. We would return to this hotel. We did not eat here.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Old, small, no frills

review.title: Good Value for Money
review.reviewText: As long as you know you are going to be in an old building, you shouldn't be disappointed. Room was as clean as could be (felt no need to wear slippers!); good water pressure in bathroom; staff always very pleasant and helpful; free internet access a big bonus; and excellent location. Only drawback was thin walls.

review.title: tiny rooms
review.reviewText: these rooms are tiny. Clean, but tiny, hard to ove around, no closet space.

review.title: Nice small niche hotel
review.reviewText: Friendly, smooth functioning hotel. Well located. My only problem at all was slow internet. When I told them about it, they were very concerned and made every effort to fix it immediately.

review.title: Pretty Awesome
review.reviewText: Yeah, the rooms are pretty tiny, and yeah the hotel shows a bit of age - but it is almost 100 years old. The location is perfect, although if the high number of beggars bothers you at all, I would avoid Union Square altogether. While they are mostly harmless, their persistence may make some travelers uncomfortable. The homeless lady who holds open the door of the parking garage across the street from the King George, however is very nice and I recommend throwing her some change every time you see her. That said, the King George has a very friendly staff, especially housekeeping, and the bellman. I also really liked the decor in our room.

review.title: Very nice hotel
review.reviewText: The staff was "awesome". The continental style breakfast if very pricey, but lots of other choices near by. The rooms are small, but if you just want a place to lay your head and get a good sleep, this is the place. Rooms were very clean and we found them quiet, although some have said otherwise.

review.title: Nice place in good location
review.reviewText: definitvely recommendable

review.title: European flavor
review.reviewText: The King George is a European flavor in the Union Square section of San Francisco. All my requests for service were answered promptly and efficiently. Staff is friendly and courteous.

review.title: Small but plesant
review.reviewText: We stayed 3 nights for a conference held at Moscone Center. (It's an easy 10 minute walk away.)The room was really small, but nicely arranged and comfortable. Amenities are set up more for someone just using the place to sleep, rather than spending much time in the room. The front desk staff were all very nice over the course of the stay. The elevator is tiny and very slow, so be prepared to hike or wait. The bed was really nice and firm and the room (on the 7th floor set back from the street)was very quiet. Everything is wonderfully non-smoking! Didn't have a chance to use the lounge/bar or eat in the KG. I would stay again for the convenient locale, but wouldn't put it on my "special places" list.

review.title: An amazing San Francisco Hotel
review.reviewText: This was my forth trip to San Francisco and the King George has to be the best hotel I have stayed in so far. Its only 5 minutes to Union Square and less than 10 minutes to the BART and Cable Car stops on Powell and Market. The central location of the King George makes it an ideal hotel for those visiting San Francisco for shopping or those who simply gone to explore the wonderful sites and rich history. If you plan on visiting San Francisco I really do recommend the King George Hotel it will make your stay.

review.title: Great find in San Fran
review.reviewText: I enjoyed my short stay at the King George. The rooms are small but not uncomfortable. My only complaint is that the walls are extremely thin, so bring earplugs if you plan on sleeping in.

review.title: great hotel with very helpful staff
review.reviewText: A great place to be based when on business. Wireless included in price, staff excellent and 24hr breakfast/restaurants on the same block. Just about as good as you can get. Two blocks from Bart.

review.title: Nice and comfy feeling
review.reviewText: Great small and cozy feeling. Almost has the charm of a bed and breakfast. Very friendly front desk and good location to downtown.

review.title: Can't Wait to Go Back!
review.reviewText: The King George Hotel in SF was more than my friend and I expected...a quaint hotel in the heart of Union Square! The staff was great, the rooms were clean and the location was just awesome! I've stayed at other boutique hotels in San Francisco, but this one topped them all. The rooms are a bit small (although expected), and the bathroom even smaller, but still at the top of my list! There is not a full service restaurant on site, but they do offer free coffee in the a.m. and a continental breakfast at a reasonable price. On my next excursion to the city, I will definitely stay at the King George.

review.title: Better to go to a cheap motel
review.reviewText: Apart from his location, this hotel is offering you discomfort after a long trip. You'd be better off in a motel if you don't mind not being right in the center or paying an extra to go to a comfortable place.

review.title: Great Hotel. I would always recommended this hotel.
review.reviewText: Everything was perfect.Great hotel and personnel. Personnel were very,very kind. I travel a lot but I have never seen hotels personnel kind as in this hotel.

review.title: Nice hotel, great location
review.reviewText: I went there with a buddy of mine for Thanksgiving. The hotel's location is awesome, a couple of blocks away from Union Square, which is where all the major shops are. Comfy room, kind staff. Only thing is the parking, which is unbelievably expensive. We thought it was included...

review.title: Keep it to yourself!
review.reviewText: A friendly and helpful staff make this lovely, few frills but great value hotel in the heart of SF action a wonderful "find". Many restaurants with everything from pub fare to SFs jewel "Michael Mina" are only a few steps away. You are also a few yards away from one of America's finest theater companies: ACT(American Conservatory Theater.) And just around the corner, you can visit Joe for the finest shoe shine in town!

review.title: small room good location
review.reviewText: good location close to union square but alot of homeless people room was small

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: Not great, but for the price, not bad.

review.title: satisfactory
review.reviewText: I would definately try to look for a better deal on some other hotel before thinking of staying at King George again. It was just satisfactory. Nothing overwelming. Although according to cost, it was ok.

review.title: Great place for a great price
review.reviewText: As others stated the rooms are small but very comfortable. Staff is extremely helpful and pleasant. It's a great location and I would definitely stay again. Remember it is San Francisco so there is a bit of street noise at night but we still had a lovley stay

review.title: good location
review.reviewText: The hotel is in the Union Square, downtown of San Francisco and is close to all of attractions. Shopping center, art galleries, theater, resturants are nearby. The service of hotel is excellent.

review.title: Affordable, clean, small room
