review.reviewText: Bed linens were pristine, toilet was clean and service was good. Room was small. Windows are single pane. New windows would be a great improvement in soundproofing. It is located in what seems to be a hotel district. It is very close to cable car terminus on Powell and Market. No good food around, but SF is fun to walk and drive around.

review.title: Great Stay
review.reviewText: Great location right near all transportation. We enjoyed our time there. Staff was really friendly and took care of us. We had heard that there was some street noise at the hotel but we barely heard any. Great price

review.title: Trip to SFO
review.reviewText: Great hotel, great service, great location if you want to shop or get around generally.

review.title: Good value
review.reviewText: For the price and location, the King George is good value for money. Only negative point is no air con in the room, which would be an inssue in the warmer months.

review.title: Great little hotel
review.reviewText: Staff were very helpful and friendly. And you're next door to the Cafe Mason, a good place for any meal of the day. And you're walking distance from Sears (excellent breakfast) and many other restaurant choices. And you can be on Telegraph Hill, in North Beach, in Golden Gate Park, or at Fisherman's Wharf in minutes. I don't care a fig about the fancy stores around Union Square, but for getting to all areas of town, the location is great. OK, the rooms are small. But are you going on vacation so you can stay in your room?? Get real. This is a place to sleep. Our room was quiet enough, and large enough for the two of us. But I have to say, if you're a large person, don't stay here -- or at any of the hotels near Union Square. You will find the rooms and bathrooms ridiculously cramped. But if you're average-sized or small, no problem. (Although I was barely able to bend over to pick up a bar of soap without bumping my head on the shower wall.)

review.title: This hotel is a mixed bag
review.reviewText: I reserved two rooms on Expedia, one for me and one for a work colleague. They were of very different quality even though the price was the same and, unfortunately, my colleague's room was awful and I was very quite embarassed. His was directly against the elevator, very noisy, unrenovated, shabby, and old looking. My room was better but there was almost no light in the room - I had to turn my computer on to illuminate things enough to read comfortably. It wasn't terrible but barely adequate, I would say. My room was much better - still not terrific but adequate - but overall, it wasn't a great experience for me.

review.title: Great Hotel!
review.reviewText: We selected the King George hotel mainly for it's location and the price. It was far nicer than expected. The rooms are small but perfectly liveable. We knew we were not going to be in the room much anyway. The bed was super comfy. The front desk was also extremely helpful and very pleasant whether it was 6 AM or midnight. We would definitely stay again on our next visit.

review.title: I'll be Back
review.reviewText: Great place, great staff; a very European feel (in a good way); Will stay there again. Close to art, cable cars, coffee, and beer. Great place for coffee next door. Interesting view from the roof. Within walking distance to the SFMOMA.

review.title: Handy Hotel
review.reviewText: Central, friendly, clean, helpful - just some of the many good things about this hotel. On a sightseeing holiday to San Francisco, this hotel is minutes from the tourist information office, Bart, underground, bus and tram-lines and the famous cable cars, to take you anywhere you need to go. Extremely handy for a wide array of quality restaurants of varying types and price ranges. Two thumbs up!

review.title: A nice hotel
review.reviewText: The King George was a cute hotel. Our room was clean, but small. The only draw back I found was that our bathroom didn't have any space to layout toiletries and curling irons, etc. However, the room was very reasonably priced and in a convenient area close to a lot of shopping.

review.title: San Frans best Little secret
review.reviewText: A great place to stay, wonderful location. Not a place to stay if you have a rental car ( $32.00 a night for valet).

review.title: A Deal Fit for a King
review.reviewText: I was hesitant to book this hotel because the price was so much lower than the Clift and Monaco nearby (both of which I've stayed in the past) -- but I trusted the user reviews and went for it. How bad could it be? Well, as it turns out, not bad at all! Very nice, quaint hotel. Friendly service. Nice clean rooms. Interesting (although not top shelf) decor. Very, very comfortable bed. In general I found it a pleasure to stay at the King George -- and with it's great location, it's going to be a difficult hotel NOT to stay at when I return to San Francisco.

review.title: 2 Star rating by my scale
review.reviewText: I'd rate this hotel as a 2 Star, no higher. It is an older property with older construction and furnishings. Good location.

review.title: Very Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Very Nice location, and very nice staff.

review.title: good hotel
review.reviewText: is a good hotel for the price, if you want a hotel not expensive but with excellent service and location, this is the hotel for you

review.title: Great Boutique Hotel in a Great Location
review.reviewText: Staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Wireless service is better than some major hotel chains. Pillow-top king bed was grand. Would definitely stay at the King George again.

review.title: First Choice when returning to San Francisco
review.reviewText: GREAT location, just a block from Union Square. Front desk staff was friendly and helpful. The room we requested was unavailable, but they upgraded at no extra cost. The room was great: two double beds, nice bath with a tub/shower combo and lots of room by San Francisco standards. We were there only one night, but it is our first choice the next time we are in the City.

review.title: Our New Home Away from Home
review.reviewText: We're so glad our usual hotel was full when we visited San Francisco as we discovered the King George Hotel! Couldn't be more convenient just a block from Union Square. Across the street is the Pinecrest Cafe--don't just a book by its cover--which has the absolute best breakfast in the City. John at the front desk is exceptional, our room wa immaculate. It's an old, classy San Francisco hotel so don't expect the suburban expanse of a chain. The bathrooms will feel cramped with small mirrors and little counter space, but it's immaculate! When is the last time your hotel bathroom came with Q-tips and cotton balls? The candy dish on the desk was a nice added touch. The only complaint: the box-spring made a funny "groaning" noise when you sat on or turned on the bed and the bottom sheet came untucked throughout the night, but that's in common to many hotels--very annoying though. You'll love this place!

review.title: Need to sound proof the rooms
review.reviewText: My wife and I took a short trip to San Fran for the weekend. The hotel was very nice and the staff very helpful. The two problems we had that if you get a room facing the street be prepared to not get a good nights sleep because the walls are so thin and there is not sealing around the windows there is no sound deadining in the room the first night we didn't sleep well at all because of all the noise. The Hotel staff was very accomidating and moved our room the next day. The last thing was the price for parking at the hotel was a little outragous, I know parking is a premium in the city but the hotels parking were the same price as the parking garage across the street. The rooms were very clean and nice and other than the two issues the Hotel was great.

review.title: Wonderful boutique hotel with a great location
review.reviewText: We found and booked the King George thru Expedia for 4-nights in September/07. We were very happy with everything about the hotel - a charming old hotel very nicely maintained. Our room was clean, the bed was comfortable, and the staff was friendly and very helpful with tour bookings. The location is great too - across the street and around the corner from the theatres and a block from the the Union Square.

review.title: Friendly but old and a bit dirty
review.reviewText: I would only recommend this hotel if you are on a budget and spending 3 nights or less.

review.title: Ideal downtown comfort
review.reviewText: Highly recommend the King George for location, friendly helpful staff, and general features. Rooms are small but very well-presented - everything we needed was there. The neighbourhood felt safe and there was a good range of restaurants nearby.

review.title: Pleasantly Surprised
review.reviewText: We didn't know what to expect, but it turned out that the King George was perfect for what we needed. Ideally located for shopping and access to Fisherman's Wharf and Chinatown, the King George was a great place to stay. Although the room was small, it was clean and comfortable. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful and made us feel welcome. There was some street noise that could be heard, but I think that would be the case in any hotel situated in downtown San Francisco. We would certainly stay there again.

review.title: Four nights for two
review.reviewText: Oasis feel as soon as you walked in, right in the thick of things off Union Square. Far enough away from the lousy areas to feel safe. Their website didn't do my well designed room justice, which was very quiet and clean. Not a room with a view, it had this small and oddly placed window looking out onto an alley, so it was dark. I rather liked the affect. The bed made me want to replace my own. Total comfort (king bed, on the first floor where all the rooms are larger. Short flight of stairs enabled me to avoid the small and busy elevator, too). Loved the location of the parking garage right across the street. Cafe Mason next door had great food with Little Diva waitresses who needed encouragement. I had a good time, great bang for the buck.

review.title: I will stay there again
review.reviewText: The staff was very friendly and helpful. The maintenance of the hotel was commendable and in all respects, staying at the King George made this trip a wholly enjoyable one.

review.title: quaint with character
review.reviewText: I enjoyed staying at the King George. The hotel is quaint and has character, unlike so many large hotel chains. The rooms were small, but it really didn't bother me at all.....that's just part of staying in an older SF hotel. The hotel is close to Union Square which I didn't enjoy so much- crowded with tourists and upscale chain retail stores (the Gap and such)....that wasn't my thing. It is close to the trolley line and easy to get around. I would recommend.

review.title: Would definitely stay there again!
review.reviewText: Hotel staff were friendly, courteous and efficient! The room quaint, neat and tidy. And their recommendation of Mason's Cafe next door was spot on, a fantastic place to eat!

review.title: Very good hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel is very nice. The rooms are small but convenient. Only one small elevator for the hotel, thus you need to wait a lot. Exept these two points, the hotel is perfect. Go head

review.title: Europian Style w/ Better Service
review.reviewText: When arriving in S.F. we thought we would stay at the K.G. for 1 night and look for another place if it was not a good place. This is a very Europian style Hotel smaller rooms than your typical U.S. rooms but no one can ask for better service, attention, or respect as a customer. Hotel was exceptionally clean and the staff was just out of this world! Would defiantly stay there again if returning to S.F. Many Thanks from Us to the Staff, YOU ROCK!!

review.title: Location, Location, Location
review.reviewText: As my first visit to a city of this size i wasn't sure what to expect. The hotel was clean and the staff very helpful, its an older, smaller hotel so the rooms are not huge but we clean and comfortable, and in any case being on vacation it was more a place to sleep that anything else. The best part was the location, just a minute or two's walk from Union Square and the cable car route, which was perfect. It was also directly opposite a parking structure with reasonable (for the city) overnight rates.

review.title: Overall A+
review.reviewText: Great location--short walk to the shopping district, lots of great eateries and shops nearby, polite and helpful staff, clean room, very old but well maintained hotel. Would stay again if we're in San Fran.

review.title: Great central location
review.reviewText: Great central location. We walked all over the east side of the city and felt safe at all times. The hotel was wonderful, the room small but very stylish and comfortable, the hotel very helpful and personable, nice bar with happy hour, fast and efficient check-in with baggage check (we were there before check-in time) and super quick accurate check-out in the very early morning.Will definitely be back!

review.title: Comfy and cozy
review.reviewText: It is located one block off of Union Square, so it is convient yet a bit more quiet. The rooms are small and so is the bathroom, but clean and comfy. If you expect to be out seeing the sights all day it is perfect.

review.title: Most rooms look the same with your eyes closed when you're sleeping...
review.reviewText: Sure, you may find a slightly higher-quality hotel nearby, but for the price and location aspects alone I would recommend King George. The staff was friendly and responsive, and the rooms, although small, had comfortable beds and all the space my wife and I needed to function when we weren't out exploring San Francisco. Unless you plan on spending more than 2 hours of waking time a day in your hotel room, you can't go wrong with the King George hotel.

review.title: Nicely furnished little room
review.reviewText: Located conveniently near the BART and Muni trains in Union Square, this hotel is definetly a bargain and pleasant place to stay. Although after exploring San Francisco a bit, I realized Union Square is not exactly the most fun neighborhood to stay in, it may be the most centrally located. I would definetly recommend this place and would stay here again. Oh and the staff is extra helpful.

review.title: good location
review.reviewText: Had everything we needed and lots of places to eat close by.

review.title: room was small. no air conditioning, just overhead fan
review.reviewText: room was very small; no airconditioning, just overhead fan.

review.title: A mixed bag
review.reviewText: The concierge service was substandard and frankly we were given wrong information. When i asked for a bandaid, i was told they had "run out." Couldn't get boarding passes unless i wanted to pay for 20 minutes of internet access in the lobby. On the positive side, it's centrally located close to Union Square; rooms were small but clean and well ventilated with a window and overhead fan.

review.title: Great location; two star hotel
review.reviewText: Great location but the hotel is very old. Elevator service was very slow. Problems with the hot water system made it very erratic (slow to heat up and not at all consistent during a shower). If you can live with the downsides and the price it's not a bad place. Rooms smaller than average.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: Close to the heart of it all this small but cosy hotel is a great place from which to explore San Francisco

review.title: A touch of Europe in downtown SF
review.reviewText: In this small hotel, I felt like I was visiting Europe. Businessmen and tourists with children speaking a wide variety of languages other than English were found in the small restaurant, the lobby and the single hallway. The main staircase spiraled up beside the tiny elevator. The jalousie windows in the private bathroom kept the room a bit chilly and let in sounds of partying on Geary Street, but I found this was manageable when I closed the bathroom door at night. The bedroom was small, but comfortable. The hot water was magnificent and the free in-room WiFi connection was very convenient! The staff was very pleasant and helpful. The breakfast menu was limited, but reasonably priced, and in some cases the price of the room includes a Continental breakfast. If you're up for something out of the ordinary when you travel, stay at the King George!

review.title: Decent hotel
review.reviewText: Hotel was better than I expected. It was in a good location, concierge was helpful, room was clean. Although we didn't have a nice view, it didn't really change anything. Definetly worth the money.

review.title: I recommend this hotel
review.reviewText: Friendy and helpful.

review.title: clean, comfortable, and convenient
review.reviewText: Small, comfortable, basic, and clean. Cheerful lobby. Pleasant staff.

review.title: Overall Satisfied
review.reviewText: The hotel is in a great location. Next to Union Square where the shopping is great. The cable car is also in the same area so it made getting around easy. The staff where very accomodating and friendly. The only downfall is the room did not keep out the noise from the hallways and the bathroom was not the best setup. Overall though I was satisfied with my stay.

review.title: Nice place
review.reviewText: The hotel rooms are cute (but small), the place is clean and the staff are friendly. The only concern is that the place is noisy! You can hear all the street noise plain as day and you can even hear conversations in the next room. The hotel is good value for the money - just make sure you bring ear-plugs.

review.title: Very Good Service
review.reviewText: Had a great time. Hotel is centrally located and charming. The front desk personnel were extremely helpful, especially John. They were able to accomodate our extremely early check in with a room and then we requested another room John was more than happy to help. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

review.title: Great Hotel With Character
review.reviewText: The King George was a delightful change of pace from the cookie-cutter hotels we are accustomed to. We had read reviews from other visitors, but still were a bit taken aback at first by the smallness of the room. After making use of the closet, however, we were actually quite comfortable for our 6-night stay. My husband was skeptical about a hotel with no air conditioning in the middle of July. That would be unheard of here in Texas, but there was no need for anything other than the ceiling fan in San Francisco. The hotel staff could not have been nicer. When we inquired about a day-trip to the Napa Valley, the concierge made note of our questions and had an informative packet of information under our door within the hour. We give the King George two thumbs up!

review.title: will visit again!
review.reviewText: nice staff comfortable rooms good location good pricing

review.title: Would stay again, great location
review.reviewText: Clean hotel. Great location downtown close to restaurants, high end shops & cable car line to get down to Fishermans Wharf. Parking a little expensive however.

review.title: Great Place
review.reviewText: My husband and I spent a long weekend in San Francisco and stayed at the King George. I would definately stay there again. The staff was great, and very helpful with directions and places to visit. Rooms small but cozy and comfortable. Very clean and neat as a pin. The location was excellent and allowed easy access to the great transportation system.

review.title: nice and quaint
review.reviewText: The conceige was helpful. The rooms were small but this was expected. It was clean and close to everything we wanted to be by.

review.title: quaint & cozy
review.reviewText: Nicely kept hotel and also clean. Just wish there was more counter space in the bathroom and that it was a bit larger. :)

review.title: A nice enough place
review.reviewText: Lobby and facade were nice, decorated Victorian/Edwardian style although rooms were not. Very basic bathroom with not a lot of space for toiletries. Bed was very comfortable and there is a ceiling fan and free (!) safe. I think they have free WiFi but we didn't use it. We asked for a quiet room and although it was set far back enough from the street, we could hear our neighbors talking and laughing loudly very early in the morning both days. Perhaps if you get more considerate neighbors this won't be a factor, but you can never be sure who's going to be next door. Tea service was nice (although expensive), but the staff we had was completely inattentive. I had to get up and ask for the check.

review.title: Excellent for middle class stay...
review.reviewText: Though the room is small, I enjoyed the comfort and the idea of resting in the soft linen bed sheets and bed covers. Furthermore, the showers and the restroom was kept rather clean daily. Television programs were rather disappointing but there were sufficient channels to put you to sleep. Besides, the hotel is in a very central location close to the shopping areas and the city central. Access to transportation is readily available. I enjoyed the stay in the hotel and will definitely recommend all tourists to get a reservation at this hotel.

review.title: Needs some updating
review.reviewText: Overall the hotel staff were great. They had a lot of helpful info on places to eat, see and how to get around the city. The room was small and the bathroom needs some updating; it was a little claustraphobic. But, overall I would definitely recommend this hotel to others.

review.title: small room in san fran
review.reviewText: Small rooms with no a/c

review.title: Great for honeymooners!!!
review.reviewText: My wife and I recently spent the first few nights of our Honeymoon at this hotel. We loved it! The staff was great. The rooms are small, so I wouldn't recommend it for more then 2 people, but everything else was great. The proximity to public transportation as well as shopping and dining couldn't be beat.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: paper thin walls and doors. you can hear everything in the hallways and you can hear your neighours talking in the next room. Also there is only one elevator in the hotel that is used by staff and guests. Overall the rooms were clean and the staff were super helpful and nice.

review.title: Do not recommend this hotel - Sleeping impossible
review.reviewText: If you're planning to have a good night's sleep do not come here. You can hear absolutely everything: conversations, tv, radio in the next rooms, people in the hallways, slamming doors. The windows are cheap and do not filter any of the outside noises; feels as though they are wide open and you can hear every car, passerby, etc. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. All I ask of a hotel is that I be able to sleep uninterrupted and unfortunately this did not happen for 5 nights (even with ear plugs).

review.title: Great location, very friendly
review.reviewText: Lives up to its description, the staff are friendly, the rooms personal although its an old building with all the good and bad aspects that go with that Might be a problem in summer - I would cehck air conditioning before booking

review.title: Small but very cozy.
review.reviewText: Queen size room was "old fashioned" but modernized. The room was small but very cozy with all of the amenities. Hotel is within walking distance or quick Muni access to everything. Don't miss happy hour in the cozy lounge. The bartender, Drew, is worth the full price of the half price drinks.

review.title: Cheap and good
review.reviewText: Rooms are a little older style, but for the price in san francisco, very reasonable. Clean overall and friendly staff. Let me check in earlier. Would stay there again.

review.title: Charming and comfortable place
review.reviewText: It is a very nice hotel situated very close to the Union Square, China Town, Market Street, MOMA, theatres and other interesting places. The rooms are small but very comfortable and cosy with elegant furniture. I would recommend it to everyone who likes to spend a few days in a city walking through it and visiting museums.

review.title: Definitely worth the price!
review.reviewText: the hotel is absolutely lovely for the price. It's not absolute luxury, and is a bit cramped, but it's pretty well situated to union square and the trolleys. the crampedness is almost fun if you're the adventurous type.

review.title: Great Location
review.reviewText: Small, boutique hotel with outstanding location. Rooms are very small and a little worn, but clean and well appointed. Elevator is very slow, so I recommend one of the lower floors. The staff was very helpful and friendly, and went out of their way to make my stay pleasant. The staff and the location make this hotel a wonderful value.

review.title: Very good location
review.reviewText: Hotel was clean, staff were friendly and helpful and best of all it is very easy to get anywhere in San Francisco form nearby. I would happily stay at the King George again.

review.title: A Little Gem in a Big City
review.reviewText: I am a fan of small, cozy places to stay, even in large cities. The King George was our answer. There are some charming little touches that made the stay pleasant: there's always a bowl of apples in the lobby; you are knee-deep in 24-hour restaurants and great places to eat in all price ranges, even next door; if you're new to San Fran, this whole section is great without having to climb hills; the maid was very responsive to requests; the hotel front desk staff was always cheerful, helpful and welcoming. A nice surprise was the British tea served on flowered china on Sats. and Suns., with an array of tea sandwiches and sweets and a large pot of tea with many flavors to choose from. Not for those who love a crowd, but charming nonetheless. You're also within easy reach of tons of car rental places. and can return the car across the street. We liked the King George so much that after a stint at Monterey down Rt. 1, we came back to spend a few days at the King George again before leaving for home. A definite home-y feeling, for those who like it that way.

review.title: Good Location - Good Price
review.reviewText: This was a nice hotel in a good location, and a very good value. Staff was helpful and very friendly. The single rooms are a bit small (especially the bathroom), but we knew that from other reviews. A really good choice if you don't need too much glitz. Clean and neat.

review.title: bad choice
review.reviewText: This hotel was very disappointing. The room was small,the bathroom was freezing,and the windows did not keep ANY outside noise out (sirens and car horns all night long. The concierge forgot to make our dinner reservation for us, and while we waited for him to fix this error, the front desk staff bantered with each other in a very juevenile manner, debating the advatntages of their various ethnicities.

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: The room was clean, safe and comfortable for a solo traveler. The staff was extremely helpful in giving directions and information on getting around the city. Close to museums, shopping and all transportation in Union Square. Food available nearby. Internet available in the lobby for a small fee. Overall, a nice stay in a nice hotel. I would definitely go back.

review.title: King George Hotel-Nice Place to stay
review.reviewText: Great Location. A little noisy because of the city, but we had no trouble sleeping. The tea served on Sat. and Sunday was very nice.

review.title: Nice for the price
review.reviewText: This hotel was fine for a short business stay. Very close to Union Square and the large hotels. Room was a little small but they were clean and the service was very friendly and helpful. Would stay again.

review.title: Great value - perfect location
review.reviewText: This has got to be the hotel with the nicest concierge in San Francisco. The location is perfect - only two blocks away from Union Square. WiFi connection was spotty, but overall a great experience. Everything was squeeky clean.

review.title: Nice place good location
review.reviewText: Yhe king was a nice place and the location was great. Union Sq is close to everything, the room I had was a little small but it is what you would expect for a older downtown hotel. The room was clean and the hotel has a nice lobby and bar.

review.title: Nice place to stay in San Francisco
review.reviewText: The hotel is nice and clean. Hotel service was excelent. They put extra pillows in bedroom whithout having to ask for them. Very well located, 2 blocks from the cable car.

review.title: It is a good value hotel. Clean and comfortable
review.reviewText: This hotel is centrally located very close to Union Square. Good value for your money. Attention is always with you. Noisy at nights sometimes.

review.title: Nice place for the money
review.reviewText: Nice, comfortable, affordable and the staff was great.

review.title: For the price ok.
review.reviewText: Excellent location near Union Square. Friendly, helpful staff. The room and bathroom were very small and very dark,surrounded by grey walls for window views all around. Heating system did not work properly during a cold spell.

review.title: Great location, clean, friendly staff
review.reviewText: It was located at centre of Union Square.Easy to go every where. The room was clean, the bed was comportable. Not noisy. Hotel price was good. Everything was good. But there was no free breakfast. I highly recommended this hotel.

review.title: Definitely Recommended
review.reviewText: We stayed at the King George 15th March for one week and have nothing but praise. To be honest we were a little worried after reading previous reviews but as soon as we arrived we knew we had made the right choice. Staff are excellent, most helpful. Rooms are comfortable, ok they are not huge but more than adequate and very clean. If I had to be picky and put something negative I would say that the bar should be open longer hours. Currently it only opens 5-10pm which is a shame. Also it only stocks beers and wines so if you dont like either you are stuffed. Location is fab, couldnt have asked for better. The Diners either side of the hotel do some great food, whether it be breakfast or dinner. The Concierge has some 20% discount vouchers available for both upon request. Only downside to San Fran is the amount of homeless people begging on the streets. We did have one scary incident when we were harrassed and followed back to the hotel by a couple of homeless guys - the concierge had to get rid of them. This was our third trip to San Fran, we have previously stayed in one dearer/higher classed hotel and another that was on a par with the King George - the King George was by far the best and we will definitely be coming back.

review.title: King George review
review.reviewText: We stayed at the KG for two nights in early March 2007. It is a small "boutique" hotel about a block from Union Square and the trolley. The service was absolutely EXCELLENT. On a few different occassions we needed things delivered to our room, and it arrived so quickly! Also, the concierge was very helpful with general info and reservations during our stay. This is not the fanciest hotel around, but it was clean, the people were nice, and the location is GREAT. We would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a few days in SF, when you know you won't be spending much time in your room anyways!

review.title: Great location, service, staff - especially for the low price!
review.reviewText: The hotel was great! An incredible location - so close to Union Square, Market Street, the Ferry Building, and trolleys. Very close to Moscone for convention travelers, but not too close that you feel isolated.

review.title: Very Old... Needs Total/Major Renovations...
review.reviewText: Room: Rooms are very, very small. There is just enough room for the bed, the room door opens right to the bed. The views of most of the rooms are facing a wall (except 2 room on each floor that is in the front of the building). There is no A/C, the only way to cool the room is by opening the window, and however, there are two dilemmas with that 1. The street noise; and 2. The next-door restaurant vent is right next to the hotel and your room will smell like fried chicken all the time. All old and uneven walls, doors and trims seemed freshly painted. Also, rooms are equipped with an old steam cast iron radiator heating system. Bathroom: The most amazing part of my stay was to figure our how they were able to fit a bathtub, toilet, and a sing in such small area. They were all there and all functional despite the fact that they seemed like they were the original fixtures from when the hotel was originally build in the early 1900s. Hotel: The hotel is equipped with one small elevator that could hold up to 4 average size people. The elevator seemed functional and safe. In general the common areas are in fair shape. The hotel staffs are all very polite and will try their best to make your stay enjoyable. Location: You will not find a better location. Near shops, and everything downtown.

review.title: Good place for the money.
review.reviewText: The King George Hotel is cute and comfortable. Great location, clean quiet rooms, very affordable. Would not recommend their breakfast, however; high priced, low quality. Their are much better places to eat nearby. The rooms are neat if somewhat small. My only real complaint: I stayed there for five nights and posted a "do not disturb sign" each of those nights. Yet every morning, bright and early, I awoke to a pushy housekeeper coming into my room. The last thing one wants after a late night on the town.

review.title: Comfort and Old World Luxury
review.reviewText: My husband and I were so impressed by the staff at The King George; they were knowledgeable and extremely helpful as well as being warm and friendly. The rooms are small but very comfortable and the tea on Saturday and Sunday afternoon is excellent. It's a great place to stay if you like theatre and museums --- or just walking!

review.title: great location, mediocre hotel
review.reviewText: Location was good, but the hotel really not that great. Room was very small. Decor not very tasteful. Service was ok.

review.title: Great Location!!
review.reviewText: I went to SF for a conference and the hotel was in a great area for shopping and in walking distance from the Mascone Center. Room was a little smaller than I would prefer but overall not a bad place to stay. The service and staff were both very good.

review.title: They really try.
review.reviewText: This hotel has friendly personnel and has all the basics one needs without the frills. Unfortunately, I chose it beacuse it also had a wireless network which I needed to get my work done. However, this network is incompatible with Mac's (believe it or not) and as much the hotel personnel tried, the company to whom this service was out sourced, no repair could be made in a timely fashion. Very frustrating as there was no wired connection either.... and all this in SF! Otherwise, it is a good hotel for those who only want the hotel to come back to and sleep in a clean room with basic amenities.

review.title: Enjoyable stay
review.reviewText: Hotel is centrally located, clean and the staff are more then courteous. Would highly recommend for value.

review.title: An Excellent Choice
review.reviewText: The hotel was clean and staff very friendly. Location was excellent being just a block from Union Square. Theaters and rental car agenices are within a blocks walking distance. Fine restaurants are within walking distance. I would go back in a heartbeat. Getting from the airport to Union Square was a matter of jumping on BART for a 30 minute ride. Could not have been easier.

review.title: Very, very pleasant experience!!
review.reviewText: We stayed at the King George on New Year's Eve, and had a great experience. The room was immaculate, cozy, and very comfy. By american standards it may seem small, but it indeed offers plenty of space, plus a big walk-in closet, and large bathroom. Staff were professional and very personable. We would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Superb
review.reviewText: I was in town for a convention at the Moscone Center, and this hotel is just a few blocks' walk away, right in the middle of downtown SF just a few steps away from a wide variety of great restaurants and two blocks from Union Square. The staff are friendly and professional and will bring you anything you need. The executive suites are immaculate, comfortable and well soundproofed if you're a light sleeper. The wifi works flawlessly. The ceilings are a bit low, as is the style for these remodeled victorian-style hotels, but a six-foot-two guy like me had no mishaps with doorframes.

review.title: small rooms
review.reviewText: i stayed in this hotel in central san francisco on a weekend between business trips. the hotel was adequate as a place to sleep and centrally located for visits to popular tourist sites in central san francisco. however, the rooms were tiny, dark and very tired in appearance. to some this might be 'quaint' but to me it was just very old-fashioned.

review.title: Cute, quaint, comfortable rooms, lousy service
review.reviewText: Great location, three blocks from Union Square one way, wouldn't walk alone in the other direction though. Dave at the front desk seemed the only one interested in customer service. Our first time in San Francisco so were looking for ideas for sightseeing, directions, etc. Concierge desk couldn't be bothered. Actually found more help in the way of activities by accident at another hotel down the street.

review.title: Excellent location
review.reviewText: The rooms are small as other reviewers had said, but we didn't need more for two nights. The location couldn't have been better. We were very pleased with our stay, we would go back.

review.title: Good location
review.reviewText: Room was dark and bathroom really small. Quality of service and welcome was appreciable. Hotel is really close of main transportations and Union Square, this is really confortable.

review.title: Great stay
review.reviewText: I read reviews of this hotel that indicated the rooms were small and or bathroom a tight squeeze. We found this hotel to be charming and priced extremely well. The boutique/european feel is evident but the rooms and bathrooms were generously sized with a walk in closet. I would definately stay here again and recomend it to others, the location was great as well as the service. The only down was that we were on the 9th floor and had to wait for the relatevely slow only elevator which could only fit about 4-5 people.

review.title: Staff nice but...
review.reviewText: This hotel is nicely redone but THERE IS NO A/C and the rooms are cramped. So if it is warm you must open the windows to the noisy streets below... and even that does not cool the room much... not to mention taking a shower with the window open to the world. It is in a great area and the staff is very helful and nice.

review.title: Cute rooms, nice hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel service was amazing! Everyone was so nice and helpful. They really went out of their way for us and offered to do things before we even asked. The decor was so nice. The room was a little smaller than I expected, but we still had plenty of room. It was so cute that it didn't really matter much anyway. The locations was great because it was so close to Union Square and all public transportation systems.

review.title: reasonably priced and comfortable
review.reviewText: Rooms are small but clean and decor is pleasant. Very reasonable. Good location.

review.title: Would definitely go back!
review.reviewText: Had seven rooms booked as part of a leadership "get-away". Everyone was satisified with their rooms (small but very well decorated and comfortable)and the proximity to Union Square was very convenient.

review.title: Great deal for the price
review.reviewText: Enjoyed my stay. There was an irate Frenchman at the counter when I checked out. He hollered about the injustice of the phone charge, but even *I* know that hotels charge you every time you pick up that receiver. Although the King George is in a bit of a shady part of Union Square, it's a great deal for the kind people at the front desk and the comfortably furnished rooms. Once inside, I was thrilled with the service.

review.title: charming and comfortable
review.reviewText: yes the rooms are small but we had an amazing view of the city, and the room was very comfortable. hotel staff was great, it is in a central location and easy to get anyway in the city,

review.title: Fantastic Location!
review.reviewText: The King George is a charming hotel (small rooms and bathroom) in a wonderful location. Chinatown, major museums, the superb Millennium (vegetarian) restaurant are within walking distance. The Mason cafe next door serves excellent fare, Staff were gracious and helpful.

review.title: nice
review.reviewText: Good price, great location and very nice rooms -- a higher class than the price would indicate.

review.title: Be prepared to pay for parking
review.reviewText: The hotel overall was very nice. The rooms were a tad bit small, The elevator seemed to take forever and it's better to pay for parking on your own. Although the parking lot is conviently located right across the street it will cost you $28.00 to park there. The hotel will validate your parking , but at a cost of $28.50

review.title: Very good hotel and a great location.
review.reviewText: Very good hotel and a great location being just a few blocks from Union Square and the theaters. Fine dinning also close by. Rooms are comfortable.

review.title: Great downtown hotel
review.reviewText: The King George hotel is located just off Union Square and within walking distance to San Francisco's excellent public transportation systems (BART, MUNI). The rooms are small as you would expect from a downtown, urban hotel. The King George is kept very clean, both in the rooms and common areas. The bathrooms (in the rooms) are a bit small, and the tile work and design show their age, but they are well maintained and are kept clean. The shower water temprature fluctuates while in use but was never uncomfortable. The lighting in the vanity area of the bathroom is a bit dim, with yellow shades. The king size bed was very comfortable and felt very new. The King George boasts an afternoon tea which you must attend at least once. Happy hour daily in their lounge (never busy). The Hotel is located next door to a 24 hour bistro which serves exellent bistro fare with good prices. The Hotel staff is very helpful and happy to do so. When asked where to eat lunch prior to checking in, we were given three excellent choices, including the Cheesecake Factory on the top floor of Macy's (1 block away). The Bell desk checked our bags for the time prior to check-in, about 2 hours and again on our day of departure after check-out for 8 hours, without hesitation. If you are planning to eat Italian, go to Franchino's. It is a small Mom and Pop place that serves the BEST pasta that I have ever had, this includes Babbo in NYC.

review.title: Not very impressed
review.reviewText: The King George was ok but nothing special. An older hotel which seems to have been renovated but the rooms were very noisy. We could hear everything going on in the hallways as well as everything going on outside. No Air conditioning in the rooms.

review.title: Small, but charming
review.reviewText: The best feature of the King George is it's staff. Everyone was welcoming and helpful. In addition the beds were very comfortable and while the room was small, it was tastefully decorated. The location was convenient for shopping, eating and all forms of transportation. It was a good value for the money. We would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Uneven
review.reviewText: We arrived at midnight after taking the late flight to find the lobby filled with some scary looking types. Many looking for a last minute room. The hotel is on the edge of Union Square and the Tenderoloin area. We went to sleep that night wondering what we had gotten into. By morning the neighborhood had cleared up and the hotel staff was friendly. Still don't expect help from the concierge. I asked about Alcatraz tickets and was told to call the company myself. He got the Muni fares completely wrong and basically offered no advice whatsoever. Upon making my own call I learned that Alcatraz was sold out but I knew some tour company would still have a spot so I asked the concierge to find me one. He promised to call around and leave me the info.. but never did. Overall - I wouldn't go back.

review.title: Great place
review.reviewText: The King George Hotel was a pretty good place to stay and I will stay in it again. The rooms were small, but the location and the price was perfect. If you aren't planning to spend time in the room, I recommend this place to all my friends.

review.title: Small, but very comfortable and quiet
review.reviewText: I couldn't believe how quiet the room was, considering it is in the heart of Union Square. But the fact that the hotel was so close to bars, restaurants, and shops made it a great location! I would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Clean and Convenient
review.reviewText: For the price paid, location to major attractions, comfort and convenience, this is a bargin! I will return to this hotel in the future. Great for either the business traveler or for those on vacation. The room is small, but clean and had all the normal amenities as other higher priced chains in the area.

review.title: Great hotel for the money
review.reviewText: For the price, I don't think you can beat the King George. Our room was small, but very clean and comfortable. Fantastic location. Only a few blocks from great shopping and the BART/MUNI station. The hotel staff was extremely nice and helpful with all of our requests/questions. The hotel does need some updating, but this did not interfer with our stay.

review.title: Wonderful Beds
review.reviewText: The beds at this hotel are just wonderful. That being said, it was in a nice location, inexpensive and very nicely decorated. Highly recommended.

review.title: Fine place to stay
review.reviewText: The room was very comfortable and there was little or no noise throughout my stay. Is very convenient to the Mall area. Reception and maintenance were very friendly and attentive.

review.title: Great location....small room.
review.reviewText: The location of the King George was great. Near all transportation stops, shopping, and dining. It was clean and staff was friendly, but the room was extremely small. It is much smaller than the hotel's virtual tour shows it to be.

review.title: was so comfortable
review.reviewText: fabulous location,good size hotel, comfortable room,bed etc - il go back for sure!

review.title: okay
review.reviewText: The location was great for downtown. The homeless problem was intences around the hotel, the alley under our room seemed to be a homelss hangout....but the staff at the hotel was aware of the issue and really tried to control the issue. The rooms are really small and the bathrooms even smaller. It was good for the price..we didn't stay in our room much. The staff very all very quick and helpful. It was okay...

review.title: Pretty Good Hotel
review.reviewText: Pros to this hotel: Good location Good rates Good service Cons: Very small rooms and beds Central A/C only - no wall units Some rooms (like mine) overlook heating and A/C units - terrible views

review.title: A great place to stay!
review.reviewText: We were on the 8th floor, kept the window open the whole time--but noise was at a minimum. Small rooms--it's an old hotel! But great place--in the middle of everything. Staff are friendly and helpful. We left our luggage with them for hours and got it easily. Don't bring a car, you don't need it and it is expensive to park. My only complaint is that the only grounded plug was in the bathroom, which made plugging in my laptop difficult (but internet access was fast and easy...)

review.title: Excellent Value
review.reviewText: The room was smsll but clean and comfortable. "Air conditioning" is via open window. The Union Square area is quite noisy at night with a lot of hollering, sirens, and mortocycle revving noise - so bring ear plugs!

review.title: Small rooms and cheap fixtures but clean.
review.reviewText: I was not impressed. The room I was in was VERY small. There was no part of the queen-sized bed that was more than two feet from a wall. I'm 6'3" tall and navigating the bathroom was uncomfortable. The wallpaper in the bathroom was poorly installed and pealing in places. The fixtures in the bathroom (toilet, sink, etc.) were cheap and poorly installed. The room was, however, well cleaned every night. This was my first time in San Francisco so this may be par for the course at the price I paid. The location was great. Close to everything you would want to be close to. The staff was very helpful and the lobby was clean and comfortable. I can see how some people might find this hotel cozy and quaint. But not me.

review.title: reasonable, good location, great staff
review.reviewText: I liked this small hotel, this was my second visit. My daughter enjoyed it too. Rooms are small,like a European hotel. Nicely furnished, pillows are like rubber though. Nice and helpful staff, great location. CLose to Union Square, shopping, resturants, theaters, clubs. Good prices.

review.title: Doesn't look like internet photos
review.reviewText: The King George has a great location, friendly and knowlegable staff, but the rooms are very small, the bathroom tiny with mildew in the shower, the heater was broken, and the window did not close completely or latch.

review.title: Great Location.
review.reviewText: Great price for the location of this Hotel. So close to Union Square, Theatres, and Restaurants. Very easy also to get to BART and Muni. Staff very nice and helpful.

review.title: Very impressed
review.reviewText: We were very impressed with the hotel. It was exactly as the pictures show. The rooms were beautiful and I loved the fluffy comforter on the bed and the throw blanket to cuddle up in. The staff was friendly and helpful. Super location, too. I'd jump at the chance to stay here again. It would be at the top of my list.

review.title: Nice Staff but......
review.reviewText: The hotel is clean with a really nice staff. Once your in the lobby your going to wonder why this isn't a four star hotel. Once you get to the tiny room you'll know why. Other than the size of the rooms I was happy with the location, staff, and the historic look.

review.title: European feel
review.reviewText: We really liked this hotel. The bath is a little tight in one spot, which is common in some quaint hotels in Europe. The price was great for the area as well - you can pay more or less, but I would definitely go back.

review.title: Great Location! Friendly People! Looking Forward to Going Back!
review.reviewText: Clean....friendly.....central to everything! A perfect San Francisco Hotel....and we will recommend it to all of our friends!

review.title: average
review.reviewText: my room was a little noisy because of thin walls great location near union square

review.title: Great location, great price, very small room
review.reviewText: This hotel has a great location close to Union Square shopping, theaters, and many great restaurants. The hotel was clean but shows its age. Our room on the 2nd floor was much smaller than the room shown on the virtual tour on Expedia. It served our purpose, but I'm sure that others would find it a bit constricting. The bed was comfortable and the room was in good shape. There is no A/C, but there is a ceiling fan that was put to use. Recommend trying the small bar for happy hour every evening. Beer and wine only. We would stay again because of the reasonable price and the great location.

review.title: no hot water x 2 days
review.reviewText: water pump broke. no shower x 2 days. and sink very dirty at check in. but price reasonable for this area. get what you pay for.

review.title: Great Small Hotel
review.reviewText: I've stayed here before and it suits me fine. Good location. Clean. If you like small but comfortable hotels, this one's great.

review.title: Close to everything
review.reviewText: Great location, friendly staff

review.title: impressive
review.reviewText: the decor was beautiful, the service good, nice bar, small rooms but very cozy.Be prepared to pay an extra $25 per day for parking at the garage across the street, the hotel has none of its own parking.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: I was not impressed with the service at this hotel. The amenities were not great either. They cleaned the room and took the towels and glasses but did not replace them. We had to call down and have them brought up. Also, they tried to bill us twice. We had already pre-paid through expedia and they tried to charge us again when we checked out.

review.title: Have enjoyed staying at the King George for many years!
review.reviewText: the best thing about the King George is location, location, location; one block from Union Square; adjacent to the Theater Section and yet you get the feel of being remote from the hub bub and noise of downtown. As an older hotel making adjustments to keep up todate, I found the tub shower a little funky; the valves to control the water are at the opposite end of the tub from the shower head; a grab bar would be nice to hold on to.

review.title: not impressed
review.reviewText: i booked this hotel via expedia.com call center. i don't want to stay this hotel again. Only one good thing is free high speed internet. No coffee maker, too short bed....

review.title: The City's little European hotel.
review.reviewText: The type of hotel you would find in Europe, small and well maintained. Attractive and charming, but not "over the top". Friendly staff willing to help with your every need.

review.title: Nice hotel with great location
review.reviewText: Room was a little small, but for the price and location, it was worth it.

review.title: Hole in the wall
review.reviewText: Tiny rooms. No honor bar. No internet services. OK for the price but next year I'll stay elsewhere.

review.title: Good for the price
review.reviewText: The hotel was in a great location right in the heart of Union Sqaure.  It is a little bit small but for the price, I think you do get what you pay for.  The room was clean and comfortable.  There is a little bit of noise from the radiator but it wasn't too loud.  I wouldn't recommend it if you plan on spending a lot of time within the hotel but it's fine if you're planning on touring the city and just need a comfortable place to crash.

review.title: Nice place, great price, small rooms
review.reviewText: Stayed for 5 days, very comfortable room, nice place, great location to Union Square, Moscone Convention Center, food, etc.  The room is great for 1 or maybe 2 people, but they are very small.  Would stay here again, because the price is reasonable for the area.

review.title: disillusioned
review.reviewText:
room with single king size bed was very small.
the room looked a lot bigger on the virtual guide.
bathroom was very small and the only mirror was a tiny one in the bathroom.

review.title: Conveniently located
review.reviewText: The hotel is located in the heart of the city, tehrefore, I do reccomend it. The atmosphere is very cozy and the lobby is cool. The rooms are nice and romantic but very very small.

review.title: Comfortable, good location, good price, small room
review.reviewText: If you don't mind the room and bathroom being on the small side, this was a nice hotel for a decent price.  The location is great, the furnishings were good quality.  Downsides are that the bathroom was tiny, the TV didn't have a great picture, and the heat couldn't be controlled (so it got a little warm.)

review.title: Awful
review.reviewText: The rooms are tiny, especially the bathroom. Fixtures in the bathroom are old. Tile grout nasty. Hotel was extremely loud. Check-ins in the middle of the night with no consideration for other guests trying to sleep. And, staff was unapologetic. Would not recommend and definitely never return.

review.title: Entertainment
review.reviewText: The live entertainment at the lounge was really bad.  It would been better to play a good jazz music (CD) rather than a bad jazz music.  I would not call that a jazz.

review.title: Overall - very decent.
review.reviewText:
Small rooms but not bad value.  
Nice lounge.
Very good location.

review.title: King George Hotel
review.reviewText: I would suggest staying in a room above the 2nd or 3rd floor.  I had a wonderful view of a wall.  The 24 hr business center is handy for checking e-mail, etc.  Very close to everything downtown.  The lobby is lovely.  The staff were very helpful and polite.

review.title: King George Hotel stay
review.reviewText: This is a nice little hotel in the heart of San Francisco. I really enjoyed the friendly staff who gave great directions & recomondations. It was very close to walk to all the shopping & Union Square,Cable Cars & BART system. It made our trip easy & fun.

review.title: BAD HOTEL
review.reviewText: worn-down furniture with cigarette burns, dirty blanket, human hair on sheets, shower curtain dirty, room crowded, no screen to window, toilet paper and kleenex not replaced, fire alarm drill done without notifying guests early sunday morning, service desk short and rude, concierge seldom present. during a 5 day stay saw him once (the day we left). transients in front of hotel following you as soon as you exited.
